story:
Hi there! I am Uhma

I might look like just another mask, but I am nothing like them. I am the first “human proof” mask!

Yes, you heard that right - “human proof”. I am the only mask that protects you regardless of what you do with me. The only thing you have to do is wear me. 

At last, the breakthrough you have been hoping for - safety and peace of mind to continue your daily life - is within reach... 

Why am I so enthusiastic about it? Let me explain.

 

Key Features

Choose the one that fits you best

 

With all this, please take into consideration my final word...

 

I know everyone is craving for normality. My purpose is to help you live your life without further constraints or worries. Since I will be clean at all times, I will decontaminate everything that touches my surface… Assuring you and your loved ones will always be protected.

See you soon, 

Uhma

PS: You can also visit me at:

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/uhmaaccessories
  • Website (coming soon): www.uhmamask.com
  • instagram: https://www.instagram.com/uhmaaccessories/

 

What else you need to know...

 

* Prices do not include taxes and VAT outside the EU. It will be subject to the laws and regulations of each individual country.

** We use customs friendly shipping and we ship worldwide.

story:
Our Founder 

Hello- I’m Dr Charles Call, founder and CEO of CleanSpot Technologies.

Over the past three years, my team has developed a novel antimicrobial coating technology and applied that to our first product, a premium hand sanitizer made with natural ingredients.

 

We have completed the research in our laboratory to prove the effectiveness of this patent-pending technology. We have evidence that unlike other hand sanitizers, our product continues to protect after it has been applied. But we need your help to fund the clinical tests to validate the persistence of the sanitizer.

Our premium product: 

  • Is formulated from natural ingredients
  • Incorporates beeswax; a superior moisturizer not found in ANY other hand sanitizer
  • Is packaged for an active lifestyle
  • And will be conveniently delivered directly to your mailbox

 

Our bottles fit conveniently in pockets!

 

And even in these pockets!

 

More on Our Product

The key ingredients in ActiveClean are ethanol, which kills the bacteria, and beeswax, which adds a moisturizing quality to the formula. Other ingredients include essential oils of lemon and peppermint oil, apricot seed oil and vitamin E. 

To apply, just spray on your hands from our convenient pocket sized bottle, and rub those hands together! Nice job showing that bacteria who's boss!

 

Spray, rub, done!

 

Our Story/CleanSpot

You know those companies that had overnight success stories? That's not us. We've spent  years working on creating the best hand sanitizer.

Our team has developed and commercialized advanced technology for sample of highly infectious organisms for almost 20 years. We started out as a spin-off company of the University of New Mexico and after a couple of major pivots, we ended up with our own company, a great team, and some great ideas.


CleanSpot team at our Launch Party 

 

What our Customers have to Say

When we presented at One Million Cups and at experienceIT by the NM Tech Council in Albuquerque, we asked the audience to try our product and post to Twitter what they thought of it.

The team at One Million Cups

The following were their responses (FYI: Thanks everyone for the great input!):

  • "Other formulas leave your hands dry, but not yours (ActiveClean)" - Chad B.
     
  • "Just used @actvclean and it left my hands smooth and silky, not just clean! #activeclean" - Tamara T. 
     
  • "With 3 kids I'm a fan of @actvclean sanitizer: keeps working after you put it on + packaging is genius. Great talk at @1MillionCupsABQ!" - Erin O.
     
  • "Natural product, convenient packaging, online delivery. I'm a fan. #launchIT #experienceITnm" - Annamarie H.
     
  • "@actvclean hand sani made with natural ingredients, #beeswax base is going to disrupt the market from #ABQ! #homegrown #experienceITnm" - Amanda G.
 

 

A Little About Those "Other" Hand Sanitizers

Many hand sanitizers contain some pretty serious chemicals in their "Other Ingredients" section. One example is benzophenone-4. This chemical may lead to allergic contact dermatitis and other skin irritations.  We suggest you try ours instead! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your support!

$1 Give us a HAND

We love you! Thank you for helping us toward our goal! When you back our project, you're creating a healthier world, one dead germ at a time.

 

$5 The Test Drive

You'll receive 1 bottle of ActiveClean. We think you'll love our product and you're going to want more!  WARNING: Say goodbye to your other products, this will be the last hand-sanitizer you'll ever want to use.

 

$10 Charter Member

YOU ARE AMAZING! For backing our campaign, you will receive a 3 pack of ActiveClean Premium Hand Sanitizer and a private invitation to become a Charter Member. 

As a Charter Member, you will receive:

  • Early access to new products
  • The opportunity to be part of our beta testing team for new products
  • Not to mention you are making the world a healthier place, one dead germ at a time!

 

 

$50 ActiveWellness 10 Mo

A 10 month supply (30 bottles) of ActiveClean delivered monthly to your door. Also includes Charter Membership, and our ActiveClean T-shirt. This is our best deal!

 

 

$100 ActiveWellness 12-mo

A 12 month supply (36 bottles) of ActiveClean delivered monthly to your door, Charter Member T-shirt and private invitation to become a Charter Member for your entire family to receive special offers, early access to new products and opportunity to be part of our BETA testing team for new products

 

$250 ActiveWellness Small Business

Your clients will love you! 
150 bottles of ActiveClean with Your clients will love you! 
150 bottles of ActiveClean with your company logo, Charter Member T-shirt and private invitation to become a Charter Member for your entire family to receive early access to new products and opportunity to be part of our beta test team for new products.

 

$500 ActiveWellness Growth Company

Your clients will love you! 
350 bottles of ActiveClean with your company logo, Charter Member T-shirt and private invitation to become a Charter Member for your entire family to receive early access to new products and opportunity to be part of our beta test team for new products.

 

$1000 ActiveWellness Big Time

Your clients will love you! 
750 bottles of ActiveClean with your company logo, Charter Member T-shirt and private invitation to become a Charter Member for your entire family to receive special offers, early access to new products and opportunity to be part of our beta testing team for new products.

 

$5000 ActiveWellness All Star

200 boxes of custom labeled ActiveClean hand-sanitizer (2400 bottles) Your clients will love you! 
6 month supply of ActiveClean delivered monthly to your door, Charter Member T-shirt and private invitation to become a Charter Member for your entire family to receive special offers, early access to new products and opportunity to be part of our beta testing team for new products.

 

$5000 Hot Air Balloon Gondola Ride

  • Dinner with New Mexican favorite, El Pinto’s executive chef Marc Quinones – Enjoy fabulous New Mexican cuisine from this young talented chef
  • Hot Air Gondola Balloon ride with Champagne toast – New Mexico International Hot Air Balloon Fiesta

 

 

$5000 ABQ Brewery Tour

Experience ABQ Night at Tractor Brewing with Imma Star Productions. Want to experience what the ABQ brew scene is all about? How about a behind the scenes, while seeing what makes this land of enchantment so darn enchanting? Come on down to one of the biggest production breweries in town - take a tour of the back - sip on some suds that aren't out yet - then, head to the tap room for some funky music. Be amazed by some of the best word smiths in the southwest.

 

$5000 New Mexico Guided Fishing Tour

Get ready for a New Mexico themed experience. This package has been carefully selected and designed for the true New Mexico fan. You and a guest will start the weekend with an exclusive dinner with the founding Active Clean team in historic Santa Fe, New Mexico.

New Mexico Guided Fishing Tour with our founder, Chuck Call.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! This product is ready to be shipped but we need YOUR help in getting the word out. Share our campaign with your friends on social media and if you tag us on Twitter @actveclean, we will respond with a personalized video message. Yes, it's true we love social media just as much as you do! Start sharing and we'll share your projects too!

We have some awesome videos coming soon!

Interested in writing about us? Then download our press kit, feel free to email us directly at julia@activeclean.com or leave us a message if you have any other questions.

Patent-pending technology, patent-pending design.

Thank you for backing our team!

story:
FAQs

 

Why is there No Fluoride in WITH MY toothpaste?

While Fluoride the chemical is definitely effective in preventing caries, it does carry some side effects. For example, in Korea, toothpastes with fluoride CANNOT be used in infants due to health reasons. And in the U.S., toothpastes with Fluoride have Warning and Call Information to Poison Control Centers. This is not to say Fluoride itself is dangerous. When used at the right amount, in the right method, it is a VERY beneficial substance. However, we do understand that a lot of children (and even adults!) swallow toothpastes (even when we are SO sure we spit it all out!). Also, in order for fluoride to be effective, it needs to be in touch with your teeth for a bit longer than 2 minutes. That's why we are in the works of developing a natural rinse with fluoride in it. That way, YOU have the choice. Lastly, although there are exceptions, in most cases, as a dentist, I personally believe it is actually your diet, brushing habits, and regular visits to the dentist that will keep your smile bright and healthy! We want YOU to have the rights and the choices!

 

Is Foam Bad?

How does your morning OJ taste after brushing your teeth? Not so pleasant is it? That's because SLS (Sodium Lauryl Sulfate) and SLES (Sodium Laureth Sulfate)--the foaming agents in most toothpastes--numb down parts of your taste bud. Yup, every time you're brushing away with rich foam, you are numbing your tongue. Not only that, those foaming agents are actually quite strong detergents, and will dry your saliva out--leaving it more susceptible to Candida yeast and other bacteria. Saliva is crucial in keeping a healthy mouth. Also along with Cinnamon, SLS and SLES can trigger aphthous ulcers!

 

What is EWG?

EWG stands for Environmental Working Group. They are the leading non-profit organization which works to "protect human health and environment". The EWG reviews international regulations regarding over 10,000 cosmetic ingredients and informs and verifies ingredients and products regarding its safety. 

 

What is PETA?

PETA stands for People for Ethical Treatment of Animals. They are the world's largest animal rights organization. If you have seen ads featuring celebrities who stand for animal rights, and also videos that expose the cruelty behind leather products and lab tests, it's very likely they were from PETA. PETA reviews and takes registrations for Cruelty-Free and Vegan companies.

 

Why Would Toothpaste Need to be Vegan?

We at WITH MY believe that IF there is an alternative, there really is no need to use animal products and by-products. And since cosmetic ingredient derived from animals are usually by-products, we believe it's also safer and cleaner for us as well.

 

Are Your Products Available Off-line?

We do have off-line retailers only in South Korea at the moment. With the success of this campaign, we will be able to expand our retailer network overseas! So Please support us! :)

 

What is it Made of?

Our toothpaste ingredients are: Organic Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Extract, Punica Granatum (Pomegranate) Extract, Artemisia Vulgaris (Mugwort) Extract, Pistacia Lentiscus (Mastic) Oil, Chaenomeles Sinensis (Quince) Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf (Green Tea) Extract, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Extract, Paeonia Suffruticosa (Peony) Root Extract, Chamaecyparis Obtusa (Hinoki) Oil, Eucalyptus Globulus Leaf Oil, Xylitol, Sorbitol, Aqua, Chamomilla Recutita (Chamomile) Extract, Perilla Frutescens (Sesame) Leaf Extract, Sodium Methyl Cocoyl Taurate, Menthol, Sodium Bicarbonate (Baking Soda), Stevioside, Cellulose Gum, Organic Calendula Officinalis Extract, Hydrated Silica, Tocopheryl Acetate, [and Mentha Virdis (Spearmint) Oil, Melaleuca Alternifolia (Tea Tree) Oil for Spearmint toothpaste / Citrus Medica Limonum (Lemon) Oil, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Oil for Lemonade toothpaste]

Our soap ingredients are: Organic Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Aqua, Sodium Hydroxide, Oenothera Biennis (Evening Primrose) Oil,  Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil, Olea Europaea (Olive) Oil, Persea (Avocado) Gratissima, Hippophae Rhamnoides (Sea Buckthorn) Fruit Oil, Theobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Seed Butter, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea Butter), Vitis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, Tocopherol, Anthemis Nobilis (Chamomile) Flower Oil, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil, Rosa Damascena (Rose) Flower Water, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus (Lemongrass) Oil.

 

How Do I Use It?

It's no different from regular toothpaste in regards to use! Just expect a lot less foaming, and sweet sweet tasting OJ and fruit after use! :)

 

Can Newborns Use it?

Well yes. HOWEVER, we recommend using regular water or coconut oil to brush you newborn baby's teeth until about 2 years of age. Most infants don't get a lot of plaque on their teeth so toothpaste is not a necessity. At the infant stage, the most common cause of cavities is 'baby bottle syndrome'--since most people use formula and milk (which has sugar) in baby bottles, by letting your infant suck on it while sleeping, you're creating an environment ripe for cavities. Yikes!

 

Your Goal is 30,000 Bricks, the Goal $$ Seems Low?

Wow, you are very observant! So yes, In order to provide 30,000 we need to raise about $12,000. However, by setting a lower fixed funding goal, we can guarantee to have funds to give back--and every little bit counts! By raising $2000, we will be able to provide 5000 bricks. Even if we raise less than $12,000 via our Indiegogo campaign, WITH MY will continue to work on building the entire kindergarten. The entire project will actually cost roughly $100,000. So our ultimate goal IS to provide 30,000 bricks--and more! :)

 

When Will You Start Shipping?

As we write this, we are almost complete with prototyping and will go into manufacturing! Ideally we will start shipping the rewards out about 2 weeks into the project, and every 2 weeks following. International shipping will take about 10 days to arrive. However, things don't always go the way we plan, so please keep an eye out for our updates! :)

 

Do You Ship Internationally?

Why Yes! However, the cost and time required may vary depending on where you are!

 

Is WITH MY a Non-Profit?

WITH MY is a social venture--kind of like a hybrid between non-profit and for-profit. In short, we are a FOR Profit company with a social purpose. Our number one mission is not to 'make more profit'. Our number one mission is the provide tasteful and mindful daily essentials that you will want to buy even if they don't give back--but they just happened to do so! We want 'giving back' to become a part of your daily routine! Your Choice Matters. So, share WITH MY goods!

 

Thank you for coming all the way down here! :)

If you already have enough toothpaste stocked up, please consider sharing our campaign!!

story:
Our Story

Hi everyone, I have been married for 16 years and have tried every fertility treatment I could afford. I am to a point in my life where I have no other option as to try IVF which I cannot afford. I have looked around and see there are many people out there in the same situation. I know you must be looking at this saying oh another person. Well I don't want to go into debt as i'm sure there are going to be expenses down the road and don't want to use all my resources and then not have any. My husband and I were told our only option is IVF and need to do it as possible because time is running out. I got pregnant 10 years ago and lost the baby at 8 weeks and then I fell pregnant again in July of last year, but lost that baby at 12 weeks. During this time we have adopted a few kids out of foster care. They are special needs and are older now. I love them to death,but they are alot of work and have needs. Now that they are older my husband and I would love so much to have a child that I could carry. I so want to have that experience that I have wanted for as long as I can remember. I am so sick of always being hurt,sad and jealous everytime I hear the words "Guess what?, I'm pregnant". I have to put on my happy face and tell them congratulations when really i'm torn inside and want to break down and cry. I am happy for them, but can't understand why I can't get pregnant. I am hoping that you can see it in your hearts to please help me out with my dream. I am hopeing to earn enough money that I can do IVF and after I have a successful pregnancy I want to award some needing couple with the remaining money to help them on their journey to have a family.


The Impact

If I can't raise any money then I don't think i'll ever get the chance to have a baby and feel that empty feeling I have. I am also hoping to show that there are ways to get help when really needed and to be able to help others in the same situation as me. You will always be in my heart and prayers. I will probably never meet you in person, but you'll always be family!!


What We Need & What You Get

All of the money I raise will go towards my IVF. 

The in vitro fertilization costs will range from around $10,000 to $15,000. Much of the cost will depend on how many cycles or placements of the embryo are needed, to achieve a successful pregnancy.

Women must take hormones prior to the first cycle, to prepare the uterus for implantation. (So, there are additional fees for medications and office visits or consults.)

A couple may also consider time lost from work, for the procedure and clinic visits, as an added expense.

 

I don't have much to give, but I am a great baker and I love crafts. I have sold many bows and hats and won baking competitions. So I'm going to offer those as my perks for those that are so willing to help me in this time of need.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word and ask others  to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Also please share my page!!

story:
In December my sister was hit by a car being driven by an underage driver who had stolen her parents car.

She was left with concussion, a broken hand, a broken arm, severe road rash and a detached patella. When she was first hit because of the road rash on her arm she was required to travel to Truro Hospital a minimum of twice a week in order to have her arm cast taken off, have the wounds underneath cleaned and then have the cast replaced, which is a £75 round trip in a taxi as she is unable to drive with her injuries. Unfortunately after a few weeks in a cast it was found that it had not set properly so she underwent an operation to have her radius re-broken, and to have a metal rod inserted in the bone to have it re-set. She is also in a full leg brace and has to regularly have fluid drained from her knee, and doctors are unsure when she will be able to start receiving treatment on her leg as they are still waiting for the swelling to go down.

My sister's predicaments are currently as follows:
- Martina is unable to work as a result of her injuries, and has been informed by her workplace that she isn't entitled to statutory sick pay so currently has no income.
- As the girl driving the car was underage and uninsured, Martina is unable to claim any compensation as there is no insurance company to claim against, and she is not entitled to sue either the girl, as she is under 16, or her parents as legally they are not considered to be responsible
- Although Martina has been working solidly since she was 18 years old, she has been informed that she is not entitled to claim any benefits, disability allowance or living allowance as she has been living in Canada for the last two years.

This means that although Martina has been paying taxes since the age of 18, and was run over through no fault of her own, she is not entitled to any financial support from either the government or the individual who hit her with a car. She is now in a position that she will be unable to pay her rent or travel costs to the hospital as she has used her savings to pay for these so far.

For these reasons I am currently trying to raise as much money as possible in order to help Martina pay for her physiotherapy treatment, travel to and from the hospital, and anything remaining to help to compensate her for loss of earnings and help her pay for her living costs and rent. Any amount, however small, will make a massive difference to Martina and Kieran's lives and will really help her to make a speedy recovery.

story:
For those of you who don't know Austin he's a son a brother, a partner and a friend and as a transguy is uninsured for the bulk of his health care needs. Austin is an extraordinary person, when we met he was volunteering nights as a rape crisis counsellor, and spening the rest of his time brightening the lives of those around him. He has dreams of working in psychology or security but for the moment is working hard to make ends meet.  He now voulnteers his extra time with children of displaced/homeless households. He's a stand-up guy with a big heart who will do big things but for the moment he needs our support. Austin's surgery is scheduled for the end of February at Baystate Hospital in Springfield. We hope to reach our fundraising goal of 3,000 dollars by the beginning of the month. 
 

What We Need 

Austin has been saving for this surgery for some time but he is still severall thousand dollars short of his goal. The overall cost of the surgery, anesthesia, tissue testing panel, and overnight hospital stay is 8,500. Thanks to generous donations from Austin's friends and family we raised 1,500 already at our Operation Celebration Burlesque show! A three thousand dollar deficit remains, help us close the gap and give Austin a new chest!

The Impact

Why it's important to support individual transition efforts: Healthcare providers have deemed care for gender transition elective and unneccesary. Helping an individual reach their funding goals for surgery is a not only a sign of solidarity but demonstrates the power of the community to support indiviuals who have been marginalized by flawed public policy.

What You Get

  • An issue of Original Plumbing Trans Male Quartely/ OP T-shirt/ "Nobody Knows I'm a Transsexual Bumper Sticker""

Original Plumbing documents diversity within trans male lifestyles through photographic portraits and essays, personal narratives and interviews. We  feel that there is no single way to sum up what it means to be a trans man because we each have different beliefs, life experiences and relationships to our own bodies."http://www.originalplumbing.com

 

  • Hand printed Belt from Project TransAction

"Project TransAction is proud to offer uniquely handmade screen printed               leather belts and other accessories. PT is an eco-conscious, artist driven independent  leather and screen-printing pursuit with roots in Boston, MA and Oakland, CA.  Established with a focus on sustainability and superior quality in 2006, TransAction  fuses traditional leathercraft and printmaking with innovative design to meet the  needs, personalities, and imaginations of the customer." http://www.etsy.com/shop/ProjectTransAction

 

  • Trans Heart Patch or "I killed Jenny Schecter" Pin 

Check out Olivia's other sexcellent creations at http://www.etsy.com/shop/itwasme

 

  • Pink First Aid Kit courtesy of Austin and Kelly filled with swag from Oh My Sensuality shop in Northampton.

**WARNING THE FOLLOWING LINKS ARE NSFW**

  • DVDs from Trannywood Pictures, San Francisco's own transmale adult video house    

   "We are a small San Francisco based, safe sex, educational and porn production company bringing together a diversity of trans and other queer men. We believe men are hot. After all, we are men who have sex with men. Our models are in various points in their transition, and we support guys who don’t want or plan on being on hormones or don’t want any surgery, as well as those who do. Thus, our films have diverse men with diverse body types.We are creating porn that presents safer sex practices as the norm but within a harm reduction model. What does that mean? People need to make informed decisions on what they do. In general, that means barriers are best, but it also means if you are sexually active, you should get tested for STDs and HIV on a regular basis. Here in San Francisco, we advocate men getting tested for syphilis every three months and HIV every six months. We also encourage people to get vaccinated for Hepatitis A and B. Learn more on our safe sex page."

http://www.trannywoodpictures.com

  • Buck Angel's award winning FTM porn documentary: Sexing the Transman

"Sexing the Transman is a groundbreaking mainstream documentary about FTM sexualities. Buck Angel elicits intimate, in-depth conversations with transmen and those who love them—about how their bodies, sexualities, and identities are affected by the medical and social processes of gender  transition.The film highlights how transitioning can open up a greater sense of freedom, desire, and willingness to explore new types of pleasure. It includes interviews with Margaret Cho, who discusses her identity as a queer bottom attracted to masculinity; and FTM comedian Ian Harvie, who reflects on his dysphoria and how his relationship with his body and his sexuality has changed post-transition."

http://sexingthetransman.com/

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, we understand. One thing you can do instead is send Austin a get-well card for a post-surgery cheer.

Austin Guilmain

90 Florence Rd.

Florence, MA

01062

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I humbly present the following on behalf of my  lifelong friend's older sister....I could not think of anything better than to get this word out. It is a tragic situation but one that every little bit will help to get them through this rough time. At the very least, please pray for them, for healing and peace .....and pass the word, please! 

Fran is a single Mom born in 1953 and has struggled all her life to raise her only son Robert (born 7/7/1994) on her own.   She is a recovering alcoholic for the last 29 years but has gone back to school and has earned her AA. After a life of retail and waitressing, she is currently in school trying to get her medical transcription certificate so that she can better provide for herself and Robert.   Robert’s father  comes in and out of his life but has never been a stable influence or consistently been able to provide monetarily . 

 

Robert was diagnosed with a malignant brain tumor called “Medulloblastoma on 5/17/12.  Because of his age, it is a pediatric type of tumor located in the cerebellum, the part of the brain that controls balance and other complex motor functions.  It is the most common malignant central nervous system tumor in children and accounts for 15-20% of all pediatric brain tumors.  There are about 500 cases of medulloblastoma each year in the US. Sadly, this has caused him to miss his senior year of high school, a time that should be filled with fun and hope for the future.....

 

He went into surgery and had most of the tumor removed on 5/20/12. It was 4cm X 5cm.   They could not remove all of the tumor for fear they would do permanent brain damage or worse.   At that time she was told the tumor was benign, but was told later it was indeed malignant Medulloblastoma.   The good news was what that it had not metastasized, the bad news is that after all radiation and chemo, the treatment can cause significant endocrinological, hearing and intellectual difficulties.  After surgery, because of the location of the tumor, the surgeon was amazed that he could even write. Previously,  he tended to be a little clumsy and not as eloquent with speech or good at reading.  Right after the surgery he was talking and able to express himself better than he has ever been able to in his life, sounding like a different person! He told his Mom he was so happy he could express himself. Sadly, chemo has taken its toll on this. 

He had radiation for 6 weeks which did shrink the remaining tumor but did not eliminate it.  Chemotherapy  began at the end of August.  He will continue the chemotherapy for one year.  At the end of this time they will do another MRI and determine whether or not the tumor has been eliminated completely or just stopped growing.  From there he will go in every few months at first to ensure the tumor has stopped growing.

 

Interestingly, this began nearly two years ago when Robert was riding his bicycle on the sidewalk and was hit by a vehicle driven by a drunk driver.  After this accident, he was having pain in his body and headaches.  The body pains eventually subsided, but he was still getting the headaches sporadically.  Then almost a year to the date of this accident, he was in another accident as the passenger in a vehicle.  After this, he started getting severe headaches and starting missing a lot of school.  Fran took him into the ER several times and was told he needed to just take some medication.  The headaches got so bad that he could not even hold his head up. Fran took him back to the ER again and insisted that they take an x-ray.   That was when it all started to fall apart and make sense at the same time.  The x-ray showed something. They did a Cat scan and MRI and found the tumor in the cerebellum.  The Doctor later said that the 2nd car accident may have helped save his life because it probably relocated the tumor enough so that his headaches were even more severe. 

 

Fran has been receiving about $800.00 a month from Social Security since Robert’s father is now retired and has been living on that and her student loans.

story:
Thank you all for your support so far! We have now reached our initial target, which covers a few months of treatment and medication for Jalal's dad.  Given however that the treatment for cancer can be highly prolonged and unexpected, we are now doing our best to overreach our initial goal. 


Jalal Qanas is a PhD student at the University of Leeds.  He is from Syria, living away from his country for the last eight years.  His family is still in Damascus. 

A few weeks back, Jalal’s dad, Bahjat, 63, was diagnosed with lung cancer, stage 3.  While such news would be devastating for anyone receiving them, for Bahjat and his family is even worse.  Living in a country that is now suffering under the 5th year of a severe war, with a completely destroyed social fabric and an annihilated economy, healthcare provision comes to be an item of luxury.  Treatment is not available on a permanent basis, while patients need to purchase the necessary drugs themselves.  In face of such a reality, Bahjat finds himself in a highly distressed financial situation.  Himself retired, earning £50 a month, and with no other source of income in the family, he needs some support so as to cover part of his treatment’s cost.

For the time the cancer is detected in Bahjat’s left lung and has not started spreading around yet.  Hence, the necessary treatment for now involves chemotherapy and radiation.  While the total cost depends on the advancement of the therapy, the current estimate is approximately £100 a week so as to cover the expenses for healthcare treatment and medication.  If a surgery turns out to be required, total cost will escalate much further.

What we can do: donate some money so as to help Jalal’s dad, Bahjat.  Please support as much as you feel, so as to give Jalal and his family some real hope.  The amount we gather here can have a huge impact; either in terms of facing and beating the illness, or at least by giving Bahjat some more time to live.  We would all deserve that.  So does he.

story:
My Story

My name is Amanda Sandeen - if you're reading this, it's likely you know me. I discovered Yoga about a year ago and was totally blown away by the tremendous effect it had on my body. I have chronic asthma, and have never really been able to engage in a real physical workout. I'm also very hyper-active, as any of my friends can attest. For me, Yoga is the only way I feel truly calm, and for the first time in my life, I've felt able to breathe.


The Impact

My goal with learning Yoga is to be able to work at a treatment facility much like the one the organization I currently volunteer for has. The majority of work I've done for this organization, whose name I have agreed to keep confidential (but my friends and family know, and I expect that is my audience here anyhow), has been basic office work. A large portion of what I've done with them is organizing and formatting customer satisfaction surveys for the auditor. These surveys come from over 20 different facilities the organization provides funding for, from housing, to medical care, to job search assistance, and a treatment facility for people struggling with addiction. I began to see a pattern with the rehab surveys - people on lock down for weeks on end with nothing to do but play cards. They praised the staff at the facility, and the only real complaint was they weren't allowed to go outside, and had no resources to exercise while in the building. I'd like to become a teacher at a Yoga studio and donate my spare time to volunteer at a local rehab facility that serves a homeless or poverty stricken population.


What We Need & What You Get

Yoga Teacher Training in New York costs roughly $5000 including course materials. I'm aiming to take fall training classes, but if I reach my financial goal in time for the spring course, that would be a dream! I don't expect to reach my goal entirely from this website, but I have put the total cost as my goal so folks can follow my progress, and I can keep track as well. I expect to work along the way and pay for the bulk of it myself, but any assistance I can garner would be much appreciated.


Other Ways You Can Help

Take yoga!  Any type of yoga promotes good health and harmony with others.  If you've seen my campaign please help spread the word.  If you donate, post on Facebook, Twitter or any other social network that you're involved with.  Give what you can.  Any amount is greatly appreciated.  Thank you for your time and your generous donations.  Namaste.
story_txt:
My Story
My name is Amanda Sandeen - if you're reading this, it's likely you know me. I discovered Yoga about a year ago and was totally blown away by the tremendous effect it had on my body. I have chronic asthma, and have never really been able to engage in a real physical workout. I'm also very hyper-active, as any of my friends can attest. For me, Yoga is the only way I feel truly calm, and for the first time in my life, I've felt able to breathe. 


The Impact
My goal with learning Yoga is to be able to work at a treatment facility much like the one the organization I currently volunteer for has. The majority of work I've done for this organization, whose name I have agreed to keep confidential (but my friends and family know, and I expect that is my audience here anyhow), has been basic office work. A large portion of what I've done with them is organizing and formatting customer satisfaction surveys for the auditor. These surveys come from over 20 different facilities the organization provides funding for, from housing, to medical care, to job search assistance, and a treatment facility for people struggling with addiction. I began to see a pattern with the rehab surveys - people on lock down for weeks on end with nothing to do but play cards. They praised the staff at the facility, and the only real complaint was they weren't allowed to go outside, and had no resources to exercise while in the building. I'd like to become a teacher at a Yoga studio and donate my spare time to volunteer at a local rehab facility that serves a homeless or poverty stricken population.


What We Need & What You Get
Yoga Teacher Training in New York costs roughly $5000 including course materials. I'm aiming to take fall training classes, but if I reach my financial goal in time for the spring course, that would be a dream! I don't expect to reach my goal entirely from this website, but I have put the total cost as my goal so folks can follow my progress, and I can keep track as well. I expect to work along the way and pay for the bulk of it myself, but any assistance I can garner would be much appreciated. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Take yoga!  Any type of yoga promotes good health 
and harmony with others.  If you've seen my campaign please help spread 
the word.  If you donate, post on Facebook, Twitter or 
any other social network that you're involved with.  Give what you can. 
 Any amount is greatly appreciated.  Thank you for your time and your 
generous donations.  Namaste.

story:
Y-Brush est un nouveau dispositif capable de vous brosser les dents en seulement 10 secondes de manière efficace. Y-Brush, qui a été développée par la société FasTeesH avec l'aide de dentistes depuis près de 3 ans, brosse les dents de manière simultanée au lieu d’un brossage dent par dent. Notre dispositif reproduit pour vous la technique recommandée par les dentistes, la méthode de Bass, et utilise des vibrations soniques, utilisées par une partie des brosses à dents électriques.
 

 

 

Un brossage efficace et sans effort 

Notre bouche est composée de 32 dents avec 3 facettes visibles (avant, arrière et dessous) soit 96 facettes à nettoyer pendant 2 minutes, soit 1.25 secondes de brossage par facette. Avec Y-Brush, chacune de vos dents sont brossées durant 5 secondes puisque le dispositif vous brosse toute les dents en même temps, soit 4 fois plus qu'avec une brosse à dents manuelle ou électrique traditionnelle.

 

La méthode de Bass

 

La méthode de Bass est un mouvement technique, recommandé par les dentistes, qui consiste à incliner la tête de la brosse avec un angle de 45° tout en effectuant des mouvements de rouleau pour éliminer au mieux la plaque dentaire et les bactéries au niveau du sillon gingival. Sur notre brosse, les poils sont déjà inclinés à 45°, il suffit de “mâcher” très doucement le dispositif pour reproduire cette méthode.

 

De nombreux tests d’efficacité déjà réalisés

Durant nos nombreux tests in vitro et in vivo, nous avons démontré que les poils en nylon étaient les plus efficaces pour l'élimination de la plaque dentaire, comparés à d'autres matériaux comme le silicone par exemple. D'autres tests ont aussi démontré que Y-Brush retire 15% de plaque dentaire en plus qu'une brosse à dents traditionnelle. Les bout des poils sont aussi arrondis pour brosser vos dents et vos gencive sans agression.

Avant de brosser avec Y-Brush

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Après avoir brossé avec Y-Brush

 

Vous pouvez même conserver votre propre dentifrice

Pas besoin d'acheter un dentifrice spécial, vous pouvez garder le votre en utilisant notre applicateur permettant de délivrer du dentifrice de partout sur notre brosse en quantité adaptée.

 

Trois modes de vibrations

Avec ses 3 modes de vibrations, Y-Brush s'adapte à votre sensibilité.

 

Une brosse flexible disponible en 4 tailles

Avec ses 4 tailles de brosse, toute la famille peut se servir de Y-Brush (2 tailles adultes, 1 taille enfant et 1 intermédiaire).De plus, la brosse est super flexible et est donc adaptable à toutes les formes de mâchoire, vous assurant aussi un confort d'utilisation à chaque brossage. En effet, la brosse nettoie une arcade de votre mâchoire : le haut plus le bas. Cela permet d’avoir une brosse très fine , non encombrante et qui évite les réflexes nauséeux.

 

Un manche qui peut être partagé

Le manche peut être partagé par toute la famille, tant que chacun garde sa brosse!

 

Des matériaux facile à nettoyer

La brosse Y-Brush est faite de matériaux compatibles avec la bouche très proche du silicone. Pour la nettoyer, il suffit de la passer sous l'eau, comme avec votre brosse à dents.

 

Un mois d'autonomie et rechargement sans fil

L’autonomie de Y-Brush est d’un mois (utilisation 2 fois par jour). Une station de rechargement vous permet de stocker le dispositif tout en le rechargeant sans fil (par induction).

Pour la nettoyer, il suffit de la passer sous l'eau, comme avec votre brosse à dents. Un mois d'autonomie et rechargement sans filL’autonomie de Y-Brush est d’un mois (utilisation 2 fois par jour). Une station de rechargement vous permet de stocker le dispositif tout en le rechargeant sans fil (par induction).    

 
Introducing

Y-Brush, the smarter auto-cleaning electronic toothbrush.
Simultaneously deep clean all your teeth with Y-Brush.
Y-Brush automatically deep cleans your teeth the way dentists recommend them to be cleaned in just 10 seconds using sonic vibrating technology.

 
See How It Works :


 
 

 

Y-Brush has been meticulously engineered by dentist for the last 3+ years, creating the toothbrush of the future offering an effortless and consistent deep cleaning:

Dentist Preferred — Replicates the recommended ‘Bass Method’ of teeth cleaning with small lateral movements. 

Effortless Cleaning — Consistently cleans your teeth the way they should be using any toothpaste in 10 seconds flat, every time. 

Deeper Cleaning — Sonic vibrations power specialized nylon bristles to clean deep under your gum line, not just the surfaces of your teeth. 

Gentler Cleaning — Single sided mouthpiece in 4 sizes eliminates hard manual scrubbing the leading cause of receding gums.
 


Y-Brush employs the Bass-Method of brushing which is the American Dental Association’s (ADA) recommended technique for teeth cleaning.
 

 
The Bass method is a technical brushing movement consists in tilting the head of your toothbrush at a 45° angle while making a rolling motion that more effectively removes plaque, debris, and bacteria from deep under your gum line.
Developed and tested by dentists for the last 3 years, Y-Brush eliminates the bacteria responsible for gingivitis, periodontitis, and gum disease with features required of the Bass Method:

Bristle Size — The length and width of the bristles are calculated to reach the interdental space, the gingival sulcus and the gums.

Bristle Shape — Supple and rounded at the ends, the bristles do not damage the gums or the tooth enamel while brushing.

Bristle Movement — Consistently replicates the technical motion of the Bass Method, deep cleaning your teeth, gums and under the gum line.



Y-Brush cleans your teeth 4x longer per tooth and in a fraction of the time.
 

 
The human mouth is composed of 32 teeth with 3 visible facets (front, back and bottom), for a total of 96 "brushable" facets overall. If the recommended time for brushing is 2 minutes minimum, then mathematically this means that each tooth facet should be brushed for at least 1.25 seconds for a total of 3.75 seconds per tooth.
In just 5 seconds each for your top and bottom, Y-Brush’s mouthpieces gently brushes each facet of every tooth at once for 4x longer per tooth to provide a deeper clean then the recommended 2 minute manual brushing.


Other 10 second toothbrush systems don’t focus on the consistent cleaning experience like Y-Brush does.
 


During our in vivo and in vitro testing, we found that Nylon bristles are the most effective at removing plaque and cleaning your teeth when compared to other methods like silicone strips. Our studies found that Y-Brush device removes 15% more plaque than a conventional toothbrush!
We made our nylon bristles thinner to make it possible to clean in between your teeth and your gum line. The ends of the bristles are rounded to keep it comfortable and keep your gums safe.
Y-Brush’s patented design took over 3 years to complete. The result is a perfectly engineered toothbrush built to deliver the same cleaning consistency every time you brush your teeth. You’ll know you’re getting a better clean every time.
See the Nylon Difference:

 

 Keep the brands you love!

 
There’s no need to buy special toothpaste or liquid to use Y-Brush. Use what you know, and avoid having to pay for expensive refill packs. The included applicator tip ensures the right amount of your favorite toothpaste is used, without getting excessive.


 
 



Sonic vibration makes it easier than ever to brush your teeth.
 

 
Not all teeth and gums are the same. We built in three different settings to match your dental care needs. Those with sensitive gum lines can use the lowest setting and still use Y-Brush!
 

Go beyond cleaning the surface. 

 
Y-Brush has been developed with the help of dentists and specialists, to be the best tooth brushing device available. The bristles are inclined at a 45° angle, and their length thought out to reach and properly clean the gum and gum line.



Y-Brush will have the whole family wanting to show off their grins.
 


Y-Brush will have the whole family wanting to show off their grins. Our flexible ABS mouthpiece makes it easy to use so that brushing your teeth isn’t an uncomfortable experience. It comes in 4 different sizes (2 adult, 1 intermediary, 1 children) so that everyone in the family can get a better clean.
We built it with comfort in mind. Focusing on one side of your mouth at a time made it possible to develop a thinner mouthpiece preventing a gag-reflex and freeing up your tongue.

Tough on Plaque, Easy on You

 
Your gum lines can start to recede if you put too much pressure on the brush. While biting down on Y-Brush, you’re leaving the cleaning duty to the powerful sonic vibration and engineered bristles layout. This way you aren’t forcing your gum lines back, while still getting more than the recommended cleaning!
 



Share Y-Brush’s cleaning technology.  

 
Order Y-Brush mouthpieces and pods for everyone in your household. With it taking almost no time to brush, everyone can share the same handle. Our dock keeps mouthpieces separated to ensure that germs and bacteria aren’t shared.


The materials behind Y-Brush make it an easy to clean and care for. 

 
Y-Brush uses a food-grade silicone-like material in its mouthpiece. Clean it with running water like you would with your normal toothbrush. The handle is made with ABS, keeping the motors and battery safe from water.


 Y-Brush’s battery lasts for a full month of brushing!

 
Take it with you on trips and enjoy a clean mouth while traveling abroad. If you’re a globetrotter for work or play, you’ll be able to take Y-Brush with you. The battery holds plenty of charge to brush your teeth the recommended 2 times a day for up to 30 days.


No need to mess with messy cords: Y-Brush’s dock keeps it charged.  

 
Y-Brush’s dock keeps your counters clean with a sleek design to fit any home. Your handle will stay charged with docks for your mouthpieces to dry.

 
How To Order Y-Brush
1. Click Back this Project: Select the available reward tier you would like to pledge on the right side of the page or click here. Each backer may only make one pledge. 
2. Payment: Enter your payment information. Your payment won't be effective until the very end of this campaign. 
3. Size& Shipping Information: Don’t worry about that yet! You will get to select your Size, Color choice and submit your Shipping at the very end of this campaign.
 






 
Add On Instructions:
To add one the above options to your pledge, follow these steps:

Press the 'Manage Your Pledge' button above. If you have not pledged yet, it will say 'Back this Project'.
Increase your pledge in the 'Pledge Amount' box by the total of the add-ons you want to add.
After the end of the Kickstarter Campaign you will receive a survey that will ask you questions so that you can explain how you would like the add-on money assigned.




 



Benjamin has worked in the health-care sector for 10 years and has occupied various positions, he was an engineer at Harvard and McGill university, a project and team manager for different clinical studies, and director of operations for medical devices. Benjamin’s sector of expertise is in health development, business development and entrepreneurship.

Christophe is an engineering science doctor. He has an Industry-oriented PhD in ultrasound transducers. His sector of expertise is research and development, material science and standardization.

Alexia has a master’s degree in Communications and is specialized in Public Relations. She has worked as a strategic consultant in communications. Her sector of expertise is marketing and communications, account planning, corporate visual identity and branding.

Lucy has a master’s degree in General Management. She is the project manager for Y-Brush's crowdfunding campaign. She is in charge of marketing and communications around Y-Brush as well as international press relations.

Robin has a master’s degree in mechanical engineering with a specialization in innovation management. He works on the product development for both FasTeesH's medical device and Y-Brush.
Before the Y-Brush project started, Benjamin's early market studies showed that the dependent and elderly were the segments with the worst dental hygiene. Whether it be because of a loss of mobility or because caregivers don't have the time or the correct skills to properly brush their patients' teeth for 2 minutes each. That is why Benjamin and Christophe have also previously developed a product called FasTeesH, designed for dependent people.
The company has a strategic committee made up of dentists, doctors and a business specialist in the medical and dental sector which have accompanied and encouraged the project from its early days. Y-Brush is part of the ECAM business incubator, which has helped the team grow this project by providing technical facilities. Y-brush has also been backed up by many dentists and specialists, dental clinics, and the region for the project.
 

  
 
 
\\ \\ \\ \\ FAQ // // // //
 

If dentists recommend 2 minutes how can Y-brush clean teeth in 10 seconds?
Our innovation is based on a simple observation: a standard toothbrush head can only brush one area of the tooth at once which means brushing your teeth takes time. Since Y-Brush brushes all of your teeth simultaneously, then the whole tooth brushing process only takes 10 seconds, 5 seconds for your top teeth and 5 seconds for your bottom teeth: which is 4 times more than a regular toothbrush and more effective to thoroughly and effectively brush your teeth.
 
Why do you use nylon bristles rather than silicone strips?
With over 3 years of research and development behind Y-Brush, we have found that traditional nylon bristles are the most effective at removing plaque and cleaning your teeth. Also, the fibers we use are a lot thinner than silicone bristles, this allows them to reach and clean between teeth. Plus, adding the sonic vibration to Nylon bristles will ensure you that you are brushing your teeth efficiently.
 
Why did you make a single sided mouthpiece rather than a double sided mouthpiece?
Y-Brush is a single sided mouthpiece to ensure your comfort. Our testing found that double sided tooth brushing device run large and are complicated to fit into someone’s mouth, especially for 10 whole seconds. We made sure that when speeding up your brushing routine, that it would still be a comfortable experience.
 
How can your device work of we all have differently shaped and sized jaws?
We have 4 different sized mouthpieces to accommodate different sized mouths to fit children, teenagers and adults (2 adult sizes, 1 intermediary and 1 for children). Also, we decided to make Y-Brush a single-sided mouthpiece to make it more comfortable and natural for your enjoyment!
 
How can we choose the right size mouthpiece?
The Y-Brush team will help you to easily figure out what size mouthpiece is best for you! A simple way to determine which size is best adapted to the user’s jaw is to measure the distance between to opposite teeth, it can easily be done in front of the mirror. We will be collecting your sizes just before we send the products out to you.
 
Will this work for my children?
Yes, Y-Brush is a great choice for kids aged 4 to 12 and teenagers. We are releasing a child-sized mouthpiece made for smaller jaws, as well as a smaller adult mouthpieces that can work for growing mouths as well.
 
What color options are available?
Currently the mouthpiece that we offer is Y-Brush’s signature green. Other color options may be available in the future!
 
Do I need to purchase a specific toothpaste or can I use my own?
With Y-Brush you can use your favorite toothpaste, no matter the brand or consistency. Your Y-Brush will come with a specially design applicator that fits on regular toothpaste containers and that allows the user to use the optimal amount of toothpaste with no waste.
 
 Where do I put my Y-Brush when I am not using it?
A dock has been designed to hold the mouth-pieces when they are not in use. Dock extensions will be made available so that the whole family can have a place for their mouthpieces!
 
How do I clean my Y-Brush?
We kept it simple. Rinse your mouthpiece after every use like you would your normal toothbrush. Users can lightly stretch the mouthpiece also to rinse in between the bristles when needed.
 
How soft are the bristles?
The bristles are as soft as a regular toothbrush with soft bristles. We rounded the ends of the bristles for added comfort, this way, they aren’t too hard on your teeth or gums.
 
How often should the Y-Brush mouthpiece be replaced?
The mouthpiece should be replaced every 6 months. Replacement mouthpieces can be added on to your campaign pledge or you can purchase them at www.y-brush.com after the campaign.
 
How is the handle charged?
The Y-Brush handle can be recharged through a wireless connection between the device and the charging station (an induction charging system).
 
How long does the battery last?
When fully charged, the battery can last up to a month.
 
How long does it take to charge the battery?
The battery takes 8 hours to charge fully.
 
This is Y-Brush the same as Ama*
Y-Brush is different, our is lined with fine Nylon bristles, which are more proven to be more efficient than silicone strips! Y-Brush mouthpiece is also single-sided, which is a lot more comfortable, and won't provoke gag-reflexes.
Y-Brush has been in the making for many years, the team just decided to advertise ours once the product was finished.
 
Will I still need to floss?
Y-Brush was designed to replace the toothbrush, in order for you to save some time in your dental health routine. With this in mind, you'll still need to floss and visit the dentist on a regular basis, as recommended by dentists.

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Jay.  Myself, my wife of 21 years, and my 4 children are asking for donations to help pay for medical expenses related to my second open-heart surgery.  I was born with a congenital heart murmur.  This became life threatening 15 years ago when I was 28 years old and had my first open-heart surgery at Seton Medical Center Austin, Texas.  I had the ROSS procedure performed; a cadaver valve was involved in replacing my aortic valve.  This became life threatening again in July of this year, now 43 years old.  Not only did I have to have my aortic valve replaced again, but this time with a St. Jude mechanical valve.  Because of this, I am now on lifetime medications to thin my blood.  Not only was the valve replaced, but I also had a life threatening aneurysm on the ascending aorta of my heart which was repaired at St. Luke's Episcopal Hospital in Houston, Texas.  I had multiple out-patient procedures the week leading up to the surgery and was hospitalized for a week after the surgery.  There were no major complications other than becoming anemic and requiring a blood transfusion.  Not only was I involved in a study for the ROSS procedure 15 years ago, but I am also in two new studies for patients with aneurysms of the aorta and for molecular mechanisms of thoracic aortic disease through Baylor College of Medicine.  Not only do I have a history of heart problems, but also suffer from diabetes, high blood pressure, and high cholesterol.

The Impact

This has been a major impact in my life.  I prayed during my most recent surgery to be able to spend another Christmas with my family.  I am so glad the Lord heard my prayers.  I understand the surgery was in July, however the medical bills are now piling in.  I consented to being a patient in studies for Baylor College of Medicine, however they will not allow me to make monthly payments of what I can afford.  Rather, they are demanding payment and having their credit agency contact me on a weekly basis.  The J J Watt Foundation denied our request for a donation.  We contacted the American Diabetic Association for donation and did not receive a response.  We also contacted the American Heart Association and they do not give individual donations.  I want you to know the contribution you make today will greatly help our family and will greatly be appreciated.  I had no benefits through my employer, therefore I was not paid while off for 10 weeks recovering.  Even though I still see my physician every 2 weeks for blood work, I had to return to work not fully recovered to pay monthly expenses.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

I am asking for $10,000 to cover out-of-pocket expenses not covered by insurance.  The donations will be distributed to St. Luke's Episcopal Hospital in Houston, Texas; Baylor College of Medicine in Houston, Texas; East Texas Medical Center in Crockett, Texas; and East Texas Medical Center in Tyler, Texas.  These are for outstanding medical expenses incurred for procedures leading up to the surgery, for the actual surgery itself, and for procedures still incurring after the surgery.  For the largest single donation received, we will give away a signed drumhead by all members of the Restless Heart Band recently signed in October of this year to help raise money for my medical expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to anyone and everyone you know!

story:
Hi!  

 

My name is Liz Cates, and I’ve been learning and teaching acro with the AcroYoga Minneapolis and the Twin Cities acro community for about two years.  Having a background in a variety of styles of social dance, I know the importance of healthy, consensual, and friendly touch for our social and mental wellbeing.  Additionally, acro challenges me both physically and mentally - techniques and movements require balance and strength combined with trust and communication.  I’ve found the acro community here to be inclusive, supportive, and fun, and I want to help this community grow.  

 

This is where I need your help!  In July 2017, I intend to take the AcroYoga Montreal Level 1 teacher training in Montreal, Canada.  AcroYoga Montreal is one of the first organizations to formalize techniques and teaching of this style of partner acrobatics. Through the certification process, I will build my teaching skills and my acro yoga practice to ensure a safe and nurturing environment for acro in the Twin Cities.

 

Acro yoga has fostered drastic change in not only my physical awareness, but also my trust and connection to others.  It’s great exercise for body and soul, and I want to help provide that experience through my teaching.

 

Your generous contributions will pay solely for the price of tuition.

 

For more information about Acro Yoga:

 

Acro Yoga MPLS  http://www.acroyogampls.com/


Acro Yoga Montreal https://acroyoga.com/
story_txt:
Hi!   My name is Liz Cates, and I’ve been learning and teaching acro with the AcroYoga Minneapolis and the Twin Cities acro community for about two years.  Having a background in a variety of styles of social dance, I know the importance of healthy, consensual, and friendly touch for our social and mental wellbeing.  Additionally, acro challenges me both physically and mentally - techniques and movements require balance and strength combined with trust and communication.  I’ve found the acro community here to be inclusive, supportive, and fun, and I want to help this community grow.   This is where I need your help!  In July 2017, I intend to take the AcroYoga Montreal Level 1 teacher training in Montreal, Canada.  AcroYoga Montreal is one of the first organizations to formalize techniques and teaching of this style of partner acrobatics. Through the certification process, I will build my teaching skills and my acro yoga practice to ensure a safe and nurturing environment for acro in the Twin Cities. Acro yoga has fostered drastic change in not only my physical awareness, but also my trust and connection to others.  It’s great exercise for body and soul, and I want to help provide that experience through my teaching. Your generous contributions will pay solely for the price of tuition. For more information about Acro Yoga: Acro Yoga MPLS  http://www.acroyogampls.com/
Acro Yoga Montreal https://acroyoga.com/

story:
About this project

We, the founders of THEMAGIC5, are all swim enthusiast. We believe all swimmers deserve the best swimming experience. We want to do things differently and challenge the status quo.

To challenge the status quo, we say: One size shall fit only one. We have invented technologies, re-thought the design and production process of our product - all of this to ensure the best swimming experience for you.

By custom fitting the goggle to its owner, we have reinvented the swimming goggle. We are selling goggles that fit perfectly. They are comfortable to wear, prevent water leakage and provide the best swimming experience on the market.

Our goggles are custom fitted, but it is not all. By focusing on the following 5 key aspects we have reinvented the swimming goggle.

FITTING – The goggle will fit the exact curvature around your eyes. This way your goggle will fit you and only you. The hardness of the material that touches your face has been tested to ensure that the goggle is comfortable to wear while at the same time providing the necessary stability to keep the goggle in place.

TEMPLES – The temples on both sides of the goggle are designed to stabilize it during swim, start and push-off. The shape of the temple is designed such that it will guide the goggle into its optimal position when you put it on.

NOSEBRIDGE – The nose bridge is built in a tough material designed to stabilize the goggle. The width of the nose bridge is individually determined for you, based on the scan of your facial structures.

GLASS – In order to meet all possible conditions and preferences the lenses come in multiple color options. We advise that you choose mirror coating if you swim outdoors, but they can also be worn indoors as a fashion statement. We guarantee that you will look amazing. All our lenses are treated with the best anti-fog coating on the market.

CURVES – The curved glass provides optimal visibility while helping you to keep a correct head position. The curves form a slight angle in the glass, which makes the goggles very hydrodynamic and it significantly increases your ability to locate competitors and navigate during a race.

Getting your goggle is made easy. You can sit at home on your couch, download our app and complete the scan. The app will guide you through the scanning process, which will take less than 1 minute. When the scan is complete you can purchase your goggle, and we will start producing it immediately.

The app will be released when our crowdfunding campaign is finalized. All backers will receive a voucher code, which must be entered after the scanning process to validate your purchase from Kickstarter.

 

We have tested our goggles in collaboration with athletes who use swimming goggles every day. Among the testers are pro swimmers and triathletes as well as recreational swimmers. Our ambition has been to provide the best swimming experience for swimmers at all levels.

The feedback we received from our testers has helped us to optimize our product. 9 out of 10 testers claimed that THEMAGIC5 was better than their current goggle. It automatically becomes easier to focus on the stroke and technique without having to worry about misfitted goggles.

Our goggles are available in multiple color options. For now, you only have to decide if you want mirror or standard coating. Later, when our app is released and when you have completed the scanning process, you will choose the color.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Until now, our production has been based on a manual process, which has certain drawbacks:

  • A manual process involves the risk of human error. And since we are working with a very HIGH level of precision in order to make the goggles fit perfectly, we cannot afford such errors.
  • We are currently unable to produce at a larger scale, which means we will not be able to supply more than a few units a day. This simply makes our operations too expensive. In other words, we need to be able to scale our production.

The solution is heavy machinery, including robotic production technologies. Unfortunately, these things do not come cheap. This is why we did a KICKSTARTER campaign: To finance the last part of our production line so that we can make the world's best swimming goggle, 100% custom fitted to you and at an affordable price.

Continuing InDemand for Pre-orders. As we got successfully funded on Kickstarter (200%), we have begun the process of implementing the Robot into our production line. During this implementation process, we will take pre-orders here on Indiegogo InDemand. 
Place your perk to ensure that you are among the very first in the world to get your own Custom Fitted swimming Goggles. 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

At this stage of our project, we have:

- Proved that our technology is working.
- Tested our technology in real life
- Scanned many swimmers
- Produced many goggles that fit perfect to each individual
- Tested all aspects of our production line

Testers say that our product is superior to standard "one size fits all" swimming goggle.

Due to the above, we see limited risks associated with our project. However, there are two things that could result in slight delays:

1. Implementation of the final production hardware that will be purchased
after the KICKSTARTER campaign.
- MITIGATION: We have already leased the production hardware, which
has allowed us to test how to implement it in our production line.
Throughout the leasing period we have obtained knowledge on the
actual implementation process for the new hardware that we are
funding through KICKSTARTER.

2. Unforeseen challenges with our app when we start introducing more
people to the final test environment.
- MITIGATION: During the past months we have continuously used our
app to scan our testers and ambassadors. This means that we have
already tested the app significantly, and know that our scanning
technology is working.
