story:
We Are Healing One

Our whole-hearted intention is to simply bring healing to everyONE willing to open up and allow themselves to become the healer in their own lives. Healing One is a balanced healing establishment allowing for a passive and an active approach to healing.  Healing modalities include, but are not limited to: float tanks, infrared saunas, energy healing, massage therapy, sound therapy, yoga, flow arts, meditation and oxygen therapy.   

Chaz Allen, Head Honcho of Healing One has been doing energy healing work for the past 5 years even though he has been a healer his entire life.  He has studied many different healing modalities and art forms, as well as ways of living a healthful and balanced lifestyle.  He has always dreamed of opening up a space where healers could come practice their gift and help progress the knowledge and awareness of healing for all living things.  As the years progressed, Chaz continued his research for various healing arts and eventually discovered sensory deprivation tanks, also known as float tanks.  Not long after experiencing his first few floats did Chaz know that he had found the last piece to the healing establishment puzzle.  

Tai Jaques, Mama Monarch of Healing One is from Spring Creek, NV.  She's a holistic healer whose passions include massage therapy, herbal medicine and Paleo nutrition.  Her eclectic bodywork style blends stretching, deep tissue massage, subtle energy work, and the use of therapeutic herbs.  In her free time she loves to create Golden Monarch Herbals' products.  Her diverse studies and experiences allow her to approach each client with eyes, heart, and mind open to a variety of treatment options.  She loves what she does and is so stoked to share her gift with Healing One and the community.  


           The dream of creating Healing One is slowly manifesting into a reality...  




WHERE

Chaz and Tai have deep roots in Nevada, being raised in Elko and residing in Reno has helped them become a part of a few unique, strong communities. They feel that they should serve healing to their local communities first and foremost, sprouting here at home and then growing with time. Their first establishment will be in Reno and as time progresses, Healing One will expand by opening a healing center in Elko, NV. 


WHY

Why?! Healing is why!  Taking time to rest and recover is all part of the balance of life.  We want to do more, forget less, perform better and have it all come effortlessly.  Unfortunately, our physiology and neurochemistry often have other things in mind.  We are a body, a mind, and a soul and all three require activity and healing.  As our logo defines, with the Infinity symbol atop of the Yin and Yang...Infinite Balance is the key to an optimized life experience.

Healing is love!

Now let us talk about the hype on this sensory deprivation thing for a minute! These sensory deprivation tanks or float tanks as we like to call them are filled with water that is at skin-temperature and has enough epsom salt to allow a person to be suspended in the water, which places you in an environment where approximately 80% of the gravity we usually feel is no longer weighing down on the body. The tank is also soundproof and pitch-black, creating a space that is free of any stimulation from the outside world. This feeling of antigravity and complete deprivation of senses allows for the body, mind, and soul to rest, relax, and rejuvenate optimally. This is the most ideal resting/recovering/healing zone! And it is proven by the number of float centers that exist worldwide which is now more than 900. What’s truly impressive about float tanks is that almost every one of these benefits lasts for several days past the float itself. The longer and the more often the float tank is used, the stronger the effects become, the longer they last, and the better off someone is when they come in to float again. This creates a positive spiral of recovery and health that simply works to reinforce itself, giving people a path and a means towards a better life.

Benefits

Float Tanks: 

-Down shifts brain waves from our normal Beta frequency down into Alpha and even Theta brain waves. (Hutchisen, 1984) Theta brain waves are most commonly associated with learning and memory, REM sleep, physical activity, etc.

-Effective in helping reduce hypertension, weight, and addiction. (Borrie and Suedfeld, 1980) (Suedfeld and Baker-Brown, 1987) (Kristeller et al., 1982)

-Decompresses the muscles, joints, and spine of the body to open up and relax for proper alignment and circulation to flow through the body by lowering one's heart rate (Forgays and Belinson, 1986).

-Found to reduce general stress all the way down to the hormonal level (Turner and Fine, 1983), especially following multiple sessions. (Suedfeld et al., 1983) (van Dierendonck and Nijenhuis, 2005) Floatation therapy has also helped reduce pain in many cases. (Shafranksy, 1998) (Rogan et al., 2001)

-Enhancement to cognitive processes involved with creativity and problem solving, as well as a notable decrease in tension, depression, fatigue, and hostility. (Suedfeld et al., 1987) (Forgays and Forgays, 1992/1994) (Norlander et al., 1998) There was also an improvement in cognitive behavioral treatment in psychological disorders such  as OCD and Schyzotypal personality disorders. (Walker et al., 1994)

-After a float you feel like a cloud, not like walking on a cloud but actually being the cloud...nice and light!

Infrared Saunas:

-Detox  of chemicals & heavy metals that are stored in fat cells

-Strengthens & regenerates body organs 

-May decrease pain through stimulation

-May promote weight loss

(Hannuksela and Ellahham, 2001)


Fun Facts: 

*15 minutes of sweating in an infrared sauna eliminates as much toxic waste as 24 hours of normal kidney function.

* One of the most important times in your life to use a sauna for detoxification is when you start preparing for having a child. Both the future father and future mother should do a detoxification program before getting pregnant 

*Tests have shown that the energy output is tuned so closely to the body's own radiant energy that our bodies absorb as much as 93% of the far infrared waves that reach our skin.

These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA.  This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent disease.

Massage:

-Increases circulation

-Alleviates pain and increases range of motion

-Relieves anxiety & depression

-Decreases stress

(Field, 2014)

-Improves immune function due to increases in lymph flow and spread of endogenous immune-associated molecules (Tejero-Fernandez et al., 2014)



Yoga:

-Increases endurance, flexibility and strength (Patel et al., 2012)

-Helps relieve stress and calm the mind (Li et al., 2012)

-Reduces hypertension, blood glucose levels, cholesterol, body weight (Okanta, 2012)

-Increases proprioception, vitality, energy, resperation

Energy Healing:

-Cleansing and clearing of stagnant, negative energy 

-Boost of good, positive energy and healing towards ones intention for their life

-Reduced pain and increase in mobility (Lu et al., 2013) (Olsen et al., 2003) (Coakly and Barron, 2012)

-Reduced stress, anxiety, and depression (Thrane and Cohen, 2013) (Van Aken and Tayler, 2009) 

-Revitalizing and cleansing the Chakras 

Singing Bowls/Sound Healing Therapy:

These instruments give an almost immediate sense of peace and wholeness and when played for others as a 'sound therapy' session can awaken a deep inner stillness and the flavor of the sacred.  The power of sound, and more accurately said, the effects of frequency via sound, as demonstrated in the Indian Ragas, instrumental-based shamanism, gongs, Tibetan bowls, etc. are some of the most effective external means for consciousness shifting and some would argue, for physical and psychological healing.


HOW 

*We have put together a business plan and a marketing plan.

*Found a potential centrally located building in Reno

*Talk to contractors of all the trades

*Contacted the NV state health department as well as the Washoe County Health department and the City of Reno.

The reason for our campaign goal being set at $200,000 is mostly because of the custom buildout for this healing establishment and the equipment being put in. We need to build custom sound and salt proof rooms for the float tanks as well as build out the rest of the healing establishment. This includes the activated flow side which will have a place for yoga, workshops, movement and the oxygen chill lounge. The equipment we will be putting in includes: float tanks, infrared saunas, oxygen concentrators, water purification systems, as well as all the necessary equipment for the activated flow area. Our business plan covers a necessary financial start up amount and an ideal financial start up amount. When we reach our fund goal of $200,000 we will be able to open 2 float rooms, 1 Infrared Sauna room, and our oxygen chill lounge. If we reach our ideal fund goal of $250,000 we then can open up 3 float rooms, 2 Infrared sauna rooms, our oxygen chill lounge AND our activated flow area!!! If we don't quite reach our goal we can still use all of the contributions to help us with either an investor or a bank loan. We are willing and ready to open up this unique healing establishment with the help from our communities and connections around us involved in seeing the betterment in life, in people, and in the world we live in.


WHO

Help US, help EVERYONE!  Through this Indiegogo campaign, a little hard work and a lot of love, we will be lifted up by those who believe in good people doing good things.

Teaming up and contributing to Healing One is the best case scenario! The contributors, donators, and the community will help bring Healing One to its feet and in turn, Healing One will help to bring healing and support to the community and all involved with this wonderful idea.


Risks & Challenges 

Most of our challenges and risks come with building the healing establishment. We will have to renovate the building we choose because the float tanks need proper insulted rooms and a specific type of flooring. The float tank rooms need to be sound proofed to rid the room of any external noise so that your floating experience is 100% quiet and peaceful. The floors of the rooms need to be sealed very, very well considering the high salt content (850lbs. in each tank) can potentially be damaging to the building’s structure; salt water can seep into the crevices leading to corrosion. The rest of the room should be fully sealed as well to keep its temperature at a constant 90-95 degrees Fahrenheit. These are the necessary precautions that need to be considered, otherwise undoable damage could occur later on. The goal is to do it right the first time. We will also be adding 2 to 4 shower set ups for each of the float rooms as it is a preliminary to floating.

We feel this process is most definitely a hurdle we can jump. As we mentioned earlier we have spoken to many contractors in the Reno area and we have our list of professionals building out this location. Chaz has also been through the float apprenticeship program through a company called Float On located in Portland, OR., where he learned everything from checking and maintaining the water quality in the tanks, the process of building float rooms, to the business side of floating and how to market yourself and your establishment properly. Healing One will continue to work with Float On to dial in our float rooms and our overall business.

Another risk of course is starting and opening a business and becoming successful business owners! We say, challenge accepted! This life is all about progression, finding a way to keep moving forward each and every. To be business men/women in this life is really all about perspective. We are healers and that is what we are...but we are also fire spinners, herbalists, students, teachers, employees, dancers, entrepreneurs, electricians and many other things. If you want to be something, go learn about someone doing what you want to do! If your heart desires a goal you have every right to attain that goal. 


Perks

We have some phenomenal perks for all of our contributors!!! These perks were all donated to Healing One by some fantastic people, the wonderful companies that they run and the whole hearted faith they all have in this amazing healing establishment!

*Mike Benna, Film/Audio/Visuals
*Quincy Shanks Photography
*Moriah Wegman, certified Yogi
*Lily Hoog-Fry, certified Yogi and Acro Yogi
*Renie Anderson & Healthy Mind, Healthy Body
*Chaz Allen, Energy Healer, and co owner Healing One
*James Newstrom & W. Monster Art
*Jon Criss Design & Higher Than Life Klothing


*Tai Jaques, Herbalist, Golden Monarch Herbals, co owner Healing One

*Float On Portland, OR.


*Geoff Torkington & The Elephant Bowl a singing bowl revolution!

These singing bowls are handcrafted in Nepal and India. They are a perfect symbol for what Healing One represents and strives for. It is with great excitement, that this campaign is not only offering a three or seven bowl harmonied set as a grand thank you, but also a personal training of how to use the bowls with The Elephant Bowl founder, Geoffrey Torkington.  For those unable to come in person, other means will be organized to share the most essential directions and perspectives.


THANK YOU!!!

A huge Healing One heartfelt THANK YOU goes out to everyone involved in this project! From all the wonderful people donating and contributing to all the people behind the scenes making things happen everyday! THANK YOU from the depths of our hearts!!!!!!


THANK YOU ALL FOR BEING WHO YOU ARE & DOING WHAT YOU DO, YOU ARE APPRECIATED!!!



    Other ways you can help

    Even if you can't contribute there are still ways to progress Healing One in its quest to help all living beings heal! 

    • Spread the word, Bird! You can help get the good word out and make some noise about our campaign. Connecting those connections!
    • Indiegogo also has some amazing share tools! Please share, share, SHARE it with the world :)

    And that's all there is to it.


      Extended References

      Beever, Richard. (2009) Far-infared saunas for treatment of cardiovascular risk factors. Canadian Family Physician, vol 55, 691-696

      Borrie, R. and Peter Suedfeld. (1980) Restricted environmental stimulation therapy in a weight reduction program. Journal of Behavioral Medicine, vol 3, 147-161

      Bowden, D. Lorna Goddard, John Gruzelier. (2010) A randomized controlled single-blind trial of the effects of reiki and positive imagery on well-being and salivary cortisol. Brain Research Bulletin, vol 81, 66-72

(2012) Physical and psychosocial benefits of yoga in cancer patients and survivors, a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials. BMC Cancer, vol 12, 1-21

      Chiesa, A. and A. Serretti. (2010) A systematic review of neurobiological and clinical features of mindfulness meditations. Psychological Medicine, vol 40, 1239-1252

      Coakley, Amanda and Anne-Marie Barron. (2012) Energy therapies in oncology nursing. Seminars in Oncology Nursing, vol 28, 55-63

      Forgays, Donald. (1987) Flotation REST as a smoking intervention. Addictive Behaviors, vol 12, 85-90

      Forgays, D. and Deborah Forgays. (1992) Creativity enhancement through flotation isolation. Journal of Environmental Psychology, vol 12, 329-335

      Forgays, D. and Deborah Forgays. (1994) The use of flotation isolation to modify important type-A components in young adults. Journal of Environmental Psychology, vol 14, 47-55

      Forgays, D. and Maureen Belinson. (1986) Is Flotation Isolation a Relaxing Environment? Journal of Environmental Psychology, vol 6, 19-34

      Hannuksela, Minna and Samer Ellahham. (2001) Benefits and risks of sauna bathing. The American Journal of Medicine, vol 110, 118-126

      Hutchison, Michael. (1984) The Book of Floating. The Brainwave Explanation. William Morrow and Companym New York, NY, p 53-58

      Patel, N. Ann Newstead and Robert Ferrer. (2012) The effects of yoga on physical functioning and health related quality of life in older adults: a systematic review and meta-analysis. The Journal of Alternative and Complementary Medicine, volume 18, 902-917

      Rogan, A. Rony Morris, and Peter Gibbons. (2001) Pain management in osteopathic medicine: the efficacy of flotation REST as an adjunct to spinal manipulation for acute non-specific low back pain. A case report. Journal of Osteopathic Medicine, vol 4, 25-30

      Rubik, Beverly. (2011) Neurofeedback-enhanced gamma brainwaves from the prefrontal cortical region of meditators and non-meditators and associated subjective experiences. The Journal of Alternative and Complementary Medicine, vol 17, 109-115

      Shulz, P. and Charles-Henry Kaspar. (1994) Neuroendocrine and psychological effects of restricted environmental stimulation technique in a flotation tank. Biological Psychology vol 37, 161-175

      Suedfeld, Peter. Chuni Roy, and P. Bruce Landon. (1982) Restricted environmental stimulation therapy in the treatment of essential hypertension. Behavior Research and Therapy, vol 20, 553-559

      Suedfeld, P. Daniel Steel, Alistair Wallbaum, Susan Bluck, Nigel Livesey and Lorianna Capozzi. (1994) Explaining the effects of stimulus restriction: testing the dynamic hemispheric asymmetry hypothesis. Journal of Environmental Psychology, vol 14, 87-100

      Suedfeld, P. Elizabeth Ballard and Margaux Murphy. (1983) Water immersion and flotation: from stress experiment to stress treatment. Journal of Environmental Psychology, vol 3, 147-155

      Suedfeld, P. Janet Metcalfe and Susan Bluck. (1987) Enhancement of scientific creativity by flotation REST (restricted environmental stimulation technique). Journal of Environmental Psychology, vol 7, 219-231

      Tejero-Fernandez, V. Miguel Membrilla-Mesa, Noelia Galiano-Castillo, and Manuel Arroyo-Morales. (2014) Immunological effects of massage after exercise: a systematic review. Physical Therapy in Sport http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.ptsp.2014.07.001

      Thrane, S. and Susan Cohen. (2013) Effect of reiki therapy on pain and anxiety in adults: an in-depth literature review of randomized trials with effect size calculations. Pain Management Nursing, 1-12

story_txt:
We Are Healing One
Our whole-hearted intention is to simply bring healing to everyONE willing to open up and allow themselves to become the healer in their own lives. Healing One is a balanced healing establishment allowing for a passive and an active approach to healing.  Healing modalities include, but are not limited to: float tanks, infrared saunas, energy healing, massage therapy, sound therapy, yoga, flow arts, meditation and oxygen therapy.   
Chaz Allen, Head Honcho of Healing One has been doing energy healing work for the past 5 years even though he has been a healer his entire life.  He has studied many different healing modalities and art forms, as well as ways of living a healthful and balanced lifestyle.  He has always dreamed of opening up a space where healers could come practice their gift and help progress the knowledge and awareness of healing for all living things.  As the years progressed, Chaz continued his research for various healing arts and eventually discovered sensory deprivation tanks, also known as float tanks.  Not long after experiencing his first few floats did Chaz know that he had found the last piece to the healing establishment puzzle.  


Tai Jaques, Mama Monarch of Healing One is from Spring Creek, NV.  She's a holistic healer whose passions include massage therapy, herbal medicine and Paleo nutrition.  Her eclectic bodywork style blends stretching, deep tissue massage, subtle energy work, and the use of therapeutic herbs.  In her free time she loves to create Golden Monarch Herbals' products.  Her diverse studies and experiences allow her to approach each client with eyes, heart, and mind open to a variety of treatment options.  She loves what she does and is so stoked to share her gift with Healing One and the community.  

           The dream of creating Healing One is slowly manifesting into a reality...  



WHERE
Chaz and Tai have deep roots in Nevada, being raised in Elko and residing in Reno has helped them become a part of a few unique, strong communities. They feel that they should serve healing to their local communities first and foremost, sprouting here at home and then growing with time. Their first establishment will be in Reno and as time progresses, Healing One will expand by opening a healing center in Elko, NV. 


WHY
Why?! Healing is why!  Taking time to rest and recover is all part of the balance of life.  We want to do more, forget less, perform better and have it all come effortlessly.  Unfortunately, our physiology and neurochemistry often have other things in mind.  We are a body, a mind, and a soul and all three require activity and healing.  As our logo defines, with the Infinity symbol atop of the Yin and Yang...Infinite Balance is the key to an optimized life experience.
Healing is love!


Now let us talk about the hype on this sensory deprivation thing for a minute! These sensory deprivation tanks or float tanks as we like to call them are filled with water that is at skin-temperature and has enough epsom salt to allow a person to be suspended in the water, which places you in an environment where approximately 80% of the gravity we usually feel is no longer weighing down on the body. The tank is also soundproof and pitch-black, creating a space that is free of any stimulation from the outside world. This feeling of antigravity and complete deprivation of senses allows for the body, mind, and soul to rest, relax, and rejuvenate optimally. This is the most ideal resting/recovering/healing zone! And it is proven by the number of float centers that exist worldwide which is now more than 900. What’s truly impressive about float tanks is that almost every one of these benefits lasts for several days past the float itself. The longer and the more often the float tank is used, the stronger the effects become, the longer they last, and the better off someone is when they come in to float again. This creates a positive spiral of recovery and health that simply works to reinforce itself, giving people a path and a means towards a better life.

Benefits
Float Tanks: 
-Down shifts brain waves from our normal Beta frequency down into Alpha and even Theta brain waves. (Hutchisen, 1984) Theta brain waves are most commonly associated with learning and memory, REM sleep, physical activity, etc.
-Effective in helping reduce hypertension, weight, and addiction. (Borrie and Suedfeld, 1980) (Suedfeld and Baker-Brown, 1987) (Kristeller et al., 1982)
-Decompresses the muscles, joints, and spine of the body to open up and relax for proper alignment and circulation to flow through the body by lowering one's heart rate (Forgays and Belinson, 1986).
-Found to reduce general stress all the way down to the hormonal level (Turner and Fine, 1983), especially following multiple sessions. (Suedfeld et al., 1983) (van Dierendonck and Nijenhuis, 2005) Floatation therapy has also helped reduce pain in many cases. (Shafranksy, 1998) (Rogan et al., 2001)
-Enhancement to cognitive processes involved with creativity and problem solving, as well as a notable decrease in tension, depression, fatigue, and hostility. (Suedfeld et al., 1987) (Forgays and Forgays, 1992/1994) (Norlander et al., 1998) There was also an improvement in cognitive behavioral treatment in psychological disorders such  as OCD and Schyzotypal personality disorders. (Walker et al., 1994)
-After a float you feel like a cloud, not like walking on a cloud but actually being the cloud...nice and light!


Infrared Saunas:

-Detox  of chemicals & heavy metals that are stored in fat cells
-Strengthens & regenerates body organs 
-May decrease pain through stimulation
-May promote weight loss
(Hannuksela and Ellahham, 2001)

Fun Facts: 
*15 minutes of sweating in an infrared sauna eliminates as much toxic waste as 24 hours of normal kidney function.
* One of the most important times in your life to use a sauna for detoxification is when you start preparing for having a child. Both the future father and future mother should do a detoxification program before getting pregnant 
*Tests have shown that the energy output is tuned so closely to the body's own radiant energy that our bodies absorb as much as 93% of the far infrared waves that reach our skin.
These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA.  This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent disease.



Massage:
-Increases circulation
-Alleviates pain and increases range of motion
-Relieves anxiety & depression
-Decreases stress
(Field, 2014)
-Improves immune function due to increases in lymph flow and spread of endogenous immune-associated molecules (Tejero-Fernandez et al., 2014)




Yoga:
-Increases endurance, flexibility and strength (Patel et al., 2012)
-Helps relieve stress and calm the mind (Li et al., 2012)
-Reduces hypertension, blood glucose levels, cholesterol, body weight (Okanta, 2012)
-Increases proprioception, vitality, energy, resperation

Energy Healing:
-Cleansing and clearing of stagnant, negative energy 
-Boost of good, positive energy and healing towards ones intention for their life
-Reduced pain and increase in mobility (Lu et al., 2013) (Olsen et al., 2003) (Coakly and Barron, 2012)
-Reduced stress, anxiety, and depression (Thrane and Cohen, 2013) (Van Aken and Tayler, 2009) 
-Revitalizing and cleansing the Chakras 


Singing Bowls/Sound Healing Therapy:
These instruments give an almost immediate sense of peace and wholeness and when played for others as a 'sound therapy' session can awaken a deep inner stillness and the flavor of the sacred.  The power of sound, and more accurately said, the effects of frequency via sound, as demonstrated in the Indian Ragas, instrumental-based shamanism, gongs, Tibetan bowls, etc. are some of the most effective external means for consciousness shifting and some would argue, for physical and psychological healing.

HOW 
*We have put together a business plan and a marketing plan.
*Found a potential centrally located building in Reno
*Talk to contractors of all the trades
*Contacted the NV state health department as well as the Washoe County Health department and the City of Reno.

The reason for our campaign goal being set at $200,000 is mostly because of the custom buildout for this healing establishment and the equipment being put in. We need to build custom sound and salt proof rooms for the float tanks as well as build out the rest of the healing establishment. This includes the activated flow side which will have a place for yoga, workshops, movement and the oxygen chill lounge. The equipment we will be putting in includes: float tanks, infrared saunas, oxygen concentrators, water purification systems, as well as all the necessary equipment for the activated flow area. Our business plan covers a necessary financial start up amount and an ideal financial start up amount. When we reach our fund goal of $200,000 we will be able to open 2 float rooms, 1 Infrared Sauna room, and our oxygen chill lounge. If we reach our ideal fund goal of $250,000 we then can open up 3 float rooms, 2 Infrared sauna rooms, our oxygen chill lounge AND our activated flow area!!! If we don't quite reach our goal we can still use all of the contributions to help us with either an investor or a bank loan. We are willing and ready to open up this unique healing establishment with the help from our communities and connections around us involved in seeing the betterment in life, in people, and in the world we live in.



WHO
Help US, help EVERYONE!  Through this Indiegogo campaign, a little hard work and a lot of love, we will be lifted up by those who believe in good people doing good things.
Teaming up and contributing to Healing One is the best case scenario! The contributors, donators, and the community will help bring Healing One to its feet and in turn, Healing One will help to bring healing and support to the community and all involved with this wonderful idea.



Risks & Challenges 
Most of our challenges and risks come with building the healing establishment. We will have to renovate the building we choose because the float tanks need proper insulted rooms and a specific type of flooring. The float tank rooms need to be sound proofed to rid the room of any external noise so that your floating experience is 100% quiet and peaceful. The floors of the rooms need to be sealed very, very well considering the high salt content (850lbs. in each tank) can potentially be damaging to the building’s structure; salt water can seep into the crevices leading to corrosion. The rest of the room should be fully sealed as well to keep its temperature at a constant 90-95 degrees Fahrenheit. These are the necessary precautions that need to be considered, otherwise undoable damage could occur later on. The goal is to do it right the first time. We will also be adding 2 to 4 shower set ups for each of the float rooms as it is a preliminary to floating.
We feel this process is most definitely a hurdle we can jump. As we mentioned earlier we have spoken to many contractors in the Reno area and we have our list of professionals building out this location. Chaz has also been through the float apprenticeship program through a company called Float On located in Portland, OR., where he learned everything from checking and maintaining the water quality in the tanks, the process of building float rooms, to the business side of floating and how to market yourself and your establishment properly. Healing One will continue to work with Float On to dial in our float rooms and our overall business.
Another risk of course is starting and opening a business and becoming successful business owners! We say, challenge accepted! This life is all about progression, finding a way to keep moving forward each and every. To be business men/women in this life is really all about perspective. We are healers and that is what we are...but we are also fire spinners, herbalists, students, teachers, employees, dancers, entrepreneurs, electricians and many other things. If you want to be something, go learn about someone doing what you want to do! If your heart desires a goal you have every right to attain that goal. 



Perks
We have some phenomenal perks for all of our contributors!!! These perks were all donated to Healing One by some fantastic people, the wonderful companies that they run and the whole hearted faith they all have in this amazing healing establishment!
*Mike Benna, Film/Audio/Visuals*Quincy Shanks Photography*Moriah Wegman, certified Yogi*Lily Hoog-Fry, certified Yogi and Acro Yogi*Renie Anderson & Healthy Mind, Healthy Body*Chaz Allen, Energy Healer, and co owner Healing One*James Newstrom & W. Monster Art*Jon Criss Design & Higher Than Life Klothing








*Tai Jaques, Herbalist, Golden Monarch Herbals, co owner Healing One


*Float On Portland, OR.




*Geoff Torkington & The Elephant Bowl a singing bowl revolution!



These singing bowls are handcrafted in Nepal and India. They are a perfect symbol for what Healing One represents and strives for. It is with great excitement, that this campaign is not only offering a three or seven bowl harmonied set as a grand thank you, but also a personal training of how to use the bowls with The Elephant Bowl founder, Geoffrey Torkington.  For those unable to come in person, other means will be organized to share the most essential directions and perspectives.



THANK YOU!!!
 A huge Healing One heartfelt THANK YOU goes out to everyone involved in this project! From all the wonderful people donating and contributing to all the people behind the scenes making things happen everyday! THANK YOU from the depths of our hearts!!!!!!








THANK YOU ALL FOR BEING WHO YOU ARE & DOING WHAT YOU DO, YOU ARE APPRECIATED!!!



  

Other ways you can help
Even if you can't contribute there are still ways to progress Healing One in its quest to help all living beings heal! 

Spread the word, Bird! You can help get the good word out and make some noise about our campaign. Connecting those connections!
Indiegogo also has some amazing share tools! Please share, share, SHARE it with the world :)

And that's all there is to it.

story:
My name is Ronnie "RJ" Boling, I am a 29 year old single father of 2. Xander (age 8), and Gracie (age 21 months). 

I have been struggling with my weight now for over a decade. I have done diet and exercise regimen supervised by both physicians and at one time a personal trainer. After literally no success (and even weight gain), the doctors did blood work on me and everything came back ok. They were kind of miffed. They could not prescribe diet pills due to high blood pressure, so the only thing they could think was less calories and more exercise. I got my caloric intake down to 750 per day, and I was constantly tired and miserable, I felt I was unable to get enough calories to even function, still I gained weight.
 
The doctor suggested a sleep study to try and diagnose my fatigue. I had my sleep study and it was discovered that I have severe sleep apnea, and had 93 breathing episodes an hour, and never got past the 2nd stage of sleep. I am at a higher risk of stroke and heart disease. 
 
Shortly after that, I crippled myself with a broken ankle, and since the broken ankle I have gained most all of my weight back. My doctor finally suggested that I get bariatric surgery, as he felt it was my only option. 
 
I called my Insurance company and they absolutely do not, under any circumstances, cover bariatric surgery.
 
I turned to a local non-profit hospital and put together their charity packet that is available for single parents, and low income families. I put together the packet with letters of medical necessity from my GP, Chiro, and Sleep Doctor, along with my medical records showing extensive attempts at weight loss. It was approved all the way up the line until it got to the CFO's desk. She declined it stating that it was "elective". I heard from a local source, that she declined it, because she was afraid if she approved one bariatric surgery that people would take advantage of it.
 
My son is starting football later this year, and I can't even go out and throw the ball with him, he can outrun me already, and is constantly asking when we will be able to play football. My daughter is running and playing around, and I can barely keep up with her. I want to be around for my children as they grow older. Sometimes I wonder if I am going to be around if I don't get this fixed. 
 
I am not usually one to ask for a handout, but I know when to suck up my pride, and I have seen so many good people on here, I thought I would give it a try. 
 
I have a blog, and if this works, I will blog my progress for the world to see.
 
http://www.bigfatloserblog.com

 

What I Need & What You Get

This is what the funds will cover.

The surgery costs roughly 18-19k. I have a $4000 credit card that I plan on covering the difference on.

I will blog weekly on my blog listed above with progress pictures.

If for some reason I do not make my entire goal, I will plead with the hospital to give me a discounted cash rate. If I still do not have enough money, I will travel to another hospital, out of state if necessary.

The Impact

If this goal becomes a reality, I will be able to live a healthy life, and enjoy my kids for a long time to come. I will be able to run around outside with them, travel to theme parks, and not have to worry if the seats are big enough in concerts and sports stadiums.

I believe that people are good, and I understand that there are people out there that have it worse than me, and there are also people who take advantage of these types of charities. I promise you, this will be life changing for my family and I.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me find a hospital that will do charity surgery, or work with my insurance company, or even a payment plan for someone with less than stellar credit.

 SHARE, SHARE, SHARE! I need exposure.

story:
Short Summary

Petals Office begun as a side project aiming for the development of a more efficient and simpler user interface. It took its name and form slowly, over a long period of time, as a modern approach to an Office suite, which uses an all-in-one tabbed interface that allows to edit text and spreadsheet documents, as well as to display PDFs, side by side. The program will be free, with a commercial version to ensure its future.

Your contribution will make possible the full time development of Petals Office, by two programmers for at least a year, estimating that a first stable version can probably be released by the end of 2014. Furthermore, it will allow for an upgrade of the infrastructure, fees for graphic design and translation to other languages. In case the goal is exceeded by an appropriate amount, additional programmer(s) will be recruited for faster delivery. However, even if the campaign is not fully founded, development of the project will still be continued.

The first version of this suite will include a document and a spreadsheet editor, alongside of a simple PDF viewer. Support for presentations and database capabilities will be added in later versions.

Creating a new suite

Working with various office suites throughout the years, I always felt there was a need for change on their interface. Being forced to change windows from spreadsheet to document editor, is a typical annoyance, even on modern computers where there is enough screen space to display both windows side by side. No matter which type of document you are working on, many of the editing options are difficult to find, hidden on sub menus and dialogs, or are missing altogether on some suites.

The aim of Petals Office is to solve all such problems through a simple adaptive interface, easy to learn and friendly to the user.

Supported Platforms

The platforms which will be supported are Linux, major distributions such as Debian Fedora and openSUSE plus derivatives, Windows, from XP and up, and finally OS X. The suite will have identical features on those operating systems, there will only be slight customization on its appearance. Support for tablets, such as Android, will start after the completion of the first stable desktop version.

The current code is implemented on C++ and Python, using the wxWidgets toolkit. The objective is to create a slick versatile and fast application suite, whilst keeping the look and feel of each OS. ODFpy is used for the manipulation of OpenDocument files. It has been considered releasing it as open source, but such a decision will only be taken with concern for the future of the program.

Design

The design, although it can't be considered unique these days, is optimized for touch screens, and is build around ease of use, under the KISS principle.

Since newest computers use wide screens, the toolbar was moved to the side, to take advantage of unused space and free the most useful screen real estate, its height. In comparison the Ribbon toolbar, on the latest Microsoft Office layout, is located at the top of your window at expense of your documents.

Having all office applications in the same interface, through different tabs, helps concentrate all -and on- your work. You can view multiple documents of all supported types (text, spreadsheet, pdf etc) side by side, or in a top bottom split layout. On a 24-inch desktop screen, it is possible to view two full A4 pages side by side, while on editing mode.

It also makes cooperation possible, between what would otherwise be different applications. For example you can insert a table in a document, view it in spreadsheet mode, create and edit a chart and move it back into the document, in no time.

The adaptive foldable toolbar comprises of task specific groups of buttons. This interface resembles that of smart-phones and tablets, and helps users with touch screens do their work faster and easier. The grouping helps you find the task quickly and will also be customizable to the user's needs. The groups and their contents adapt, depending on the type of the document you are focused on, so you always have exactly what you need at your disposal.

Νot just another Office Suite

What we are trying to accomplish, is not simply to change how your office looks, but to enhance how it works as well. For example special attention has been given on the planning of the spreadsheet part of the program. Adding to what current applications can do, we want to incorporate OpenCL/GPGPU functions, where applicable. Such features are above MS Office compatibility and will probably only run on Petals Office.

Advanced Features

Adaptive toolbar, all the tools you need, available when you need them.
 Tabbed Interface, work on different types of documents at the same time.
Cloud integration, save and share your documents (Google Drive, Dropbox ...)
Equation Library, to support students and scientists, both for spreadsheet and documents.

Free with Commercial spin off

As a crowd funded project, Petals office will always be a fully working free program for everyone. No ads, no spying, no locked features will ever be incorporated in it. A spin off commercial version with advanced business features is being planned, in order to ensure its long term viability. Such features include integrated Cloud storage (1 to 5GB per license) with sharing, team projects and speech to text. According to the perk you choose, you will get a respective number of lifetime licenses for the commercial version.

Who are we?

 Currently there is only one person behind Petals Office: Gregory Papadopoulos. I am a physicist with specialization in programming, computers and electronics. Learning programming languages has been a hobby for me, and designing new interfaces has been a passion and a real challenge since the beginning. Being able to get in touch both with users and people in the industry, as technical editor in PC Magazine Greece, my last job, has helped to develop a new different holistic approach to interface design.

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can't contribute but still believe this suite is a nice idea, you can help by spreading the word. Share this campaign with friends and colleagues. Don't forget that indiegogo allows contributions of any amount, no matter how small.

Feel free to contact us on Facebook or Twitter, for any question or suggestion.

Thank you...


FAQ / You asked

Q1. Will the program be compatible with doc/docx/xls/xlsx files?
A1. Yes, we will always try to achieve the best compatibility with all major Office suites.

Q2. Will there be a tablet version?
A2. Yes it is planned, after the first release of the main program, since development for tablets differ. It will have a similar interface, adapted to the unique characteristics of each operating system.

Q3. Why a $10,000 perk?
A3. It is common practice for big companies to support projects that have a public benefit. If you own Google, for example, you may want to fund a project that helps both your interests and that of your users.

Q4. When will a beta version be available for download?
A4. Although this is clearly an estimate and depending on the funding, a beta download can be produced within 6-7 months.

The program will be free, with a commercial version to ensure its future. 
Your contribution will make possible the full time development of Petals Office, by two programmers for at least a year, estimating that a first stable version can probably be released by the end of 2014. In case the goal is exceeded by an appropriate amount, additional programmer(s) will be recruited for faster delivery. story:
--- Update September 30, 2013

We have all the perks 3D printed, packaged, and sent! With that behind us, we look forward to servicing all your new orders at our new website at http://www.rjclip.com


Thank you All.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Who we are and what we want (the Campaign)

We are a home-based business, Bit64 Solutions Ltd., primarily providing IT professional services to small, medium, and large enterprise clients. The RJClip is our first venture outside of selling services. Everyone in our family is involved with bringing the RJClip to the market. It's an exciting time for us.

We are launching the RJClip through Indiegogo because we feel this is the best place to launch a product such as ours. Here, our crowdfunding campaign will help us understand our customers, create media exposure, and raise capital to fund product and business expenses.   

What is an RJClip?

The RJClip is an easy and inexpensive way to replace the broken clip on a RJ45 connector at the end of a network cable. It allows the network cable to securely plug into a switch or wall jack. 

NOTE: Telephone cords use RJ11 connectors. Despite the fact that they look similar, the RJ11 connector is smaller than the RJ45 connector. The RJClip is designed for RJ45 connectors, and therefore is too big for an RJ11 connector. We are planning to develop this version later in the campaign. 

What does this mean to you?

Using the RJClip to fix broken network cable clips allows you to save time and money. Instead of spending time crimping a new RJ45 connector onto the cable or spending money to buy a new network cable, you can simply clip an RJClip onto the broken network head and continue to use the cable. The design and material of the RJClip ensures it lasts many times longer than the original clip.  As a result, it mimimizes waste and contributes to a greener way of life.

 

What colours does it come in?

The RJClip is currently available in Red, White, Black, Green, Yellow, and Blue.

 

How do we make them?

The RJClip is made with a state-of-the-art 3D manufacturing system.  Our vendor, Anubis3D, can produce the RJClip in a rainbow of colours in a medical grade nylon 12 material.  We are proud to say the RJClip is invented, designed and "Made in Canada".  We think this is one of the best things about our product. The biggest advantage to 3D manufacturing is the ability to have the RJClips ready to send to you soon after the end of the campaign.

What's in it for you? (the Perks)

All our perks are about getting you RJClips in the quantities and colours of your choice. We will also provide customization to suit corporations or individuals looking to hand out personalized gifts. (Hint: trade show handouts).  

Are there risks?

We do not foresee any risks at this time as our patent pending design for the RJClip has tested successfully on almost all occasions. That being said, we are still making minor design changes to make the RJClip the best it can be. If the RJClip(s) you receive do not work, we will either exchange your RJClips or refund your money.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We know it's not always possible to contribute funds. The best way you can help us otherwise is to pass this campaign to anyone you think would be interested, especially people who work with computers (network and office administrators, etc.).  

We greatly appreciate everybody's time, support, and contributions!

story:
As Seen On


Skin Edge Technology (S.E.T)

S.E.T - is the exfoliator that's sweeping the global skin-care markets today. A handy and portable patented exfoliating tool that precisely exfoliates the user's skin in the shower. It uses the Patented Smooth Edge Micro Groove Technology as its main medium of exfoliation.

  • Get cleaner and clearer skin with less bumps.
  • Prevent shaving rash, skin infections, ingrown hair and razor stubble.
  • Make all your skin care products, cosmetics and make-up applications absorb better.
  • Get the closest waxing and shaving experience ever.

Forget traditional scrubs, creams and exfoliators that do more harm than good. We have the solution right here! S.E.T exfoliator is set to take care of your skin for life.

How This Exfoliator Works, Watch Please!



The most Effective, Simple & Beautiful Tool for Home exfoliation.

(S.E.M.G.T) Technology

Laser Forged Edge - The coolest part about the tool is its patented laser forged smooth edge micro groove technology. Using a pre-calculated computer guided process, the laser machine cuts micro precision grooves into pieces of high quality stainless steel. Each stainless steel is cut individually to make sure the quality is uniformed for maximum exfoliation results. It makes the process extremely expensive, but you get quality when you pay for quality.


You Need (S.E.T)

S.E.T was developed with only one thing in mind. - Effective Exfoliation Results.

  • It was developed to clear away dead skin cells and blackheads on the skin.
  • It was developed to prevent shaving rash and bumps.
  • It was developed to prevent skin infections.
  • It was developed to prevent razor stubble.
  • It was developed to aid in the healing of pimples, acne and scars.

Skin-care products and performance. - Enhanced when using S.E.T.

  • Proven to help performance of all skin-care products.
  • Proven to help laser skin devices.
  • Proven to help smoother make up application.
  • Proven to help smoother shaving and waxing process
  • Proven to give a more even fake-tan.
  • Proven to remove cigarette stains.

How Does S.E.T Work

The Patented tool was made to glide with nothing but water. 

  • It does not cut or harm the user in anyway.
  • It glides smoothly off your skin.

Replacement Blades (Forget Them)

SET will save you time and money. - Cost Effective Exfoliation.

The smooth edge blade on the exfoliator never needs sharpening or replacement, it was meant to last and last and last. It does not rust since its made out of extremely high-quality stainless steel.

How To Use S.E.T

Simply at a 90 Degree Angle - Just Add Water and Glide.

  • Wet the face and body in the shower or the part you are exfoliating.
  • Target any spots which holds SKIN.
  • Warm water is recommended.
  • Glide the tool at a 90 degree angle.
  • Give it 3-5 gentle strokes per spot.
  • Note that the face will produce more clay-like dirt since its most exposed.
  • If you feel the tool is too smooth, flip it and use the other side of the blade.

Importance of Effective Exfoliation

New skin cells are created in the skin's lower layer, the dermis. Over time, cells migrate to the surface of the skin and become more acidic. During their 30-day journey, they die and become saturated with keratin. Keratin is important because it protects the skin from outside elements. Exfoliation removes the outer layer to reveal the newer skin beneath. This shedding of the outer layer unclogs pores, keeps skin clean, and helps reduce acne outbreaks.

Only The Best Use S.E.T

S.E.T exfoliator tools are used by thousands of home users world-wide, they have been recently adopted by top seven star luxury spas such as Jumeirah and The Mandarin Oriential Spa and also used in hospitals before surgery.

Surgeons and Doctors

Top Seven Star Luxury Spas

Home Users Like You

Limited Edition Run

To raise capital for this crowd funding project, we have decided to produce a one-time limited edition run only for Indiegogo funders. You will find this limited edition perk no where else in the world. We won't tell you what it is, but it will be something extra special! Just for our Indiegogo backers!

Please note that there is no money back guarantee for any perks offered on this campaign. Do take good care of this limited edition exfoliator! You may wish to buy an extra unit as a keepsake. - Proudly Designed By Rob & Josh

Why The Indiegogo Campaign

Here’s where you come in! We have perfected and tested our current exfoliator. Lab-tested and proven by doctors, users and some of the world's top skin-care specialists. We're now raising $110,000, which will allow us to produce a future new and improved version!

A version that implements healing technology such as UVB light and other non-invasive skin technologies. This version will help to not only increase exfoliation results, but aid in healing skin as well. In return for your early support, you'll be the one and only exclusive club of funders to get our limited edition exfoliator. Designed only for Indiegogo!


Schedule of execution phase (only if our campaign meets or exceeds):

1st month – Creating a beautiful limited edition exfoliator for our backers.

2nd month – Sending out the limited edition exfoliators to our backers.

3rd-5th month – Extended Research and Development For SET version 2.

5th-7mth month – Final Testing and Lab Tests of SET version 2.

7th-12th month – Mass Production of SET version 2.

Schedule of production for the second version is TBA, the above schedule is just a guideline. The second version of the exfoliator is still a very long way from production. We need to get the implementation of the new technology perfect. The limited edition perk production can only start if our funds meet or exceed a certain amount or orders of up to at least 1000 units. If for some reason that does not happen, we will send out our regular S.E.M.G.T exfoliators to our backers depending on how much is raised.

The fundraiser will use the funds to inject capital into the company that owns the patent and distribution rights of the technology, the company will then do the necessary research for the combination of the two technologies. S.E.M.G.T + N.I.S.T (smooth edge micro groove technology + non invasive skin technology). The injection of capital is done by buying a small share in the company. How much share bought is at the discretion of the fundraiser.

Marketing Video



Thank You

We would like to thank our backers for any contribution and assistance rendered in the realization of our crowd funding project. Please help share with your friends and families on facebook, twitter and other social media sites on this new and most effective way of exfoliating your skin today!

If you have any questions please contact the fundraiser at jthia@hotmail.com

story:
The Initiative

The Alpha Lambda Chapter of Alpha Phi Alpha saw a need to promote health and wellness in an area of town not traditionally exposed to healthy lifestyles promotions. We decided running/walking, the most accessible form of exercise, would be an excellent way to engage the community. The 5k was born out of a desire to advocate advocate a healthy lifestyle while raising funds for various local charities. 

All proceeds will be split amongst our 3 partners:

  1. The Alpha Lamdbda Education Foundation (ALEF): our partner in the event and a 501c3 organization. ALEF was organized as a means to provide funding for academic scholarships and other community endeavors.
  2. Big Brothers Big Sisters KY (BBBSKY): A national partner of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc. BBBSKY is a mentoring network, providing children facing adversity with strong and enduring, professionally supported 1-to-1 relationships that change their lives for the better, forever.
  3. March of Dimes: Also a national partner of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc. the March of Dimes works to promote healthy pregnancies and babies, and work to prevent premature birth and birth defects.

What We Need & What You Get

Organizing such an event can be a resource intensive proposition. We need  your help! DJ's, tents, tables, permits, etc. are needed to ensure a well attended and professional event that participants will remember and look forward to year after year. It's our hope that the success of this years inagural event will see us planning bigger and better events in the future.

We're asking for your donations. Big or small, any $ will aid us. Please remember the funds will be distributed to charities in great need and with formidable missions to improve our community!

What you can do:

  • Pledge $5 (Thank you mention on our website)
  • Pledge $10 (Thank you mention on our website)
  • Pledge $20 (Thank you mention on our website, an event T-shirt)
  • Pledge $50 (Thank you mention on our website, an event T-shit customized with your name on it)

Other Ways you can help

In the Louisville area and looking for a healthy challenge? We'd love to have you register and run with us!

Booked that day, but know some folks that might benefit? Please, spread the word. Tell them to go to www.westlouisvillefunrun.com and sign up for the race!

Are you a health professional willing to donate your services for one of our health booth's at the event? Contact michaelbranch1906@yahoo.com to find out how you can help. 

Be sure to share this event (Indiegogo has tools built in just for that!) on all your social media networks and email contacts!!

More

For more detailed information regarding the event please navigate to www.westlouisvillefunrun.com for more information.

story:
A $2500 GUILT-FREE CANCER FUN FUND FOR ME & MY DAUGHTER

My name is Monet Trail.  I’m 42 and I’m kicking breast cancer’s ass!  I’ve had the cancer removed and I’m making it through chemo. But since my mom’s adopted, I decided to have the test done and it turns out I tested positive for the cancer gene – which means there’s a good chance the cancer will return.  Rather than dealing with this sh*t again, I’ve decided to have a double mastectomy and a hysterectomy.  If it were only me, I’d be grateful just to be surviving.  But I’m a single mom and I have a beautiful 15 year old daughter who deserves to enjoy this amazing time in her life.

I turn 43 on May 23rd and I just realized what I really want for my birthday this year is the ability (on the day’s that I do feel good) to pick up and do something fun with my daughter – whether it’s dinner at Outback, a trip to the mall or a weekend at the beach which is just a 2 hour drive away. I want to grab those moments when I feel good and create happy experiences and memories with my daughter. I’ll try doing this no matter what, but the reality is money is tight and while I’m lucky because I’ve worked hard my entire life, disability and insurance doesn’t quite cover our living expenses so any splurges mean added stress and guilt because the money has to come from somewhere. 

I have to admit it’s hard for me to do this because I hate asking for help.  But I’ve been through enough now to know that life is short and my pride is nothing compared to spending an afternoon having fun and laughing with my daughter. If I can’t ask for help now, when will I ever have the nerve to swallow my pride and ask for help?  So I’m closing my eyes, saying a secret prayer, crossing my fingers, and jumping into the deep end of the IndieGoGo pool and ultimately asking for the crowd’s help to create a “GUILT-FREE FUN FUND” for me and my daughter. 

I’ve got great friends who helped me pull this together and I hope you find the saying/logo/design as funny as we did when thinking up a fun reward for contributing to this campaign.  It reads:

 

Part of me hopes that by posting this campaign, I’ll somehow help another woman who’s struggling with breast cancer or tests positive for the cancer gene.  I’ve got all my tests and am happy to share anything with anyone.  I just don’t want to post it publicly because it contains private personal information.  I can also share my resume if you want to know where I’ve worked (though I am particularly proud of the fact that I took classes at night and on weekends for nearly a decade and earned by Bachelor’s Degree in accounting in 2006.

If you have any questions or want to know more, please message me or comment.  I’m happy to talk with anyone about what I’ve been through and the choices I’ve made.  And I’m usually pretty funny too.  Thanks to anyone and everyone who decides to chip in and be part of this fairly unusual IndieGoGo campaign.

Where does the money go (or how $5,000 really equals $2500)?

The goal is $5,000, but Uncle Sam, IndieGoGo and the actual products and mailing them to you cost money as well.  So after all that's taken care of, the net amount of "FUN FUNDS" is closer to $2500 (which is still AMAZING)!

Stretch Goal:

$10,000:  If we're lucky enough to get this far, after paying for the rewards, taxes, fulfilllment, etc. that means we'll be closer to $5,000 (our real goal that seems too big to actually put up).  This means we'll definitely enjoy a long weekend together somewhere close but FUN!

story:
The story

Last Thursday night, Cassie and Eric returned home from the gym to find their apartment broken into. Their wedding rings, iPad, and inexplicably, an unopened bag of t-shirts had been stolen. 

But they have renters insurance!

True - but there is a $500 deductible. And with only a few weeks left till their wedding, we're guessing an extra $500 was not built in to their wedding budget. 

What can I do?

Donate! Let's try to raise $500 to cover their deductible - and make sure they'll have rings at their wedding! 

Thanks for your support!

story:
Cancer:

Amanda had breast cancer, and she beat it. She did not have insurance when she became ill and now has to cover ALL of the costs out of pocket.  She was working as a waitress and could not afford to buy her own insurance.  Because of the treatments she was not able to work and now has no job, and was left with the huge medical bills to pay.  The collection agencies are calling, but there is nothing she can do.  She has to pay the bills by the middle of August or the collection agencies will bring her to court.  She did her part and beat the cancer, now let's do our part and help pay her medical bills. 

AMANDA WILL BE WRITING A LETTER AND SENDING IT TO EVERYONE WHO DONATES AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE CAMPAIGN ALONG WITH A PICTURE OF WHAT SHE LOOKS LIKE NOW THAT SHE IS HEALTHY AGAIN!

 

What We Need:

  • $50,000 will go toward the medical expenses
  • If the goal is not met, all money will go toward medical expenses to get as much of it covered as possible.
  • If the goal is exceeded, she will use some to buy insurance, pay for psychological therapy, get back on her feet, and re-donate any remaining money to the Susan G. Komen foundation.

 

Other Ways To Help:

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Email your friends, or share the link on Facebook.
  • Get the word out, however you can.  Amanda did her part in beating the cancer, now it's turn for us to do our part to hel her!

story:
I’ve written an eBook with all the knowledge I have, and all I’ve learned from real experience, in order to help others in my same situation to avoid making some key mistakes which have costed me so much.

This ebook is full of experience and inside advice that could help you or someone you know ease that back pain that's been affecting you and save you months or years of complications in the future.
How much is that worth for you? How much is that worth for those you love?

What I Need

  • The money raised here will be used for Medical expenses alone. After we achieve our goal any excess it will be donated to a local found to help increase the quality of life of poor people living
  • There is no amount that is “too little”, whether its $5 or $500!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Forward this project and/or Facebook page to everyone you know!
  • Email friends and family and ask for their support.
  • Adopt a poor kitty and send me the pictures! I just love them! Dogs count too!

 

The Ariel’s  Found:

This is my life’s journey:

I grew up in poor neighborhood in Argentina, an small house with another 7 member of my family and sincerely I wouldn’t chosen otherwise

 I loved those years all of us sleeping together in the same room.

My mother took care of us all by herself, and working hard every day she got me and my brothers a decent, drugless and safer place to live by the time I was 16.

Some of my friend weren’t so lucky, they end up using drugs, getting in and out of jail, stealing and worse. Then I realize how lucky I was and how bad I wanted to help people in that situation, they could become so much more!

Since I was a child I knew nothing was out of my reach, I felt no fear of being really ambitious. I’ve got everything to achieve my many dreams: A beloved family to support me, good education and I knew how to work really hard, so I did it.

I studied engineering, got a good enough job and started with the first steps to develop my own beneficial enterprise were ALL the profits would be for the school were I studied as a child in my old neighborhood.

Two years ago, at the age of 22, I got a herniated disc injury…

I have always had hyperlordosis, spine bifida and scoliosis, and some issues attach to them but it was nothing compared to what I now have to live with. And I know many of you have a first hand experience of what I’m talking about.

The back pain started as numbing annoyance in my lower back and right leg and rapidly spread to my other leg. Eight month later I couldn’t get up of my bed because the pain was just too much.

I was crippled. I couldn’t move too much so I obviously left sports. I could not be seated still for too long without unbearable pain, hence I was fired from my office job.  My mother started suffering from epileptic attacks before all this even happened, so to be unemployed was not an option. I left most of the university studies to get a full time job to support her along with the rest of the family.

Living with everyday with this pain broke my life in other aspects as well: Somehow I get sick a lot, my everyday smiling  and laughing self almost disappeared and my girlfriend left me because of that. My dreams and projects were suddenly abducted and held in a painly prison.

I’ve tried all! My stomach is always a mess due to the 2 to 5 every day muscle relaxing and anti-inflammatory pills. And I’m far of giving up.

I’ve decided to end this once and for all, surgery is the only option for me now. All the other treatments have failed me and the rest are too expensive here in Argentina and less reliable.

I deeply believe in people’s good will and I would really appreciate any help. Allow me to pursue my dreams one again, to help the people I love. Any help is welcomed, I’m not asking for much, every dollar, every friend you show my life’s journey, every truly deep pray…

Lastly, I really do hate being negative, that’s not who I am. Life is great, even with pain, without money, with crappy job, with a diseased mother and the myriad of problems we face everyday, life is still precious and something to enjoy. I firmly believe that the thing we are forced to deal with forge our life ALWAYS IN THE BEST WAY. Most of the people I admire have archived they greater masterpieces because, not despite, of the struggle with very real challenges.

story: My name is Lexis. I am a Pomeranian. My forever family found me at Small Dog Rescue three years ago and I love them very much for saving me and protecting me. Last year Mom was diagnosed with stage four breast cancer which went to her bones and we were all very afraid that we would lose her. Her wonderful doctors tried a new combination of chemotherapy and she began to get better. In July the doctors told us that we probably wouldn't have her for the coming Christmas and here she was with her hair growing back, smiling again and nearly back to her old happy self. With one letter from Amerihealth our lives were changed for the worse. The insurance company found a way to take back the hundreds of thousands of dollars they had paid for mom's life saving treatements by calling her cancer a pre-existing condition. Even though she appealed it three times we still ended up with no help from anywhere. Every where mom and dad turned for help there was none. Dad works really hard and has a good job but ends just are not meeting. Utilities are always getting turned off, people taking her car, sheriff's officers coming to inventory our belongings it is all very scary. We almost lost our house but mom and dad were able to get a mortgage modification to stop the foreclosure. They did lose a beloved family businesss called hangar 84 which was a concert venue where mom enjoyed cooking homemade meals for the touring bands and supporting music in the community. Summer camp was very popular and this summer mom really missed the kids and the music. She needs hormone therapy pills and a bone juice treatment once a month so we can keep her around with us. It is hard to pay for treatments, payment arrangements and normal household bills each month. Any donation at all will help. XOXO Lexis.

story:
Imagine, a program that literally works for everyone, has incredible health and immune system benefits, only takes 20 minutes 3 times per week, and is paid for by health insurance.  That is ibodi’s mission. 

A Mission that means The End of Obesity

“We treat our cars better than our bodies”, says ibodi CEO Phil Walker.  “Because our cars come with an owner’s manual, and because of that manual we know exactly what the car needs.  ibodi is the manual for the human body and is the most complete and efficient program ever created based on human physiology”. 

Watch the video and see why the obesity crisis will not be solved with a pill, diet, or surgery.  These pseudo solutions do not address how the human body is designed. (Make sure to scroll down for before and after photos!)

Phil is living proof.  The 48 year-old former S&P 500 executive has lost 65 pounds of body fat on the program. 

The obesity crisis is currently costing $174 Billion per year, and Type 2 Diabetes is on a staggering rise.  According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, there are currently 17 million diagnosed diabetics in the US, and an estimated 7 million undiagnosed, with 79 million pre-diabetics in the pipeline.  The implications to the healthcare system and the national economy could be devastating.

ibodi will soft launch by introducing a revolutionary nutrition line on Indiegogo.  Products and Perks are offered at a deep discount and the proceeds will be used toward completing the company's initial capital raise.  ibodi, who is also a member of Start Up America, is also considering an equity crowdfunding campaign in the Spring of 2013.

The ibodi Fitness Nutrition Line:

ibodi Slim Protein Shake - Ultra low glycemic, Great Tasting, and Gluten Free

ibodi Digest - Digestive Ezymes break down food the way nature intended and improves nutritent absorption.

ibodi Probiotics - Boost the immune system and helps keep your villi clean and available for nutrient absorption (Want to know what villi are?..watch the video).

ibodi Greens - The antioxidants of 20 servings of fruits and vegetables in one little scoop.  Be honest, do you really eat enough veggies?

ibodi Multi Vitamin - Bioavailable nutrients that every cell in your body needs.

You can view our product FAQ here.

ibodi recently announced their spokesman Ron Brown, who won a gold medal in the LA Olympics and set the world record in the 4x100 relay with Carl Lewis.  Ron then joined the LA Rams and was the fastest man in the NFL, twice.  Ron joined the ibodi team because of the amazing program results, whole body approach of nutrition, and sprint based technology which anyone can do. 

The exercise component was developed by world class sprint coach Phil Campbell M.S., M.A., ACSM-CPT, FACHE and Certified, American College of Sports Medicine CPT.  Phil has spent the last 20 years making Olympic athletes and NFL football stars faster.  His discoveries over the years led to an easy to follow, machine-based, program that gets 40 and 50 year olds burning fat as if they were in their 20’s again.  If you can sit down and peddle, you can do this exercise.  There are three different machines that have been specially programmed for this breakthrough 20 minute exercise.  The first developed was a semi-recumbent bike seen below (available in Perk 7). 

It may look like bikes you have seen at your local gym, but don't be fooled.  First of all, the positioning on this bike actually emulates a running sprint position.  The unique programming is designed to work the fast twitch muscle fibers of the legs, and there lies the game changer.  Much like how lifting weights increases bone density, exercising fast twitch muscle fibers specifically increases lean muscle mass and burns fat like crazy.  This new technology will be a game changer for the entire fitness industry.

A clinical study concluded that the program achieved an average body fat reduction of 31% in just 8 weeks along with amazing improvements in cholesterol and blood pressure levels.  A nurse that participated in the study saw her bad cholesterol go from 270 to 190.  A physician in the study was quoted as saying "This program could potentially save Medicare millions by reducing obesity and reducing the need for cholesterol-lowering Statin drugs (a $14 billion dollar per year class of drugs) and reducing the number of diabetics and Metabolic Syndrome patients on Medicare".  It even increased skin thickness 7.1% making skin smoother and filling in wrinkles. 

ibodi will open its first 3-4 locations in California and then expand nationally using a franchising model.  “We expect our data to be so conclusive that eventually health insurance companies will see the financial benefit of paying for memberships” says Walker.  People can join the company newsletter by participating in the Indiegogo campaign at any level.  If successful, the company is also considering using equity-crowdfunding (issuing stock) in early 2013 to complete their initial capital raise.

Here are the T-Shirts

 

 

Esitmated Perk Delivery Schedule:

Perk 1 - Nov. 2012

Perk 2 - Nov. 2012

Perk 3 - Nov. 30 2012

Perk 4 - Nov. 30 2012

Perk 5 - Nov. 30 2012

Perk 6 - Nov. 30 2012

Perk 7 - Nov. 30 2012

Perk 8 - When available after campaign ends

Perk 9 - Perks 1-6 on their schedules.  The rest after first location opens in 2013

Perk 10 - Feb 3rd 2013 Super Bowl Sunday (package delivery and event schedule details will be coordinated well in advance)
story_txt:
Imagine, a program that literally works for everyone, has incredible health and immune system benefits, only takes 20 minutes 3 times per week, and is paid for by health insurance.  That is ibodi’s mission. 
A Mission that means The End of Obesity
“We treat our cars better than our bodies”, says ibodi CEO Phil Walker.  “Because our cars come with an owner’s manual, and because of that manual we know exactly what the car needs.  ibodi is the manual for the human body and is the most complete and efficient program ever created based on human physiology”. 
Watch the video and see why the obesity crisis will not be solved with a pill, diet, or surgery.  These pseudo solutions do not address how the human body is designed. (Make sure to scroll down for before and after photos!)
Phil is living proof.  The 48 year-old former S&P 500 executive has lost 65 pounds of body fat on the program. 
The obesity crisis is currently costing $174 Billion per year, and Type 2 Diabetes is on a staggering rise.  According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, there are currently 17 million diagnosed diabetics in the US, and an estimated 7 million undiagnosed, with 79 million pre-diabetics in the pipeline.  The implications to the healthcare system and the national economy could be devastating.
ibodi will soft launch by introducing a revolutionary nutrition line on Indiegogo.  Products and Perks are offered at a deep discount and the proceeds will be used toward completing the company's initial capital raise.  ibodi, who is also a member of Start Up America, is also considering an equity crowdfunding campaign in the Spring of 2013.
The ibodi Fitness Nutrition Line:

ibodi Slim Protein Shake - Ultra low glycemic, Great Tasting, and Gluten Free
ibodi Digest - Digestive Ezymes break down food the way nature intended and improves nutritent absorption.
ibodi Probiotics - Boost the immune system and helps keep your villi clean and available for nutrient absorption (Want to know what villi are?..watch the video).
ibodi Greens - The antioxidants of 20 servings of fruits and vegetables in one little scoop.  Be honest, do you really eat enough veggies?
ibodi Multi Vitamin - Bioavailable nutrients that every cell in your body needs.
You can view our product FAQ here.
ibodi recently announced their spokesman Ron Brown, who won a gold medal in the LA Olympics and set the world record in the 4x100 relay with Carl Lewis.  Ron then joined the LA Rams and was the fastest man in the NFL, twice.  Ron joined the ibodi team because of the amazing program results, whole body approach of nutrition, and sprint based technology which anyone can do.
