story:
Help us create a 24/7 sober community and save lives!

The number one thing that helps many of us in recovery every day is a strong support network.  Many of us who have long-term sobriety see a need for a tool to supplement 12-step programs, meetings, therapy and other traditional methods of becoming and staying clean and sober.

When people are feeling isolated, disconnected and alone, they are most likely to relapse. If they are traveling, it's the middle of the night, or they are unable to realistically connect with their support system, they need to be able to reach out to someone that can help them.

With an estimated 20 million individuals in the United States living in recovery, our goal and belief is that Sober Chat will save lives, families and relationships by providing that instant support network to help people stay in recovery . 

Sober Chat is the first ever location-sensitive mobile social application designed specifically for people in recovery. It’s a way for people who share that common goal of staying in recovery by instantly connect to get the support they need. Subscribers to Sober Chat will be able to purchase the app for $0.99 per year, symbolic of the $1.00 customarily contributed at each meeting in many twelve step programs.

We have an initial design completed for the Sober Chat app. We need your help to raise the funds to finish building the app, and then to generate widespread awareness of this valuable and perhaps life-saving tool. When we launch there will be an instant community of support available for anyone in recovery feeling isolated, alone and at risk of using again.

Please make a contribution and help us reach our goal of saving lives and keep people in recovery and free from the insidious grasp of addiction. Thank you for your time, contributions and help spreading the word about Sober Chat.

What we need & what you get

We have the initial design completed for the Sober Chat app. We need your help to:

  • Fund getting the app fully built and having ongoing support for the app from our team of developers
  • Fund a professional Public Relations and Marketing campaign to raise awareness of this potentially life-saving tool to people and providers in the recovery community across the United States 
  • Spread the word through your own online and in person social media connections to anyone and everyone you can. 

The impact of your contribution

At some point in their lives, it is highly likely that everyone will be affected in some way by this insidious disease known as addiction.  This tool will help those who have made the choice to live a clean and sober life to stay in recovery, especially in times of crisis when they are most likely to relapse: late at night, when alone and isolated, and when presented with extreme emotional distress.

Some people just don't respond well to traditional treatments, and are struggling with sobriety on their own. Sober Chat can also help them have the support network to keep them from making decisions that can jeopardize their sobriety.

There are countless personal stories we could share of people we know relapsing and even dying from this disease because at that point of temptation, isolation or fear, they didn't feel they had their support network available.  Our goal is to make sure that network is always there, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

What is the risk?

There is always risk in developing for-profit mobile applications. We want to be clear about that. There is always the chance an app will not resonate with its audience.  However, every expert we've spoken with in the fields of mobile technology, mental health and addiction, as well as people living with addiction in the sober community are all immediately on board once they hear about the app and see the design for it.  We've also taken the time to speak with public relations and marketing experts who agree there is a need for the product and that they anticipate a great response.

In addition, Ken Seeley, a certified Interventionist featured regularly on A&E's critically acclaimed television show "Intervention" has not only invested his own funds to help get us to this point, but has endorsed this project because he believes it will help people stay clean and sober. Period.  Ken is a professional in the industry with a deep understanding of addiction of all kinds, and has put his support behind this project because he believes in it.  

Other ways you can help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help get the word out through your own social networks and spread the word about Sober Chat.
  • Don't forget you can use the Indiegogo share tools to help you connect with people in your online social media networks like Facebook and Twitter!

Please help us with your contributions, your time, and your voice.  Let's help keep people who choose a sobriety to remain there and stay alive.  Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Hello and thank you for taking time to read about CaNo Collection! Our names are Camille Smith and Noel Thompson and we are both 20 year old college students. Camille is from Columbus, Ohio and Noel is from Detroit, Michigan and we both are early on into our junior year at Eastern Michigan University. As enthusiasts of hair care and hair extensions, we want to create and expand a business where we can share what we know and what we’ve learned in the world of hair with consumers worldwide. We are very passionate about healthy hair, and as newly natural young women, we have discovered many ways to care for our hair through research and trial and error. We also have a passion for hair extensions, and throughout the many years we have worn hair extensions, we have discovered great quality hair. We plan to promote extensions, not only for the look, style and confidence that they give, but more so for protective styling.

  As young ladies who believe that when you look good, you feel even better we plan to give back by donating hand made wigs to people who suffer from the after affects of cancer/chemo therapy, alopecia areata, psoriasis of the scalp and any other unfortunate cause of hair loss. We have also done research, and will continue to find tips to help soothe some of those annoying side affects that can cause a woman to be self conscious or  hold them back from unleashing their inner beauty to its full potential.

  Since we are in college and on campus, we want to provide the best for our college peers who may be interested in wearing great quality hair but have never really been able to afford it. We understand how it feels to be in school and having to choose between what we want and what we actually need. With that being said, after many hours of careful planning, we have devised a way to price our hair extensions to be both affordable, as well as providing hair care tips so customers will have the chance to get the most out of the money they choose to spend with us. This campaign is very important to us because it will help us meet the start-up goals that we need and we will be able to bring forth the very best in products to our customers. As a contributor, you will help us achieve many of our start-up goals, which we will be exceptionally grateful for and you will also help us get a great start on the company that we plan to create and share with the world.

What we need & what you get

  To start off, we will need $1,500 so that we can begin to purchase the Indian Remy hair extensions. The vendor that we are purchasing hair from prices their wholesale Indian Remy hair according to the length. We only plan to start with 14” bundles which are $18 per bundle. The vendor requires that we purchase a minimum of 20 bundles in order to place an order. That will also include shipping fees as well as membership fees, so that will be about $390. The rest of the contributions will be used in purchasing packaging materials as well as cover any advertising costs. We will gradually add more lengths of Indian Remy hair extensions with hopes to expand to more illustrious textures such as Brazilian, Malaysian, Peruvian and other virgin and raw textures. When we see that our small business is moving forward people will naturally become more and more interested thus fulfilling our dreams and the hopes of all of those who invest and believe in said dream.

Example:

20 bundles  of the Indian Remy extensions will cost about $18 per bundle to purchase wholesale. That is about $360 for 20 bundles of the Indian Remy hair texture in ONE length (14 inches).

The average amount of bundles that a person may use is about 3 to 4 bundles.

That means 20 bundles of hair can be bought by about 5 to 6 people and we would have to continue to purchase more bundles of hair wholesale to meet the needs of consumers and to be consistent.

More of what is contributed to us will be spent on great products for the care of the hair extensions, including, weft sealant, argan oil, etc. We will also offer our customers custom coloring at an extra price so hair dye would be another product that would be covered from the contributions that we receive from you.

We also plan to set up a simple website that is easy to navigate and will allow for stress-free ordering of our products.

Perks:

There will be perks to contributing and supporting our dream! It can be anything from discounts on hair and products, great and researched advice on healthy hair care, and gifts! And of course, you will stay updated on the progress of our business (we will NEVER forget those who’ve helped or even just supported).

If we don’t reach our entire goal, we will still use the money given to us to take care of the things that we need. We don’t give up easily; we will probably begin a new campaign!

Glossary

Natural hair: allowing hair to grow in its natural state without the alteration of harsh chemicals (relaxers, dyes, perms, etc.)

Protective styling: styling one’s hair in a way where it prevents damage and protects the hair from the elements of everyday life.

Bundle or bundles of hair: Wefted hair of a certain length rolled neatly to create a bundle, or roll.

Raw hair extensions: pure virgin hair; cut off and NOT chemically treated; comes from one donor, so one bundle of hair is from one donor; comes free of lice and thoroughly washed; it is cuticle aligned hair, meaning the cuticles of the hair are still intact (no matting & tangling); there are more consistent pieces and pieces are going to match in colors and in texture; it is REAL & ALIVE HAIR (can develop split ends, etc); very high grade of that costs more than regular virgin hair but lasts longer; can be worn repeatedly; has a very natural look and can easily blend with any hair texture; can be cut, dyed, relaxed/permed, straightened, curled, washed; longevity depends on the maintenance


The Impact

Your contribution to our small, start-up business will make a great difference because we want to provide the very best to our customers at an affordable price. Once again, we understand how it feels to be college students, so offering this as an on campus business will help those who have always wanted great quality hair to purchase this affordable hair, while at the same time boosting any self-confidence that they may need/want.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t necessarily mean they cannot help us out. Please just re-post our link! We appreciate all of the support that we receive and even those that take the time to read about our story!

Please get the word out and help us achieve our dream!

Thanks to everyone that took the time to ready our story!

story:
Kylie was diagnosed with a rare cancer in 2011.  She underwent 42 weeks of intensive chemo therapy and radiation treatment.  During Chemo treatment Kylie would constantly get tangled up with the wires which attached to the I.V. pole and drip controller.  Her Dr's office had lots of fun things to do but due to the I.V. pole and wires/tubes she was limited in mobility. 

KYLiE'S iNVENTiON:

This year Kylie was challenged with coming up with an invention through her school and the CT Invention Convention.  Kylie immediately knew what she wanted to invent.  A backpack that could allow children some mobility while receiving I.V. treatments or infusions. 

Kylie's backpack couldn't be just any backpack.  Because of the fasionista that she is, these would have to be colorful, gender specific, and awesome.  She went to work and with the help from her parents designed a backpack.

The design incorporated an I.V. pole with a drip bag protection cage.  Kids want to move around and we can't risk the Medicine bags getting punctured or compressed.  This cage is customizable with different shapes, like hearts, peace signs, etc.  This also makes treatment less scary.  I.V. poles are very intimidating to young children.  The protection cage is also removable and can be replaced with a child's choice of design. 

The backpack also has the I.V. controller built into the bag to control the flow rate.  It is powered by battery which most I.V. machines on a pole are also battery operated. 

UCONN iNVENTION CONVENTiON

Kylie's invention was chosen by her middle school teachers, among others, to attend the UCONN Invention Convention where over 700 inventions were displayed selected for awards and recognition.  Amazingly, Kylie's invention received four awards including the "Patent Award", the highest award at the convention.  She even received the only standing ovation of the night.  The Patent Award has allowed Kylie's invention to be submitted to the US Patent & Trademark Office with the sponsor covering all costs.  The lawyers have submitted the provisional patent application.

WHY KYLiE NEEDS FUNDiNG

Kylie is determined to make this a reality and see the I.V. backpack in children's hospitals throughout the U.S., maybe throughout the world.  Unfortunately, it requires an enormous amount of money to make a prototype of this backpack.  The controller will need to be customized to be mobile and also small enough to fit in a backpack.  So Kylie needs your help to make this a reality. 

Please help Kylie reach her goal.  You can learn more about Kylie on Facebook if you search for "Courage For Kylie", her facebook page for support while she was receiving treatment.

shapes, like hearts, peace signs, etc.  This also makes treatment less

protection cage is also removable and can be replaced with a child's 
choice of design.  


The backpack also has the I.V. controller 
built into the bag to control the flow rate.  It is powered by battery 
which most I.V. machines on a pole are also battery operated. 
UCONN iNVENTION CONVENTiON
Kylie's
 invention was chosen by her middle school teachers, among others, to 
attend the UCONN Invention Convention where over 700 inventions were 
displayed selected for awards and recognition.  Amazingly, Kylie's 
invention received four awards including the "Patent Award", the highest
 award at the convention.  She even received the only standing ovation 
of the night.  

The Patent Award has allowed Kylie's invention to be submitted to the US Patent & Trademark Office with the sponsor covering all costs.  The lawyers have submitted the provisional patent application.WHY KYLiE NEEDS FUNDiNGKylie is determined to make this a reality and see the I.V. backpack in children's hospitals throughout the U.S., maybe throughout the world.  Unfortunately, it requires an enormous amount of money to make a prototype of this backpack.  The controller will need to be customized to be mobile and also small enough to fit in a backpack.  So Kylie needs your help to make this a reality.  Please help Kylie reach her goal.  You can learn more about Kylie on Facebook if you search for "Courage For Kylie", her facebook page for support while she was receiving treatment.

story:
Nurses Who Vaccinate is becoming Not-For-Profit! Help us achieve this goal of applying for 501(3)(c)

What is Nurses Who Vaccinate?
  • Nurses Who Vaccinate is a member-based organization comprised of nurses, doctors, health-care providers and immunization advocates. We work to advocate and educate about the importance of vaccination in the workplace, community & social media. Started by Melody Butler, a pediatric Registered Nurse, she saw the need for such an organization to exist to support pro-science evidence-based healthcare professionals. You can read more about the motivation to start NWV here on their blog post, A Pediatric Nurse's Quest to Dispel Vaccine Information (The Need for Nurses Who Vaccinate)
  • Nurses Who Vaccinate is seeking your assistance to help us become a nonprofit organization. Since 2011, we have promoted knowledge and competency in immunizations and worked to position nurses and health care professionals as vaccine advocates for colleagues, patients, and the public. By becoming a NFP it opens the door for more opportunities and partnerships to protect our communities from vaccine-preventable diseases.
  • By supporting our mission, you're helping us to continue the education, advocacy and important work being done by vaccine advocates all over the world to protect you and your loved ones from diseases like polio, measles, and influenza, to name a few. 

Why We Need Your Help!

  • This campaign seeks your help in acquiring the funds to set up the nonprofit organization including all necessary federal and state filing fees and professional services including legal and accounting fees. 
  • All funds raised will be dedicated to the formation of the nonprofit organization and any excess funds raised will be held on deposit until the organization's nonprofit status is approved by the Internal Revenue Service. Remaining funds will be used to fund running services such as the website, communication and maintenance fees.
  • Recently our organization has been threatened by those who oppose life-saving vaccines. Funds would be reserved to counter these bulling tactics. 

Together We Can Do So Much More!

  • Nurses Who Vaccinate is open to all for membership. You, (yes you!) can help protect others from vaccine-preventable diseases with education and advocacy.
  • You can become a member, right now! Then you can be a part of this exciting organization and help us to serve you and your community even better! Click here for more information.
  • Why did we choose the amount for $4320 as our fund-raising goal? Every 20 seconds a child dies from a vaccine-preventable disease. That amounts to 4,320 children dying everyday from a preventable death, had they had the access to vaccines or been protected by a community with a high community immunity level. There are 4,320 children we can be saving from suffering and dying. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you can't contribute, but that doesn’t mean you still can’t help!

  • Help us get the word out! Share this on your blog and social media platforms. Tag us when you do! Twitter/Pinterest/Instagram- @NursesWhoVax 
    Find us on Facebook- https://www.facebook.com/NursesWhoVaccinate
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

We thank you for reading this far down. We also thank you for any help and support you provide, no matter how small!

story:
Do you want to avoid nutritional deficiencies and feel your best?

Medical studies show that majority of people need supplemental vitamins and minerals. However, several recent reports have indicated that many common multivitamins do not work (*).

We are a team of scientists who have discovered and created a solution to this problem.


Why common multivitamins do not work?

There are three main reasons why common multivitamins do not work:

A solution

BT is a new daily vitamin regimen that gives your body the nutritional benefits that multivitamins are supposed to deliver, but can’t.  

Though convenient, all-in-one multivitamins combine ingredients that either can’t be digested together or actually cancel one another out. The net effect is sub-optimal nutrition and negative impact on mood and energy.  

Developed by scientists, BT groups ingredients by their synergy and provides supplements for the body’s three unique daily phases:  Energy in the Morning.  Sustained nutrition during the Day.  Relaxation in the Evening. 



BT accounts for many interactions between vitamins and minerals as well as for interactions between vitamins and minerals with meals commonly eaten at the specific time of day.


BT is complete and effective

In BT three formulas together contain all the micronutrients that your body needs every day: vitamins, minerals, omega-3 fish oil, CoQ10, Cal/Mag, and herbal/fruit blend of antioxidants. All the ingredients are grouped according to the synergy between them. When using BT you save money and get better results compared to taking these five products individually!







Who needs BT?

BT was created for adults, both men and women. It would benefit anyone who wants to feel more energetic and balanced during the day and more relaxed at night. BT is for busy people who want to feed their bodies well, but do not have time to do all the required planning and cooking.

Our Story

Our company was founded in 2011 by Natalia Lukina. Natalia is a scientist who holds MSc degree in Biology from Caltech and 2-year professional Drug Discovery and Development certification from UCSD. Natalia has studied nutrition, supplements and herbal medicine for over fifteen years.

In 2012 Natalia has partnered with NJ-based contract manufacturing company and produced a test run of BT. 

With the help of your funding we want to bring BT to a much wider audience and help more people experience the benefits of balanced nutritional support.


How will your funding help us

Your funding will help us manufacture a production run of BT. You will get to experience the benefits of taking BT and we will be able to share this wellness and knowledge with more people.

Please support us by contributing to our campaign and by sharing it with your friends!


Timeline


We expect to fulfill our IndieGoGo orders by August 2014. Delays are unlikely, but possible and we promise to keep our backers aware of every step in the manufacturing and fulfillment process.


For International Supporters

For supporters outside the United States, please add $10 to $30 order, $20 to $60 order, $30 to $110 order and $50 to any order of $300 or more. We'll ship it by air mail at the same time as all other orders. If there are any customs charges, you will be responsible for them. Thank you!

story:
What is Longevity Cookbook?

Aging steals away your most valuable resource: time. The Longevity Cookbook is a strategy guide to help you get more time to experience the joy from everything that you like in life. Take yourself on a journey starting with nutrients and exercise regimes that goes on to explore the usage of genetically modified symbiotic organisms and using gene therapy to boost your own longevity.  

Why wait until the body has broken down to fix it? Longevity Cookbook helps you repair and proactively prevent damage caused by the ongoing aging process.

Knowing your body, being able to recognize when something is wrong, and having the tools to fix it, is what the Longevity Cookbook is about.


Why a cookbook? How does this relate to longevity?

Most importantly, we want to draw attention to an overlooked problem whose time has come: aging.  In recent decades, we have begun to understand how to use changes in nutrition and lifestyle to extend the healthiest years of life.  At the same time, findings in the lab have shown that it may someday be possible to greatly extend our maximum lifespan, and our quality of life as we age.  This could happen sooner than you might think!

Any ambition to live longer than the historical human maximum lifespan of ~120 years will require a complex approach, that is not yet fully understood.  It's possible that by modestly improving our health, and rolling back the clock using improvements to nutrition and lifestyle, such as those to be outlined in the Longevity Cookbook, we may live long enough to reap the benefits of revolutionary interventions that are currently still in the lab.  With this thinking in mind, in the book we'll outline some of the most promising experiments that are currently underway or being proposed. 

If we really want to live longer, we can’t concentrate all our prospects in one place. Our goal in the Longevity Cookbook is to tell you about many of the promising available options that could one day lead to huge changes in how we age, and to bring them to life.


Did you know that ...

There are animals in nature that age very slowly. For instance, Brandt's bat, and the naked mole rat, live many times longer than closely related species.


The drug Metformin has been shown to make type 2 diabetic patients live longer than matched healthy people who do not receive the drug.  What might metformin do in healthy humans?

Your gut bacteria in part determine whether you are skinny or fat.

Diet impacts how our genes work. Our health and longevity depend on that. We can affect 2 molecular aging mechanisms by diet. These are the insulin-like growth factor 1 pathway, and the mTOR pathway, which blocks cell clean-up from damaged proteins.

Aging is regulated by the nervous system. Reducing inflammation in the hypothalamus boosted mouse longevity by 20%.

We'll tell you much more in the Longevity Cookbook!

Why now? Why us?

We can’t wait for the next generation to defeat aging. It might be too late. We have to act now.

In many ways, the Longevity Cookbook is meant to act as a catalyst.  Recent findings in the science of aging suggest that pharmaceutical interventions that could extend human lifespan will be here in years, not decades.  This project is one of many experiments in how to best engage and recruit enthusiastic supporters of the idea of slowing aging and thus delaying the now-inevitable diseases of aging, such as Alzheimer's, cancer, and heart disease.  We hope to share some of what is happening at the cutting edge of aging research, how this research will help defeat aging, as well as actionable suggestions on nutrition and lifestyle that you can use now.


Is Longevity Cookbook a book for me?

If you care about your own life and lives of your kids – Longevity Cookbook is for you.

Longevity Cookbook is not the next popular diet, it is the ultimate review of everything that science knows about longevity and food and lifestyle influence on health and life expectancy. This information is not just interesting but very useful from a practical perspective. By following our easy recommendations, you will enjoy your healthy life longer.

If you care about surrounding world and want to make it better, then Longevity Cookbook is your book. By helping us write it, you are getting not only a practical longevity guide, but also an open road to new scientific research in life extension.



Perks

$35 - Be the coolest kid on the block - get an awesome Longevity T-shirt to amaze your friends! You will also receive the electronic version of the Longevity Cookbook. Add $10 for shipping outside the US.

$80 - You will get a beautifully designed Longevity Hoodie that highlights the awesomeness of the person wearing it. You will also be thanked in your copy of Longevity e-Cookbook delivered to the device of your choice. Two design options available. Check the campaign page to choose which one you like most of all. You will also definitely spread the word of your awesomeness on various social media. Please, remember to add $10 for shipping outside the US.


Why are we using crowdfunding?

This is an independent project. We don’t represent any investors. Our research is absolutely independent, and our conclusions don’t depend on investor’s opinions and beliefs. We will arm you with objective and relevant information on life extension. That’s why traditional funding is not for us.

Longevity Cookbook has a humanitarian mission. We believe that everybody has a right for a long and happy life, regardless of their nationality, age and income. Our goal is not only to make your life and the lives of your loved ones better, but to do this for all the people on Earth. After the book is written we are going to translate it into different languages in order for it to be accessible to as many people around the world as possible.


Meet the team

Maria Konovalenko

Hi! I'm Maria. I'm studying biology of aging in a joint Ph.D. program between the University of Southern California and the Buck Institute. My background is in molecular biological physics. I’m 29 and I am a fighter for longevity! The last 7 years of my life were dedicated to this fight. Now is the time when I can contribute my passion and expertise to helping everybody make their lives better, healthier and muuuuuuuuch-much longer.


Steve Aoki

You and I have a problem. It’s aging. Aging is slowly killing every person. We have to solve this problem, otherwise we will all die. How can we do it? Obviously with the help of science. But what kind of research has the power to cure aging? This is what Longevity Cookbook is going to tell you. The best scientists united to explain how to defeat aging. Longevity Cookbook will also tell you what kind of food is the best to live longer and healthier from scientific standpoint. Let’s defeat aging together. Support Longevity Cookbook!


Anna Kozlova

Hi! I'm Anna. I'm 34 and absolutely love my life.  Being a chemist, I understand that there are no physical laws prohibiting us to stop aging. Our bodies are intricate molecular machines that can be modified at our will. I believe that technology will bring us a happier and more meaningful life, colonization of other planets and friendly AI. But to do all this we need to extend our healthspan first. Let's do it together!

Mark McCormick

I'm a postdoctoral researcher studying the basic biology of aging.  I think that projects like the Longevity Cookbook can help bridge an important gap, by translating what we do every day in the lab into a format that's fun and accessible for a large and well-informed audience.  Science is not done in a vacuum, and as researchers we work best when we engage the broadest audience of people who are enthusiastic about scientific progress in our fields.  It's my hope that participating in the Longevity Cookbook will help move aging research in this direction.


How are we going to spend the funds?

We intend to spend 70% of all of the money collected to fund bioinformatic meta-analysis to inform our recommendations. Top aging bioinformaticians will analyze hundreds of scientific articles and attempt to distill the information into scientifically supported, yet easily understandable, results. Translating the existing scientific literature into actionable suggestions allows all of us to begin to benefit from the research, today.

The remaining 30% of the funds will be spent on the actual production of the book itself: full-color illustrations, photographs, and publishing costs. We want you to be aware of not only what, when and how to eat, but also how these food products promote our molecular longevity mechanisms.


FAQ

- When will the Longevity Cookbook be published?

Our goal is to deliver the book within one year of completing our funding campaign by summer 2016.

- What are the possible issues with getting the book published?

The greatest challenge that we see is the bioinformatic analysis taking longer than anticipated. Just because it involves quite a bit of programming and is itself a sophisticated intellectual task, there is a chance that we won’t be able to finish the book in 12 months after completing the crowdfunding campaign. This chance is slim, and we will be keeping everyone up to date on the progress of the project by posting frequent updates on the website. Any possible delay won’t come as a surprise and will be addressed by outsourcing additional specialists as necessary.

- How can I stay in touch and see what’s happening with the writing?

Click here to subscribe to our email list for continuous updates, exclusive information, and progress updates.


Join the Longevity movement!

Here’s how you can help:

Tell your friends about the Longevity Cookbook and send them here, now. Please, share the campaign on all social networks. Spreading the word gets you closer to your longevity!

Support the Trend

Every Wednesday and Friday at 4 pm EST, we will tweet #LongevityCookbook to make it a trend. For it to work, we need your help! Please follow us and retweet the message. Together, we’ll inspire the world.

story:
Short Summary

The Intercultural Outreach Initiative is working to replace mercury filled thermometers and blood pressure devices with safer, more modern equipment on Isabela in the Galapagos.

What is the issue, problem or challenge?

In Isabela, Galapagos mercury based equipment is still commonly used. Mercury is a heavy metal that accumulates in the body and can cause a range of health problems including brain, kidney and digestive damage. Mercury based thermometers and blood pressure devices have the potential to break and spill. The liquid mercury evaporates easily into the air, even at room temperature, to form mercury vapor creating a dangerous inhalation hazard.

How will the project solve this problem?

By supplying the hospital on Isabela with alternatives to mercury based thermometers the risk of detrimental effects of mercury poisoning on Isabela’s citizens will decrease exponentially.


What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise three automatic blood pressure monitors at the price of $126,66 each ($379,98 for three), two adult oximeters $80,- each ($160.- for two) and one digital gun thermometer at the price of $140,- making it a total of $679,98 for all the equipment. An additional $120,- is needed for transport and packaging bringing the final total to $799,98. These medical devices will be used in the only health center available on Isabela island.

If we don't reach our goal of $800,- we will use what was donated to buy as much equipment as the total donation allows. 

The Impact

Replacing this outdated and dangerous equipment on Isabela, Galapagos is an important step in the work to modernize the hospital and improve the islands healthcare for all its citizens. 

Risks & Challenges

It will be a challenge getting the equipment safely from the mainland to the island of Isabela as logistics from Ecuador mainland are always a challenge. The Galapagos Islands are 800 miles off the coast of south America in the Pacific Ocean.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign with your friends and family and inform them why this campaign is so important to the health center of Isabela.
story_txt:
Short Summary


The Intercultural Outreach Initiative is working to replace
mercury filled thermometers and blood pressure devices with safer, more modern
equipment on Isabela in the Galapagos.
What is the issue, problem or challenge?
In Isabela, Galapagos mercury based equipment is still commonly
used. Mercury is a heavy metal that accumulates in the body and can cause a
range of health problems including brain, kidney and digestive damage. Mercury
based thermometers and blood pressure devices have the potential to break and
spill. The liquid mercury evaporates easily into the air, even at room
temperature, to form mercury vapor creating a dangerous inhalation hazard. 
How will the project solve this problem?
By supplying the hospital on Isabela with alternatives to
mercury based thermometers the risk of detrimental effects of mercury poisoning
on Isabela’s citizens will decrease exponentially.


What We Need & What You Get

 

We are aiming to raise three automatic blood
pressure monitors at the price of $126,66 each ($379,98 for three), two adult
oximeters $80,- each ($160.- for two) and one digital gun thermometer at the price
of $140,- making it a total of $679,98 for all the equipment. An additional
$120,- is needed for transport and packaging bringing the final total to $799,98. These medical devices will be used in the only health center available on Isabela island.
If we don't reach our goal of $800,- we will use what was donated to buy as much equipment as the total donation allows. 
   The Impact Replacing this outdated and dangerous equipment on Isabela, Galapagos is an important step in the work to modernize the hospital and improve the islands healthcare for all its citizens.    Risks & Challenges It will be a challenge getting the equipment safely from the mainland to the island of Isabela as logistics from Ecuador mainland are always a challenge. The Galapagos Islands are 800 miles off the coast of south America in the Pacific Ocean.   Other Ways You Can Help Share our campaign with your friends and family and inform them why this campaign is so important to the health center of Isabela.

story:
Just nineteen days to go! We are off to a good start. Please support today. 

The Holistic Sound Technology program, based in Royal Oak, Michigan, USA, is looking for support so we can create Downloads and a professional full length CD of the 9 Solfeggio frequencies that have been known to benefit humans as well as plant organisms with sound therapy. 

The original Solfeggio frequencies have the capacity to heal you in miraculous ways. In ancient times they were sung in the Gregorian chants during religious ceremonies in churches of that time period. Unfortunately, around 1050 AD, they mysteriously disappeared, presumably lost forever. Cymatic research shows how these frequencies create beautiful symmetrical patterns that are found in biological life forms. It is believed that listening to them can repair DNA and assist in balancing the chakras. 

Months of research has already gone into this project, studying scientific documentation, reviewing cymatic experiments and mastering the technique to create specific frequencies to benefit health. 

Our first project is The Solfeggio Collection. We want to create quality recordings of the 9 Solfeggio frequencies for a duration of 7 minutes each. You can listen to these frequencies with or without headphones, although headphones at a comfortably low volume is recommended.  

They can be played while meditating, sleeping, studying, doing chores or exercising. But one is cautioned not to drive, operate machinery or perform tasks that could possibly result in injury because most people experience a trance like state while listening to the frequencies. 

Your support will help us acquire the proper equipment, studio time, CD artwork and duplication to complete this project. And you get to benefit from listening to them. 

  • 174 – reduce pain
  • 285 – influence energy fields
  • 396 – turn grief into joy
  • 417 – facilitate change
  • 528 – transformation & miracles
  • 639 – reconnecting, relationships
  • 741 – expressions/solutions
  • 852 – return to spiritual order
  • 963 – awaken perfect state

Thank you for you interest and support. Namaste.

Holistic Sound Technology Group

story:
>>    Please find the english version below the French one!   

Cap sur l’Everest !

Tahar Manaï souhaite devenir le 1er Tunisien à gravir l'Everest, 8848 m d'altitude, en mai prochain.

Plus que ça, il souhaite inspirer et fédérer la jeunesse tunisienne autour de valeurs telles que le dépassement de soi, le rêve, le travail, l'ambition.

A travers son rêve d'atteindre le plus haut sommet du monde, Tahar souhaite montrer à la jeune génération dont il est issu que rien n'est impossible à qui ose rêver, travailler dur pour atteindre son but.

1 an et demi de préparation, 15 ans de travail et d'expérience du monde de l'alpinisme pour finalement s'attaquer au plus haut sommet du monde à 26 ans, venant lui-même d'un pays où la plus haute montagne culmine à 1544 m.

Ce pompier professionnel de Massy, originaire de Sousse, va en étonner plus d'un par sa détermination, sa discipline et sa bravoure !

Sa première tentative sur l’Everest a démarré le 30/03/2015, par un vol au départ Katmandou jusqu'à Lukla (Népal). Si le séisme du 25 avril dernier a obligé Tahar a rebrousser chemin, le jeune alpiniste est d’ores et déjà reparti en préparation physique pour retenter son assaut dès avril 2016…

Projet "de cœur et de valeurs" au bénéfice de la Tunisie et des jeunes générations -le "Rêve" ne connait pas de frontières-, aidez-nous à mener à bien ce défi hors norme !

La Tunisie, seul pays du Maghreb encore non représenté sur le Toit du Monde, détient un potentiel incroyable pour réaliser de grandes choses, notamment à travers sa jeunesse.

Le rêve est à portée de main.

Nous pouvons ici marquer l'Histoire !

#latunisieausommet #lascensiondunenation 

Embarquez-avec nous pour cette aventure hors-pair qui relève autant de l'exploit sportif que de la volonté d'un jeune de 27 ans à hisser haut et fort les couleurs de sa Nation sur le toit du monde !

Pourquoi une nouvelle campagne ?

Tout d'abord, nous voulons remercier nos contributeurs de la première campagne pour avoir cru en nous. Votre soutien moral, spirituel ou financier depuis le début de l'aventure nous a permis d'avancer, de continuer à travailler pour toucher du doigt notre but.

Une telle campagne de crowdfunding est un travail d'équipe : famille, amis, collègues, connaissances ou même généreux donateurs, vous avez rendu tout cela possible ! Vous savez tous que pour aller au bout du projet, nous avons besoin de continuer à récolter des fonds.

Ces dernières semaines, nous avons reçu de nombreux emails nous proposant de l'aide pour cette nouvelle saison. Comme nous n'avons pas encore de sponsors prenant en charge la totalité du budget de la nouvelle expédition, nous avons décidé d'accepter votre soutien une nouvelle fois afin que Tahar puisse rester concentré sur son but : atteindre le sommet de l'Everest vers la mi-mai 2016.

Il n'y a rien de plus fort que la détermination collective pour réaliser de grandes choses !

"Compte tenu de l'enthousiasme, de l'énergie partagée avec les internautes lorsque j'étais en Argentine en train de gravir le sommet de l'Aconcagua, ou au Népal en avril dernier, l'expérience de 2016 ne peut être qu'époustouflante !

Ensemble, nous pouvons réaliser ce rêve et ainsi inspirer d'autres jeunes à poursuivre les leurs !"

Tahar Manaï

Heading for Mt. Everest!

Tahar Manaï’s goal is to become the 1st Tunisian to climb Mt. Everest by May, 2016.

He aims to inspire and connect with Tunisian youth to help them understand the value of their will to surpassoneself, to dream, to believe in hardwork and ambition by sharing his own dream of climbing the highest summit of the world.

Tahar wants to show the young generation there is no limitations and nothing is impossible to those who dare to dream and work hard to achieve their goals. You just need to believe in yourself, the rest is determination!

A year and a half of preparation, 15 years of practice and the experience of alpinism gave him the ability to rise up to the challenge to climb the Mt. Everest, the highest summit of the world in May... Coming from a country where the highest mountain peak is no more than 1544 m above sea level, this is the edge he has been training for all this time.

This young profesionnal fireman of Massy (near Paris) native from Sousse, Tunisia, has amazed so many with his determination, self-discipline and genuine bravery ! 

Tahar’s first expedition onto Mt. Everest began last March, 30th 2015, flying from Kathmandu to Lukla (Nepal). Stopped right in the middle of his first attempt by the earthquake which stroke the country last April, 25th, Tahar has already started out his physical preparation to renew his ascent in April 2016…

Our dream is within reach.

We can write History here!

#tunisiaontop #theriseofanation

Get on board for a thrilling adventure, a true inspirational story of a young Tunisian man with an astonishing will and determination to climb up the colors of his native nation to the "Top of the World"!

What is the purpose of this new campaign?

First and foremost, we personally thank our first contributors for believing in us. Their emotional, spiritual and financial support given to us from the beginning made it all possible.

A strong campaign is made up of a team such as family, friends and the community that support the cause but as you all know,  what is also required is continued financial support.

The pass few weeks we have received many emails offering donations to the cause and since we do not have sponsors at this time for this new season coming up, we have decided to graciously accept the support of the community once again.  

Although this is our second campaign, your generous donations will enable Tahar to carry on and stay focus on his goal which is to reach the summit of Mt. Everest by mid-May 2016.

There is nothing stronger than the collective determination to make extraordinary things happen!

"Considering the enthusiasm, the energy we shared together when I climbed Mt. Aconcagua, Argentina, in December 2014, and Mont Everest last April 2015, this 2016 new ascent cannot be anything  but amazing! 

Together, we can realize this dream and inspire others to manifest their own dreams!"

Tahar Manaï

story:
Active: progress; motion; causing change; capable of exerting influence

PortRyde will base our studio on the definition of active.

Progress - whether it be working towards a goal or just feeling good about yourself

Causing change - making the decision for a positive and healthy change in your life

Capable of exerting influence - a positive and active individual influences others to be and do the same

PortRyde is not just another cycling studio - it's a small studio built around the students first, followed by the instructors. We will have 11 rentable bikes in our studio and we're excited about the intimate class sizes, which will help us focus on motivation and simply feeling good about ourselves. 

GRAND OPENING:
Mid-November 2014

OUR BIKES:
This is NOT just another indoor cycling studio. PortRyde is featuring RealRyder® Bikes, the only bike on the market that offers multi-planar movement, providing riders with greater functional training and metabolic benefits that you simpy cannot be achieved on a traditional, one-dimensional bike. It's fun. It's function and we're first to offer this incredible workout to the great people of Portsmouth!

A great article about RealRyder® bikes:
http://minnesota.cbslocal.com/2011/11/21/stationary-biking-evolves-to-the-next-level/

Two great videos of our bikes:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3sjomTJtsuY
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-baY2R3eGc4

Read more about our bikes in the media: 

http://www.realryder.com/media/in-the-media.cfm

LOCATION:
PortRyde will be located inside the "Balance" gym in downtown Portsmouth, NH. While we will be independent of "Balance," we hope to create an environment where we can help each other grow. Our studio will include a men's and women's bathroom/locker room, a waiting area, and access to free parking.

STUDIO:
Our studio is small, dark, and has a cozy yet explosive feeling. We'll provide you with a bottle of water, a towel, and we'll turn the music up loud enough for you to forget all of your daily stressors and allow you to focus on your goals.

FEES:
Our class fees are very competitive and will hopefully allow our students to continue coming back. We will offer single-ride and multiple-ride punch card options to help accommodate everyone. The "perks" offered through this campaign are the best value.

SCHEDULE:
As of now our schedule is still in the works but we plan on holding 16-22, 45min classes per week; start times ranging from 5am to 7pm. We hope to involve all of our students in shaping our schedule, based on your wants/needs. 

INSTRUCTORS:
We currently have 12, Seacoast based instructors ready to begin motivating you on a daily basis. Each instructor will bring something unique to the studio and I promise you will be excited to ride with them.

RESERVING A BIKE:
This campaign will help us establish our online presence and utilize software that will allow our riders to reserve their class spots via the web. Students will also have the ability to monitor and control their ride "balance" online. We're talking about magic stuff on the internet!

FUNDS DISBURSEMENT:
What are we going to do with all that money? It will help with the cost of the bikes, the design of the studio and website, install a killer stereo system, and enable us to open our doors in mid-November, 2014.

story:
JOIN THE CAUSE 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION CAN HELP

MAKE A DIFFERENCE

WHAT IF I CAN'T CONTRIBUTE MYSELF BUT WANT TO HELP THE CAMPAIGN ? 

Even if you can't purchase a heavily discounted subscription for yourself or donate one to a person with mental health issues who don't have the means , You can still provide your contribution by sharing this campaign on social media and to friends, family, and colleagues. Your sharing may lead to other contributions.

I HAVE A QUESTION, HOW MAY I REACH YOU?

Twitter is our preferred method of communication.

Ask anything from Alireza @ALIRDehghan and Noel @Borg74 .

We promise every single question gets answered so don't be shy and tweet at us .

remember to use relevant hashtags as below, maybe your question is also someone else's, let them find it.

#SARAHthetherapist

#Mentalhealth

#Mentalhealthawareness

#Healthtech

#Crowdfunding

#Indiegogo

 

For media inquires only use the following email to contact Alireza Dehghan , Founder and CEO of SARAH AI.

Alirezadehghanshiraz@gmail.com

story:
Our Story

My son Cody has an extremely rare Kidney disease called mpgn type 3. He is 20 yrs. old and has no ins. I'm a single father of 2 and cannot get him ins. due to his age and disease. The transplant doctor wont see him till he has ins. or the funds for the procedure. This should not happen in america but the sad reality is that the poor are allowed to die in this country. My son has a bright future, provided he's allowed to live it.

The Impact

The impact of my campaign is literally life or death.

What We Need & What You Get

As this procedure unfolds I will keep all contributers informed on Facebook or via e-mails what ever you would like. Reciepts for doctors and all procedures and medications, will be made public to all contributers, or annonymous donations will be respected. Any help will be appreciated there is no amount to small it will all add up. The upside for contributers will not only be the satisfaction of saving a life but the life you save you will be able to follow for the rest of his or yours so thats where you'll see your investment devolope and progress for him and his future contributions to society. Please save my sons life!

Other Ways You Can Help

Doctors who can contribute there skills in this field as a contribution of time will also help us reach our goals.
story_txt:
Our Story
My son Cody has an extremely rare Kidney disease called mpgn type 3. He is 20 yrs. old and has no ins. I'm a single father of 2 and cannot get him ins. due to his age and disease. The transplant doctor wont see him till he has ins. or the funds for the procedure. This should not happen in america but the sad reality is that the poor are allowed to die in this country. My son has a bright future, provided he's allowed to live it.


The Impact
The impact of my campaign is literally life or death.


What We Need & What You Get
As this procedure unfolds I will keep all contributers informed on Facebook or via e-mails what ever you would like. Reciepts for doctors and all procedures and medications, will be made public to all contributers, or annonymous donations will be respected. Any help will be appreciated there is no amount to small it will all add up. The upside for contributers will not only be the satisfaction of saving a life but the life you save you will be able to follow for the rest of his or yours so thats where you'll see your investment devolope and progress for him and his future contributions to society. Please save my sons life!

story:
Global Health in Calcutta

I am currently a fourth year medical student with a passion for global health and a love for the people and land of India. This spring I will travel to Calcutta for 8 weeks to join an organization which serves the underprivileged. 

In Calcutta and other parts of West Bengal, nearly 4 million people live below the poverty line and 2.5 million live on the streets and slums. This spring, I will be joining an organization to provide medical care to mothers and infants in a mother infant clinic in Calcutta. This clinic provides ante and post natal care to mothers and also provides feeding programs for malnourished children. It also provides mother and child check-ups, immunizations, and family planning.

The money I raise from this campaign will help me to afford the plane ticket and expenses of my stay in Calcutta, allowing me to give my time.

story:
Camp HLC: A free camp, May 3-5 at Fairview YMCA for children and grandchildren of ALS patients ages 6-21.

Camp HLC is an opportunity for children to unite with other children who understand what it is like to have a parent or relative battling ALS.  The theme of the camp is FUN.  The children will get to engage in age-appropriate activities such as campfire sing- a longs to candle making and zip line adventures.  Any questions regarding the camp can be send to hopelovescompany@gmail.com or contact HLC's Founder, Jodi O'Donnell-Ames at 609-280-1905.  

Campers will be accompanied by camp staff at all times.  A volunteer nurse and counselor will also be present.  This will be an amazing weekend not to be missed.

All funding raised on Indiegogo will support a child's camp experience and you contribution is tax deductible.

Hope Loves Company is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing both emotional and educational support to children and young adults who have parents or family members living with ALS.

Hope Loves Company is the result of raising three children who learned about ALS (or Lou Gehrig's Disease) as young children. HLC’s Founder, Jodi O’Donnell, lost her husband, Kevin Gerard O'Donnell, in 2001 after heroically battled ALS from 1995 until 2001. Their daughter Alina was almost three when Kevin was diagnosed and eight when he passed. Alina did not understand why her daddy was different and Kevin and Jodi watched painfully as Alina noticed and adjusted to many changes brought about by ALS:

  • Kevin relied on a wheelchair and could no longer play soccer with Alina the way he once did.
  • Kevin was eventually ventilator dependent and paralyzed so he could no longer travel to Alina’s school functions easily.
  • Kevin lost his ability to speak so Alina learned to follow his facial expressions and body language to communicate with him.
  • Jodi was very busy as a caregiver to Kevin and as a result, missed time and memories with Alina.
  • Alina did not know any other children who had a sick Daddy and this upset her.

Soon after Kevin lost his battle with ALS, Jodi began working as Director of Communications at the ALS Hope Foundation in Philadelphia.  She ordered a children’s book, What Did You Learn Today? for each family who attended their Family Fun Day at Waterloo Gardens in Exton, PA.

The book was written by Tina Singer Ames who lived six months with ALS.  Her widower Warren and their children Nora and Adam attended the Fun Day at Waterloo and brought 50 copies of the book to share with others.

The two families became friends and enjoyed spending time together.In 2003, Jodi married Warren Ames and became Jodi O’Donnell-Ames.  Nora, Adam and Alina were the happy bridal party!

ALS has united both families in loss, love and hope. They live each day with hope for an ALS cure and the purpose to help other families who, like they, know ALS all too well. Not a day goes by without remembering Kevin and Tina and the lessons they have passed along. Hope Loves Company is the result of their advocacy and compassion.

Send children like Alina, Nora and Adam to camp so they can meet other children and share their experiences in a fun, safe environment.

You can also help Hope Loves Company and ALS  Connections by sharing this campaign through your networks.  You can do this easily by using Indiegogo's share tools.  Follow us on Twitter: @HopeLovesCo and @alsconnections.  For more information on Hope Loves Company, please visit http://hopelovescompany.com/.  ALS Connections wants your ideas for ALS awareness.  Connect with us at http://alsconnections.org.

story:
Short Summary

KATHY’S STORY:

As told by a friend;

I’ve known Kathy for some seven years now maybe more, this is her story put together as best as I can, my accounts come first hand or directly from her. I know that she wouldn’t ask for help. So my plan is to do it for her.

Let’s get Kathy a prosthetic; and some help;

   Kathy, through no fault of her own is unemployed; and is now considered handicapped; she has lost her arm just below her shoulder to cancer, she has endured four separate amputation / rebuild surgery’s attempting to save the limb and stop the spread of the cancer; all but the last had failed.

Divorced from a local businessman, shortly after having her second child, Kathy lost everything, yet still had the perseverance and the wherewithal to raise her

two children alone, starting a small antique shop with her mom she was able to made ends meet for a while; finally securing a home for herself and her children, but tragedy struck again when Kathy was diagnosed with a rare form of melanoma.  

The cancer, an extremely rare growth the Doctor's had initially thought was a cyst, had formed on her wrist, the doctors treated it as such but this course of treatment sent the tendrils of cancer further into the arm, discovering their error she underwent surgery to remove the cancer and rebuild the arm. This was endured four separate times in rapid succession in order to catch up with and arrest the spread of the melanoma. She would no sooner heal from one surgery then be into another surgery again. All the while raising her two children, as well as trying within a poor economy to make the business run successfully.

 Kathy’s a fighter, and made it through, the business failed, but she sold for enough to secure her home and raise the children for a while; but as a result of not being able to work full time due to her surgeries, amputation and caring for the children at home she is not eligible for social security disability insurance, unemployment or welfare. Determined to make it and provide for herself and her children, she has taken everything she could put together financially and tried to improve her home with the thought that maybe she could if necessary either lease her home while maintaining a room or rent the rooms while the kids are in college, this way she would have a small income and a place to live in the event the cancer returned and the children would have a home.

Kathy had done everything by the book in securing a contractor and initially things went smooth, work on the house progressed with Kathy and a friend doing the majority of the demolition work inside and outside of the house even saving old beams, wood doors etc. to be reincorporated into the house, but soon Kathy began noticing that the contractors workmanship was slipping, recovered detailing was being burnt, detailing within the house was not completed, walls were not straight, windows improperly installed, siding not attached, safety items not installed or improperly installed, the list just got longer and longer. Kathy had numerous meetings with the contractor and he continuously reassured her that things would be made right; but he used every excuse known, overbooked, behind on other jobs, even hostile work environment the contractor even though paid to date would not show or show weeks even months after scheduled eventually even after reassuring Kathy that the job would be completed soon, he never showed again leaving her with an unfinished, home many repairs to be done and no moneys to complete the project. Kathy being an honest person and thinking that her contractor was a friend, was now out thousands of dollars. Eventually, finding out that the contractor had done the same with others in the recent past.

 I’ve done everything in my power to help Kathy, contacting the powers that be within the state government, from the Governor’s office to the State Attorney General. I’ve had some well meaning responses but it hasn’t been enough, and she needs the prosthesis and a real education in order to continue on. She’s praying for a miracle and I’m asking you to aid me in giving her one. She’s 46 this year, a great mother, never smoked, and is the most upbeat person you’ll ever meet, though as a friend I think I see through that.

 Kathy only has enough money set aside to get through till about the end of the year.  Ideally I’d like to set her up with a prosthetic an education within a trade and the tools to do simple things, voice recognition typing programs to use in a new job or even a business.

 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET:

I have taken the first steps in getting this message out now I need your help in order to help Kathy, to fulfill the promise of a fair chance in life. In the end all I can offer are my personal thanks, our prayers and if I ever see you a hug and a cup of coffee.

I will keep everyone updated as best I can.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Even if you can’t personally give, post this link on your Face book, Twitter, blog or email list to get the message out to others.  Every little bit helps.

story:
Dear Friends & Family,

I recently qualified for an incredible opportunity with an organization called International Volunteer HQ that will allow me to travel abroad at work in a rural clinic, serving those who are is dire need to medical care.

I am looking forward to this amazing opportunity, and I know I will learn so much. The trip will be an incredible cultural and educational experience for me, and I can hardly wait!

Each year, thousands of people participate in International Volunteer HQ's programs to destinations in more than 20 countries. Volunteers immerse themselves in local cultures, uplift the lives of the extremely poor, and return with life-changing stories and experiences.

My fellow international volunteers and I will live with host families and work with local medical clinic providing free medical care to those who cannot afford it.

I hope you will sponsor me with a donation of $10 or more to help lower my travel expenses. I need to raise money to take this trip so in addition to all the hard work I will be putting in to cover that cost, I am reaching out for an assist from people like you who want to see me succeed.

Thanks so much for making this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity a reality. You're the best!

--Chris

story:
What we are about

Dear friends, my name is Lucian Mircescu and I am the manager of Aurora Baicoi Rugby Club, a children rugby association. Our project deals with rebuilding an abandoned soccer venue and transforming it into a children-only sports zone. Together with our rugby agenda, we are happy to promote sport activities in general as long as we get children physically active.

What we need & where we want to get

In detail, we want to aquire the building materials necessary for repairing the aforementioned sports grounds. At the moment we lack basic utilities such as electricity, heating, running water and therefore there are no showers or usable locker rooms. 

The 6500$ that we are humbly asking are obviously insufficient for a complete overhaul, but they are enough to have functional facilities and thus get us through the winter. The actual work will be done by our network of volunteers made up mainly by our children's parents. Therefore every 10$ or 20$ will make a huge a difference for us and it will get us closer to our goal.

The Impact

There are currently 80 children playing rugby on our grounds and we are also aiming to bring pupils from two nearby primary schools so that they can have their physical education classes on the much safer grass pitch. Repairing this sports venue would make a huge impact in the life our community since there currently is no outdoor space for children to play sports. That is to say one with safe, hygienic and generally decent and free of charge sports facilities.

Get to know us better

If you want to know more about us you can check out our activity as well as the photo section of our facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/rugbyaurora/

Also, if you happen to have friends in Romania who love sports and are willing to give us a hand in promoting sports education feel free to put them in contact with us: aurora@rugbybaicoi.ro

story:
What is the Eden Alternative? 

The Eden Alternative is a worldwide culture change movement that transforms nursing homes from institutions into human habitats where the focus is on allowing residents to continue to lead meaningful lives.

What's wrong with nursing homes? 

Institutions that are designed to care for the elderly and improve their health can actually make them sicker.  The focus has shifted away from the individual needs of residents and their families. Recent high-profile scandals around abuse or neglect in nursing homes have made providers stick more rigidly to guidelines and wary of innovation. Even though there is a genuine desire to provide quality personal care, staff can feel disempowered and unable to look beyond the boundaries of regulation. 

Some of the greatest burden of suffering for elders comes from loneliness, helplessness and boredom, and these are addressed either inadequately or not at all by a system that relies on medications and guidelines to direct care.

Why is this a problem in Ireland?

Ireland has one of the highest rates of over-65s living in long-term care in Europe, yet funding pressures have led to huge numbers of public beds in nursing homes being closed (around 1,200 since 2011).

Our population is ageing rapidly, which is going to put even more strain on healthcare budgets that are already stretched thin. Over the next thirty years, the total number of people in Ireland aged 65 years and older is projected to more than double and the number of those aged 85 years to quadruple.  

These demographic changes do not need to be worrying, but without a long-term care sector able to cope with dealing with large numbers of people in a dignified way that still allows for them to play a valuable and meaningful role in their communities, the results could be disastrous.

How does the Eden Alternative help?

The Eden Alternative is a low-cost, high-quality training programme which empowers staff in nursing homes to use the tools and resources already available to them to create “households” within large facilities.

Built around ten core principles, Eden introduces a person-centred philosophy of care that focuses less on pills and medication and more on targeting the burden of helplessness, loneliness and boredom on residents, to provide a fuller quality of life. Residents are offered meaningful activities that allow them to still have a positive impact on the community around them. 

Residents in Eden Alternative homes live longer, take fewer medications and have fewer falls.

Eden places a strong focus on integrating the staff as members of the household. This brings meaning and enjoyment back into their role, and breaks down the boundaries that can exist where restrictive guidelines have led to an overly clinical environment.  

Because Eden is a philosophy of care, rather than a set of guidelines, there is scope for each home to adapt and shape its practice as best fits their circumstances. The Eden Alternative includes ongoing support throughout this process, making it more than just a document or abstract idea.

The Plan

We want to bring the Eden Alternative to as many nursing homes in Ireland as possible, so we're setting up a fund to cover the cost of staff training. If we raise €10,000, we'll be able to train 75 staff in 25 nursing homes, and they'll be able to start implementing Eden in their homes and improving the quality of life for over 1,000 older people across the country. 

Using this as a base, we'll be able to strengthen the roots of the Eden Alternative here, and start spreading it throughout Ireland. 

Other ways to help

If you can't make a donation - don't worry! There's loads of ways to help. We want people to stop being afraid to think about nursing homes, and start talking about the kinds of places they want their loved ones, and themselves, to grow old. So you can share this on facebook, tweet about it (we're @EdenAltIre) and start talking about how you think we should be caring for our older people.

story:
UPDATE! 

Honor Thy Midwife!

Mothers, fathers, partners, and grandparents - we invite you to honor the midwife who cared for you during pregnancy, birth, and the early weeks of your newborn’s life.

For a contribution of any level, we will list the name of your midwife (and your name, if you choose) on our Honor Thy Midwife page at the California Families for Access to Midwives site. We will also give your midwife a well-deserved shout-out on social media.

Your donation will help to fund critical efforts to ensure that homebirth midwifery is still available in California. Read on for details! (the rest of the Indiegogo campaign spells out the details)

To honor your midwife:

1) Make a contribution at any level.

2) Leave us a comment** with the name of your midwife to be honored. If you would like us to include your name, please let us know - otherwise, we’ll mark it an anonymous. If you have your midwife’s e-mail handy, let us know that, too, so we can tell your midwife about the honor! ** After you make your contribution, return to the FreeOurMidwives campaign page and click on the "comments" tab to add your midwife's name.

We will list your midwife on our Honor Thy Midwife page within 2 days of your donation.

The problem with California midwifery law

In California, licensed midwives are technically required by law to to secure supervision from a physician in order to legally practice. While the spirit of the law may appear to inspire collaboration between midwives and physicians, this is not the case.

Physician supervision is unattainable for midwives in California. Physicians are unwilling or, because of malpractice insurance limitations, unable to provide the required supervision. The result? Licensed midwives providing home and birth center births are currently unable to comply with California law.

Until now, this law has remained unenforced. However, a new bill (SB 304) would move enforcement of licensees from the California Medical Board to the Department of Justice. As we understand it, this bill was designed to tighten enforcement of dangerous prescription writing by a tiny minority of physicians. However, this legislation could have the unintended consequence of opening up midwives to enforcement of the existing physician supervision regulations.

Even if this SB 304 does not pass, one of our key allies - the executive director of the CA Medical Board - has mysteriously taken early retirement. Some have suggested she was forced out in part because of her support for home birth. A new executive director could quickly call for enforcement of physician supervision - which would criminalize most homebirth in CA. 

California, Louisiana, Delaware and Arkansas are the only states where the laws governing the relationship between midwives and physicians fail to comply with the standards of practice outlined by National Association of Certified Professional Midwives.

The Truth About Licensed Midwives In California

  • Licensed midwives are trained as experts in out-of-hospital birth and are autonomous providers.

  • Licensed midwives are specifically trained to recognize abnormal or emergent conditions needing expert help outside their scope.

  • Licensed midwives have a plan for consultation and referral to appropriate physicians when such conditions arise.

What we are doing to create change in California

We are up against a huge foe. ACOG - the American Congress of Obstetricians and Gynecologists - has launched massive and well-funded campaigns in other states to reduce access to out-of-hospital midwifery.

We know that the only way to combat dollars is by showing legislators that large numbers of voters care about midwifery. California Families for Access to Midwives has in just a few short months identified and mobilized a base of mothers, fathers, and community members.

We have launched a highly effective public education campaign and online system that rapidly updates our supporters on critical next steps. We have generated hundreds of calls to legislators using our website and our social media campaign.

On July 1st, we will be taking on the state Capitol with a rally to show legislators just how much we care about out-of-hospital birth. 

Who is California Families For Access to Midwives

California Families for Access to Midwives includes mothers, fathers, families and their communities who advocate safe, affordable and healthy birth options. CFAM is working to improve the health of mothers and babies by increasing access to midwifery care. Because our advocacy work is considered lobbying, we are not a 501(c)(3), and your donations to CFAM are not tax deductible.  But that also means your contributions will make a huge difference for midwifery in California, because there are no big grants or foundations keeping this movement alive, only you.   

Why we need your help now

California Families For Access To Midwives is a volunteer organization made up of mothers, fathers, and community members, all of whom are donating countless hours to change the law.

However, the legislative process is complex and campaigns require some degree of professional expertise… which costs money. We also are rapidly building expenses towards our rally at the State Capitol. We estimate our bare-bones budget to be about $30,000.

We are hoping to raise $5,000 towards covering a portion of our consultant bills and rally expenses. Your donations will help us further leverage our volunteer efforts!

story:
MY GOAL

To raise $500 for The SIMS Foundation as I swim a 1 mile race in the 12th Annual Deep Eddy Race on Aug 17th, 2013 at 8:00AM.
*All proceeds raised through this campaign benefit the SIMS Foundation.
*Donation deadline Aug 24th
*Race open to the public to watch (401 Deep Eddy Drive).

ABOUT AIMEE BOBRUK
& THE AUG 17th DEEP EDDY 12 ANNUAL RACE

I am a singer-songwriter and vibrant participant in Austin's live music scene. In 2010 I was selected as a top 10 band by Austin Monthly and most recently I was featured in the book, The Sound of Austin. I have toured nationally and internationally, but Austin, TX is home! Off stage, I am an ardent swimmer and supporter of musicians' health and well-being. Three times a week I swim a mile or more at Austin's Deep Eddy pool. I figured it is time to use my passion for the water to support a great cause. The Deep Eddy Mile is an annual race open to the public where swimmers compete in racing a mile long race. How long is a mile? 1766 2/3 yards @ Deep Eddy that is 53 laps!
It is my goal to raise $500 for the SIMS Foundation as I swim a 1 mile race in the 12th Annual Deep Eddy Race on Aug 17th. 
*All proceeds raised through this campaign benefit the SIMS Foundation.

More About Aimee Bobruk: www.aimeebobruk.com

More About The SIMS Foundation: www.simsfoundation.org

More About the 12th Annual Deep Eddy Mile Race: Deep Eddy Mile

WHAT YOU GET FOR YOUR DONATION

All supporters at any $ amount receive the following:

  • The satisfaction of knowing you are making a difference in the life of a musician in need of care expressed in a handwritten letter by Aimee Bobruk.
  • An invitation to watch the race Aug 17th 8:00am and cheer me on!
    Deep Eddy Pool is located at 401 Deep Eddy Drive, Austin, TX.
  • Access to view pictures & media taken at the event
  • *A chance to win a swim date with Aimee Bobruk at Deep Eddy!
    *Guess My Race Time & Win a Swim Date!
    Email your guess of my race time to aimeebobruk@aimeebobruk.com and the person closest to my actual time the day of the race will win a swim date with me at Deep Eddy. In your e-mail please include your name, time, and phone number.

THE IMPACT of YOUR DONATION & SIMS

Austin musicians often struggle financially and cannot afford mental health services when they need them most. Research shows that untreated mental illness can lead to incarceration, an inability to work, loss of housing and strained relationships, all of which effect our families as well as the greater community.

SIMS provides a range of life-saving mental health services to 800 clients per year. 98% of clients report an improvement in symptoms after initiating SIMS services.

Healthy, happy musicians make better band mates, better fathers and mothers, better wives and husbands. The result is a healthier, more productive creative community with more hours in the studio and more time spent with friends and loved ones.

SIMS provides a range of mental health services for Austin musicians and their families including:
  • Counseling sessions for individuals, couples, families, and entire bands.
  • Psychiatric services include psychiatric evaluation and medication management.
  • Addiction Recovery options include medical detoxification, intensive inpatient treatment, and continued care at a sober living facility.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you are unable to contribute, don't worry, you can still help by:

  • Sharing this campaign link on your social network page (Facebook, Twitter, Etc)
  • Volunteering for a future SIMS event (see www.simsfoundation.org)
  • Supporting the musicians you know in living a healthy lifestyle
  • Come see me race and cheer me on Aug 17th at 8am at Deep Eddy Pool
