story:
Short Summary

Hi! We are a new youth soccer club starting out called the Dayton Players Academy (DPA) Cobras.  Our goal is to provide a positive youth soccer experience with a player centered approach in the Dayton, Ohio area.  The club is run by Andy Szucs and Janelle Fritschie.

Our passion is to not only teach soccer but also help provide a family atmosphere and teach life skills to our players including leadership, self evaluation, teamwork, and mentoring.

What We Need & What You Get

Our main need for funding is to keep player fees as low as possible for our initial season this Spring.  We are looking to raise $10,000 to help with indoor facility rentals, tournament fees, and uniforms.

For every $100 donation we will list your name on our founding donations web page, as well as get a personalized story about a player you are helping succeed!

For every $500 donation we will also include our first ever DPA Cobras training shirt.

    The Impact

    By donating to this organization you are donating to help children succeed!

    Andy and Janelle have a great record of developing players for the next level of soccer (high school, college, and beyond).

      Risks & Challenges

      We are a brand new start up club, with this there is always risk!  However, Andy and Janelle have over 20+ years of experience between them running youth soccer organizations and their goal is to make a true impact on soccer in the Dayton, Ohio area by partnering with other clubs to provide the best opportunities for our players.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Please share our campaign!

        If you are local and would like to get involved in the project please contact us!

story:
who is Laurence? who is Ben?

and more importantly, what is yellobox?

  • Laurence, 39. I am an IT professional of 15 years. With a passion for Technology and Science, I have had an entrepreneurial streak since early teens, when I first thought of the idea for a kids musical toothbrush.
  • Ben, 26, is a designer and illustrator. He has a degree in illustration and animation. Proficient in several mediums, he consistently brings enthusiasm and expertise to yellobox.
  • yellobox is a solution born out of frustration. The original concept of bookmarking digital information 'on-the-go' struck me like a bolt of lightening when waiting in a Doctors surgery and staring unimpressed by the plethora of flyers and information pinned to the wall. Friends agreed, with a few saying "I sometimes take a photo of information that appeals to me". This got me thinking. We're bombarded with advertising, website links, phone numbers and email addresses when we go about our daily lives. If you could 'tap' a device on a shop window, in a cinema foyer or at a train station, to bookmark content you're interested in, wouldn't that be good?! wouldn't that save the world?! ... well, perhaps not save the world but it would certainly help bridge the gap between the offline and online world, when it's most necessary.

A contribution, but you'll get rewarded!

  • We've done our due-diligence, we've done our marketing, and we believe there is no end to the scenarios where the yellobox marketing solution could provide a much needed benefit.
  • We need £25,000. This money will take us to a fully working, manufacturable product with accompanying feature rich online user interface for phone, tablet and computer. Here are some examples where yellobox could benefit, but before I list them please let us make sure of our commitment to you by saying we will always provide yellocards for FREE!...FOREVER!
  • example: an Exhibition, attendees capture exhibitor information.
  • example: a Mall, visitors bookmark brand information they love, at point of sale.
  • example: Information points in large public areas, airports and train stations.
  • example: Movie stickered yelloboxes in the cinema foyer.
  •  YES! --- we could provide a 'White-Labelled' solution, using your logo.

But how does it work, you say?

  • The key to the magic in yellobox is NFC technology and the Internet.
  • Every yellobox is uniquely identified and so is each yellocard
  • When you 'tap'. We marry those 2 unique identifiers together in real-time and show you the content the business has decided to upload, when you visit yellobox.io/cardnumber

You said i'll get rewarded?!

  • From small acorns do big oak trees grow, so every little you give will help.
  • We have a short Perks list, and we'll give you something in return for your generosity. Whether it's a personal thank-you email from us, to fully working yelloboxes and yellocards.
  • You're putting your trust in us and we want to fulfill our honesty by giving you details every step of the way after your contribution, even when it's post world domination!!!

Sure, there might be a few challenges!

  • We are currently seeking a business mentor in the Tech/Marketing space. During our prototype phase, we hope to bring this mentor in to the company to help us with any area we feel we are not quite fulfilling 100%.
  • If we reach our campaign goal, it's envisaged that we'll be ready to manufacture yelloboxes and yellocards on mass only 8 weeks after our first initial payment.
  • We currently have on stand-by a highly respected Web Developer and User Interface designer, based in London. He is extremely well connected in the fast growing Tech Startup scene that is Silicon Roundabout.
  • We also have on stand-by, a design and manufacturing company. They have a commitment to source the best and most suitable components to make yellobox. They are passionate about the project and aim to provide the yelloboxes at the most cost effective price, but of course still using quality materials.

Can I share this campaign?

  • Whatever steps you think will help make our yellobox campaign a success, is a step worth making and we'll be highly grateful for your efforts.
  • Get the word out in your business. Share in Twitterland or post on Facebook. Email friends and colleagues and invite them along for the ride too.


Made with ❤

story:
It's a grim picture.  America has become the second fattest country in the world.  We are Virtual Wellness, and we can change the picture.

We are a classic Silicon Valley story: a small company with a big software application.  An important, free application: WeightZone. 

WeightZone can help you and the people you love to reach an ideal weight.  And if enough people use WeightZone, we can help combat the national obesity crisis.  That’s why we think it is important. 

The WeightZone project started after one of our founders had a massive heart attack.  Jay was in his forties, but he weighed over 300 pounds and owned an ice cream store – a bad combination.  He continued to struggle with his weight even after surviving open heart surgery, because all the advice he found was trying to selling him something: a diet book, a program, or some worthless over-the-counter pill. 

During his recovery, he did his own research; Jay’s an experienced mathematician and software designer.  Eventually, he wrote the first significant algorithm to estimate a person’s weight since the Body Mass Index was created in 1832.  Far more accurate than the BMI, WeightZone analyzes 25 facts before creating your personal Zone - a Zone as unique as your DNA.  The simple message: don’t weigh more than this; don’t weigh less than that. 



As he was writing the algorithm, he formed our team, and we agreed to develop a comprehensive weight loss package that people could use at no charge.  That’s why we decided to self-fund everything.  We even shot our own video and created our own pictures; we could have paid professionals, but who would we impress? 

WeightZone is an amazing app that will help many people.  Some of them will help build our Company.  We hope you will be one of those builders, and join us as we work to Reduce Obesity. 

The following pictures are taken from our website.  The data and the two-page analysis are real.

 



Our entire team has been working on WeightZone for more than two years.  Two of us are wellness experts (Becky Williamson and Jay Wiener); two of us are software engineers (John Alburger and Rolland Hoyt), and two of us have had multiple successful startups (Majid Azad and John.)  Obesity has affected us and it has affected our families: some of us have been seriously obese, Jay and another partner had heart attacks while in their forties, and two of our children (both adults) had gastric bypass surgery.  The national obesity crisis has hit us personally, and hard.


OUR STATUS TODAY
www.weightzonefactor.com is already online, giving the most sophisticated personal weight loss analysis on the Internet.  Free, personalized programs are the key to combating widespread obesity – they greatly increase the chance of success.  And success is urgently needed if we are going to reduce the effects of obesity: heart disease, diabetes, stroke, even cancer.  

We want to improve www.weightzonefactor.com , to build the first prototype of our free fitness application, and to reach as many people as we can.  That’s why we launched this campaign with Indiegogo. 


PERSONAL WEIGHT ZONE: Forget the obsolete idea of a ‘perfect weight’.  Few people reach it; fewer maintain it.  WeightZone does something smarter: it gives you an achievable range of weight: the most and least you should weigh today based on your body, health history, and lifestyle.  Mainly concerned with your health?  Just reduce down to the high end of your Zone.  Want to look and feel your best?  Get close to the low end. Your body, your decision.

THE EXERCISE CALCULATOR: Beginning an exercise program?  Starting to work out harder?  See how different routines can affect your Zone.  This powerful tool can optimize any workout. 

PERSONAL WEIGHT LOSS ADVICE:  Which diet is best for your body… Low Carb?  Low Fat?  Something else?  We will help you decide what works best for your body and lifestyle. 

FITNESS ASSESSMENT:  Our easy self-test lets you see how fit you are for your age group. It’s a terrific way to determine your health and longevity. 

TARGET HEART RATE: Your target heart rate is an excellent benchmark to maintain while exercising.  Be sure that you are getting the most value from your workouts. 

EXERCISE SCHEDULE: How much exercise is best for your body?  We’ll determine how often you should do both cardio exercise and strength training, and we’ll optimize each workout.  Get an easy-to-follow schedule based on your health, goals, and exercise patterns. 

JAY’S BLOG:  Our CEO, Jay Wiener, writes a popular column on a variety of health-related issues.  No spam, no ads, just wellness stories that are fun to read.  He covers the latest findings in nutrition and exercise, how to select a diet you can stick with for life, the social problems of living with obesity, and more.  Jay is a professional humorist and it shows; his blog has one of the highest readership rates on the Internet.   Jay's Blog   



HOW WEIGHTZONE CAN HELP REDUCE OBESITY
“Reduce Obesity”.  It’s a nice play on words but it highlights a serious problem.  More than 70 million Americans are significantly overweight and  inactive, which puts them at high risk of heart disease, stroke, diabetes, cancer, and other life-threatening diseases.  In addition to the personal tragedies, it is a national tragedy: we spend tens of billions of dollars each year to treat them. The WeightZone program will help many people to control their disease.




WHY CROWD FUNDING?
Software companies with big applications like ours usually raise money through venture capitalists or professional angel investors.  Excellent solutions, but not for us.  Pros want fast growth and high profits.  Our team would welcome both, but we also want to devote our energy into free software that will get many people healthier.  Crowd funding will help us to grow while sticking to our philosophy. 

Crowd funding has a second advantage: the best way to spread the word is to work with people like you.  We can reach millions of people if enough people like you simply share this campaign with their friends.  No professional investor can help us as much as you can.

HOW YOUR DONATIONS WILL HELP
We need to expand WeightZone and to reach as many people as we can.  With your donations we will:

  • Improve WeightZone: add new features, expand our analysis, create friendlier graphics, and do more research. 
  • Publicize our site!  We cannot help people unless they know about us
  • Build and test our next free app, FitZone. 
  • Write the first interactive e-diet book, so that people can custom-tailor their wellness programs.  

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you cannot contribute, there are other ways to help.  Tell your friends and co-workers about the WeightZone campaign.  Also, many well-known people are publicly committed to combating American Obesity - do you know any of them?  Do you know anyone who does?  Do you know anyone in the media?  Ask them to look at this campaign.  Contact us for more information: (cut and paste this address) info@weightzonefactor.com   

Want to join our team?  We badly need a few volunteers, such as a talented graphics artist.  Also, we would like to place the WeightZone application on other sites so that more people can use it.  For information, write to (cut and paste this address) info@weightzonefactor.com     

Whatever you do to help, thank you. 

The WeightZone Team


THE WEIGHTZONE STORY
Jay Wiener, the developer of the WeightZone algorithm, also writes the Company Blog. 

Like many people, I’ve worried about my weight for my entire life.  I started earlier than most; the first time I went to a doctor to lose weight I was four years old.  After examining me, the doctor gravely told my mother and grandmother that I should lose eight pounds.  Obviously, I didn’t understand what he meant.  I was four!  I couldn’t read the scale yet!  But somehow, he convinced them that if I lost eight pounds I would be perfect.  Not seven or nine pounds.  Eight.  Why?  Because that’s what some chart on the wall said I should weigh. 

On the spot, my grandmother promised me that if I lost eight pounds she’d buy me a blue striped suit with a vest.  I was barely out of diapers and she thought I would enjoy dressing up like a banker.  Grandma wasn’t a strong motivator.

Well, I didn’t lose the eight pounds.  I lost four.  It was the first of many failures. 

I hit the yo-yo syndrome when I was a teenager.  I gained about fifty pounds in junior high, and then my parents took me to our new family doctor.  He told me to lose 63 pounds, and then handed me a box of amphetamines to take three times a day.  They worked, but I didn’t sleep for the month of January, 1971.  I lost about forty pounds, gained about sixty, and then went to a quack diet doctor our next door neighbor recommended.  Dr. Quacker told me to lose 83 pounds, warned that exercise would slow down my weight loss, and gave me amphetamines to take six times a day.  But he looked impressive in his expensive blue striped suit – maybe he knew my grandmother.  


The Body Mass Index Gives Bad Advice  


Somehow, something good came out of all this failure.  I learned that goal weights are useless unless the target is achievable and maintainable, and I also learned that no one could give me an achievable, maintainable goal.  The Body Mass Index?  Worthless.  The wall charts? Not much better.  And then I realized something surprising.

I’m only 5’ 10”, but I’m a big man.  Broad shoulders, big rib cage.  Regardless, doctors kept telling me that according to the BMI I should weigh 157.  They treated the Body Mass Index as if it had magical powers – so magical that I had to balloon up past 320 and have a massive heart attack to break free of its spell.  There’s one good thing about having a heart attack: it you live, you learn to take care of yourself.  You learn to separate the good advice from the bad.  I learned, and then I started to look in the mirror.  

                      

                         


Somehow, as I recuperated, I developed an eating plan that I could stick with for life, and began to exercise regularly.  The pounds have came off slowly, but I have never gained any weight back.  My waistline is smaller today than it was on my wedding day.

But during that long recuperation, I had a problem.  I couldn’t find a target weight I could trust.  I looked online.  It turns out that if you are 5’ 10” tall, the BMI will always tell you to weigh 157 pounds.  Man or woman, young or old, broad football player or narrow couch potato, it doesn’t matter: height is the only factor the BMI uses.  The most popular metric in medicine is also the worst. 

Then why do so many doctors use it?  Because they do not understand how inaccurate it is. 

WHY TACKLE THE OLDEST MEASUREMENT IN MEDICINE?
I wanted something better than the BMI.  I’m a mathematician, and I knew that with computers and modern analytical techniques, I could do an accurate job of predicting how much a person should weigh.  And I so created The WeightZone.  

It took two years to research and write a formula that would give solid results.  Then, to test it, I asked my friends to use the Zone.  And most of them loved it.  Of course, some people want to weigh what they weighed in high school.  Can’t help them.  But the overwhelming majority gave WeightZone excellent reviews.  It felt great. 

THANKS FOR READING MY STORY
Now I want to share WeightZone – with you and with anyone else who is struggling.  You can help with a donation or by simply telling your friends and co-workers about us.  Send them this link; like us on your Facebook page; tweet about us; do whatever you can.  If you let enough people know about WeightZone, we can help Reduce Obesity.

she’d buy me a blue striped suit with a vest.

like a banker.  Grandma wasn’t a strong
motivator.
Well, I didn’t lose the eight pounds. 
I lost four.  It was the first of
many failures.  
I hit the yo-yo syndrome when I was a teenager.  I gained about fifty pounds in junior high,
and then my parents took me to our new family doctor.  He told me to lose 63 pounds, and then handed
me a box of amphetamines to take three times a day.  They worked, but I didn’t sleep for the month
of January, 1971.  I lost about forty
pounds, gained about sixty, and then went to a quack diet doctor our next door
neighbor recommended.  Dr. Quacker told
me to lose 83 pounds, warned that exercise would slow down my weight loss, and gave
me amphetamines to take six times a day. 
But he looked impressive in his expensive blue striped suit – maybe he
knew my grandmother.  The Body Mass Index Gives Bad Advice  Somehow, something good came out of all this failure.  I learned that goal weights are useless unless
the target is achievable and maintainable, and I also learned that no one could
give me an achievable, maintainable goal. 
The Body Mass Index? 
Worthless.  The wall charts? Not
much better.  And then I realized
something surprising.
I’m only 5’ 10”, but I’m a big man. 
Broad shoulders, big rib cage. 
Regardless, doctors kept telling me that according to the BMI I should
weigh 157.  They treated the Body Mass
Index as if it had magical powers – so magical that I had to balloon up past 320 and have a massive
heart attack to break free of its spell.  There’s one
good thing about having a heart attack: it you live, you learn to take care of yourself.  You learn to separate the good advice from the bad.  I learned, and then I started to look in the mirror.                                                  Somehow, as I recuperated, I developed an eating plan that I could stick with
for life, and began to exercise regularly. 
The pounds have came off slowly, but I have never gained any weight
back.  My waistline is smaller today
than it was on my wedding day.
But during that long recuperation, I had a problem.  I couldn’t find a target weight I could trust.  I looked online.  It turns out that if you are 5’ 10” tall, the
BMI will always tell you to weigh 157 pounds. 
Man or woman, young or old, broad football player or narrow couch
potato, it doesn’t matter: height is the only factor the BMI uses.  The most popular metric in medicine is also
the worst.  
Then why do so many doctors use it? 
Because they do not understand how inaccurate it is.  
WHY TACKLE THE OLDEST MEASUREMENT IN MEDICINE?I wanted something better than the BMI.  I’m a mathematician, and I knew that with
computers and modern analytical techniques, I could do an accurate job of
predicting how much a person should weigh. 
And I so created The WeightZone.  
It took two years to research and write a formula that would
give solid results.  Then, to test it, I
asked my friends to use the Zone.  And most
of them loved it.  Of course, some people
want to weigh what they weighed in high school. 
Can’t help them.  But the
overwhelming majority gave WeightZone excellent reviews.  It felt great.  
THANKS FOR READING MY STORYNow I want to share WeightZone – with you and with anyone else who is
struggling.  You can help with a donation
or by simply telling your friends and co-workers about us.  Send them this link; like us on your Facebook page; tweet about us; do whatever you can. 
If you let enough people know about WeightZone, we can help Reduce Obesity.

story:
Hello, my name is Christen Lothridge. My 19 year old daughter Alexandra is seriously ill due to Chronic Lyme Disease and possibly other tick-borne diseases. Some of you well know that Lyme disease is a complex illness that is difficult to understand and treat. If not treated correctly and effectively Lyme disease will likely have an impact on a person for their entire life. 

 

Alexandra was bitten by a tick at the beginning of November of 2012. She began to develop flu like symptoms a few weeks later, with her symptoms increasing in severity almost on a daily basis after that. Alexandra was diagnosed with Lyme disease in December and was treated with a 21-day course of antibiotics. However, due to her symptoms, we believe that Alexandra has actually had Lyme for quite some time before her diagnosis in December. That is most likely why the Lyme is affecting Alexandra's central nervous system so quickly. It also means that the basic treatment she received would not be enough for her. After Alexandra completed the antibiotics, she began to feel somewhat better for a couple of weeks. Unfortunately, her Lyme symptoms came back with full vengeance and even worse in severity.

 

Unfortunately, the cost of Alexandra's medical care is more than I can cover due to other financial hardships that I've experienced in the last few years. I have no other resources than to reach out and ask for help from others. The flu like symptoms of general malaise, mild body aches, headache, stomach pain and nausea are nothing in comparison to how the Lyme disease is already currently affecting Alexandra's central nervous system. Alexandra is having seizures, severe facial tremors, stuttering speech, numbness and tingling of the feet, constant headaches, poor balance, shock wave vibrations throughout her body, soreness of the eyes, extreme joint pain, extreme fatigue, shaky hands, abdominal pain and the list goes on. She is unable to work, drive a car, and has had to take the semester off from college. At the age of 19 all activities of daily living are a struggle for Alexandra. I just can't stand to see my daughter suffer. I have seen Alexandra go from a young fairly healthly woman who always had a smile on her face and was due to graduate from college this May at the the age of 19 into a young woman who now struggles get out of bed everyday. It kills me so deep inside as a parent. Alexandra's initial visit with the LLMD (Lyme Literate Medical Doctor) will be $650. Her follow up visits will be $175 each. This DOES NOT include any testing, medications, or any other treatments specific to the Lyme disease or co-infections. We do not know at this time how long she will have to receive treatment for. There is also a substantial amount of travel involved, as the LLMD she is going to see is 760 miles away round trip. 

 

Again, please let me stress that without the help of others I do not have the resources available to me that will make it possible for Alexandra to seek treatment. There are no LLMD's in our area of the state, and that is why I am having to seek medical treatment so far away from home. The doctor that we have chosen is a brilliant man and has been reccomened to Alexandra by many of her Lyme friends. Everyone speaks very highly of him and has nothing but great things to say about him! Your contributions will help make it possible for Alexandra to seek proper treatment for her Lyme Disease and other possible co-infections so that she can get well and hopefully lead a healthy life. 

 

To learn more about Lyme Disease visit http://www.ilads.org/about_ILADS/about_us.html

You can also watch a film on http://www.hulu.com/ called Under Our Skin.

story: November 26 me and Duke were in a head on collision in california!  While luckily neither of us suffered any serious injuries, winter is here, and Duke's neck and back pain has not gone anywhere.  GET INTO THE HOLIDAY SPIRIT.  She keeps saying she needs a good rub.  It's time to let her have it.  We are just trying to get 140 dollars to get at least a few, really good massage with someone like, oh maybe Jordie Martin in San Francisco.  Any additional funds will also support some acupuncture at the Community Acupuncture Projects around town.

story:
The past two years we researched and experienced that sporters were in need of more challenge in their workout and making more result in less time.

We started designing and developing a fitnesstool that would give each and everyone the possiblity to find more challenge, push their boundaries, and boost their workout.

And so we proudly present the CrossXvest WeightVest, exclusively available on Indiegogo!

Thanks for checking out our project!

_________________________________________________________________________________

 

The CrossXvest WeightVest is a fully adjustable fitnesstool from 0 kg/ 0 lb. to a max of 20 kg./44 lb. The Vest is a one size fits all model, and has special features to make it fit perfect for each body.

Because of these special features the vest is suitable for men and woman at every level.

 

_________________________________________________________________________________


Our product is produced in collaboration with a producer for military and policeforces gear. This means that we have the best quality materials available for the CrossXvest WeightVest.

The overwhelming durability of 1000 denier Cordura qualifies this fabric for heavy duty use. Characteristic features of this nylon fabric such as resistance to tears and scuffs indicate it performs fantastic for outdoors. 

We analyzed the WeightVest on all kind of conditions. This to develop the best possible WeightVest for you. The CrossXvest WeightVest is worldwide tested by many professionals.


                                        

                                           

___________________________________________________________________________



This fitnesstool increases strength, stamina, explosivity, power, flexibility and endurance! Your body works harder and more muscles are involved, you will burn more KCAL and reduce more fat overall.

It's a quick boost of big muscle groups like your back, legs, chest and core. It will boost your condition and energy levels in all kinds of workouts and different in- and outdoor sports.


A study from a leading university tracked two groups of people: one that was resistance training with a WeightVest and another that was doing only traditional resistance training. In six weeks, both groups were tested to determine progress.

The group that used weight vests in addition to their resistance training performed better. That group's results in the vertical jump, broad jump and 40-yard dash were meaningfully better than the group not using WeightVests.


The weight loss factor of WeightVests occurs through the burning of calories. This is especially seen when cardio workouts are performed with the WeightVest on. 

If the desired effect of running with a WeightVest is to enhance the amount of calories you burn, then that increase will occur.


A WeightVest does increase the rate at which you lose weight, because it enhances the calorie-burning effects of cardio exercises like running. Though the primary use of a WeightVest is for resistance training, aerobic exercises with a WeightVest are also possible. Aerobic exercises with a WeightVest on increases the number of calories that you burn during such a workout. 


_________________________________________________________________________________


The WeightVest is adjustable from 0 kg./0 lb. to a maximum weight of 20 kg./44.1lb. You can easily adjust the vest, each weight is 1 kg./2.2 lb. This makes the vest easy to use and available for everyone.

We advice all WeightVest users to start with our level system

Beginner     4 - 6 kg./4.4 - 13.2 lb.
Regular       6 - 10 kg./13.2 - 22 lb.
Advanced   10 - 20 kg./22 - 44.1 lb.          

If you train daily you can get fit and strong fast, you will notice that you can upgrade your WeightVest by adding 1 kg. /2.2 lb. till maximum 2 kg./4.4 lb. a time.

_________________________________________________________________________________


We need your help to finalize the first production batch of the WeightVests in combination with the Weights.

We already have first prototypes of the WeightVest ready, and first test users are using them with great succes. The money will be used to finalize production and get products ready for shipping. You can view here the complete overview of targets________________________________________________________________________________




 

Hi Indiegogo!

We are Dave de Vries and Jacqueline van Leusden. We are working full time on this project after resigning our own jobs, this to commit our entire time and passion to this great business. We've received loads of support and are very excited to finally share all of our hard work with everyone.

Dave de Vries – is an entrepreneur with the experience in sports and health. And has been active as militair in the army, he benefited from working everywhere in the world. From his knowledge he started with designing - developing - and testing the CrossXvest succesfully.

Jacqueline van Leusden – is involved in the Communication and Social Media aspects of CrossXvest. She studied Communication and Marketing with great passion. She is also responsible for the moodboards and concepts for our photography campaigns and product designs.
_______________________________________________________________________________


Why would you buy the CrossXvest WeightVest?
The CrossXvest WeightVest is made of durable materials, tested on indoor and outdoor situations. Wears comfortable and has been tested by many professionals in the sportscene. Boost your workout and improve your strength, mobility, and stamina. Find more challenge and push your boundaries with this unique fitnesstool!

What are you going to do with the money you raise?
Once we reach our goal, we'll make your WeightVest and ship them to you as quickly as possible. Check our perkes for the complete overview of packs ! Any additional funds raised will go towards continued production and expansion.

When do I get my CrossXvest WeightVest?
Our manufacturing partner is standing by and excited to start producing. As soon as our campaign ends, they will get to work.

Allowing for 40 days to receive the funds we raised we can expect to have the CrossXvest WeightVest delivered to you within 2 months after the end of the campaign. We ship in the month November 2013.

Can everyone use the WeightVest, also non-sporters? And is it for Men and Woman?
The CrossXvest WeightVest is uni-sex design, our WeightVest is for Men and Woman use. It is fully adjustable so everyone can train with our WeightVest.

What if I don't like the CrossXvest WeightVest?
Unlikely, but you never know! We stand by our product for 100% so if for any reason contact us at buycrossxvest@gmail.com and we'll arrange for an exchange or full return.

Can I train with my CrossXvest WeightVest outside the gym?
You can use your WeightVest anywhere you want..The WeightVest has been tested on all kinds of conditions. Think about heavy duty workouts, rainy weather, survivalruns, crossfit workouts etc. The CrossXvest materials are also engineered for military gear. We have no doubt about the quality.

Social Media - Follow, Share and Like us via:

We would like to thank every backer for any contribution, support, and any assistance in the realization of our CrossXvest project. Share our concept of the CrossXvest amongst friends and relatives in Facebook and Twitter.

CrossXvest on Facebook
CrossXvest on Twitter

Questions and more information about product via: buycrossxvest@gmail.com

story:
Hi,

My name is Zen. Back in 2012 I was diagnosed with an aggressive form of cancer which has since been diagnosed as terminal. I remain hopeful that there are treatments available out there which will save my life and I am hoping to raise the money to be able to afford those treatments. 



I love life and am often described as a caring, fun-loving girl. I have fought this battle with everything I have thus far and have no intention of giving up any time soon. For that, I need your help. The NHS has given up on my treatment and decided that I am no longer worthy of the cost. I happen to disagree. With the money I raise here I would like to take my treatment private and continue on with the chemotherapy that had been working so effectively until my doctors withdrew treatment. Private treatment will definitely allow me to receive the care I need to keep on going. I have every faith that this treatment will be successful but in order for me to afford it I will need your help. Please give as generously as you can afford, or spread the word about my case if you would like to offer your support. At this point, any help would be greatly appreciated. 



I have aspirations of becoming  a plus sized model. It's a silly dream but something I would love to chase. If I survive this, I would love to challenge this world's idea of what beauty should or shouldn't look like. It's been a dream of mine for some time now and I would love to stick around long enough to make it a reality.



I have decided that if all does not go well with my case, then I would like to forward any remaining proceeds to people in similar situations as myself. I know it isn't a lot but I believe in paying it forward and a gesture as grand as saving my life is not something I will forget any time soon.

Thanks for your support. x

We send more of our pockets money. Please send any small donations as opur resources are really low. We have 3 case to help...Please PLease please send what you can if you can...thank you!!!

Now is a definetly: Nilda needs surgery as her vesiculum is inflamed and can burst at any time, bringing serious life threatning consequences. The surgery costs 5000 soles, or £1,140, or € 1351, or U$ 1780 or BR$4250. And have to be done urgently, she is a single mother from the Shipibo Comunity of San Francisco. story:
My name is Monica.  I have three children. The oldest, Elly, is from a previous relationship and is eleven years old.  She is a bright, beautiful, and creative girl.  Unfortunately her situation isn't the best.


This campaign is to help my family cover the seemingly endless attorney's fees associated with protecting Elly from her father.


Elly recently disclosed that her father had been touching her inappropriately.  DCS was contacted and she was inteviewed.  Despite this our family needs to get an attorney to represent us in court and to protect Elly.

We have a temporary restraining order but need to appear in court, with an attorney, on the 10th of October.  We only paid off the last attorney fees this month and just can't afford to keep doing this without help. 

All contributions will go toward attorney fees and court costs regardless of if we meet our goal. 

We're requesting funding of $2500 because a retainer fee typically runs between $1500 - $2500 and the hourly rate is between $250-$500.  That adds up quickly.

If you can't contribute financially please share this so we can reach as many people as possible.
story_txt:
My name is Monica.  I have three children. The oldest, Elly, is from a previous relationship and is eleven years old.  She is a bright, beautiful, and creative girl.  Unfortunately her situation isn't the best.

 This campaign is to help my family cover the seemingly endless attorney's fees associated with protecting Elly from her father. 
Elly recently disclosed that her father had been touching her inappropriately.  DCS was contacted and she was inteviewed.  Despite this our family needs to get an attorney to represent us in court and to protect Elly. We have a temporary restraining order but need to appear in court, with an attorney, on the 10th of October.  We only paid off the last attorney fees this month and just can't afford to keep doing this without help.  All contributions will go toward attorney fees and court costs regardless of if we meet our goal.  We're requesting funding of $2500 because a retainer fee typically runs between $1500 - $2500 and the hourly rate is between $250-$500.  That adds up quickly.If you can't contribute financially please share this so we can reach as many people as possible.

story:
My name is Maria. I am a waitress and my husband works for a construction company as a framer. In March 2012 I was diagnosed with breast cancer and had a mastectomy. My recovery time was all together 3 months when I couldn't work. I still had to pay my health insurance and my husband's salary was not enough to cover all the expenses so all our savings were gone. At the beginning of 2013 my doctors recommended to go through hysterectomy as a result of massive tumors that could have been malignant. Even though they appeared to be benign I had to stay at home for the next 3 months. It happened that someone lent us some money that we fully paid back.

Now my breast cancer came back and I am facing 20 weeks of chemotherapy, another surgery and radiation. I don't have anyone who could help me. 

I need to pay my insurance which is $1018 monthly for both of us and will probably be increased to keep my medical procedures going. 

I will be grateful for any amount as well as spreading this information among people who can help.

story:
Short Summary

Martial Arts has changed my life. It has made me happier, healthier, and has taught me the importance of not giving up when things become difficult. It has helped me build friendships that will last a lifetime and given me training partners that I have high respect for. Building this Academy will not make me financially successful. I just want to earn enough to keep the lights on for our students. If we can build a place where people love to attend and where we can really make a difference in peoples lives, that would mean more to me than any financial gain. That would be worth all the time and sacrifices I am making to get this off the ground. 

 

I am no ones master. I am simply a student that is willing to train and teach all that I have learned. I love teaching the kids especially. Watching them become more confident, and learn to overcome difficult situations is gratifying. I try to be a good example to them on and off the mats. Showing them I am willing to fight to keep our team together is important to me. I will be working to get us a new head Jiu Jitsu coach after we open. 

We have a great group martial artist that are knowledgeable in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, Catch Wrestling, Judo, Sambo, Boxing, and MMA that are willing to share their knowledge with our team. Without your help we will all have to go our separate ways and search for more expensive and less convenient places to train. If we don't open, some of our students wont be able to train at all. We need our communities help. Every little bit counts!

What We Need & What You Get

I have spent a ton of time trying to figure out the bare minimum that we will need to get off the ground:

Location: I have negotiated a convenient location on the lower level of 229 Main Street. It is easy to get to and gives us 525 square feet of mat space, a striking area and a changing room! The landlord is willing to work with us but will require a deposit.

Location Startup costs-$1000

LLC: $450

Insurance: $800

Mats: To fill an area this large with quality mats can easily run over $4,000. We have decided to go with a more affordable option. It is the official way the Gracie family makes their mats! Here's a video breakdown:   

I already received quotes on cost of materials. Here's the breakdown:
 
$230 Carpet Padding
$650 Polyethylene Foam
$270 Industrial Carpet
$400 Vinyl Covering
 
Total Mat Cost: $1550
 
Materials Misc: $200 We will need paint, cleaning supplies, hardware, seating etc. (I am being very conservative here.)
 

 

The Impact

 

Martial Arts can be life changing. It crushes ego, builds confidence and teaches you more than just cool moves. It helps you get in shape and builds lifelong friendships. We will work hard to make a lasting difference in our students lives. By donating you wont only be helping us open, you will be part of creating a place where people will not be judged and will be encouraged to be the best versions of themselves. We cannot do it without your help. Please consider donating in any way you can. This is a great opportunity to be a part of something very special!

 

Risks & Challenges

We know there will be many challenges along the way and unexpected costs as we move along. Even after we raise the funds there will be a lot of building to do and paperwork to get us up and running.  We will lean on our friends and family to get this built quickly.

In the end we will have an affordable and friendly place where we can train and grow together. Every donation will be used to build our facility. We really need your help and would appreciate you telling others about our goal.  If we do not reach our goal, unfortunately we will not be able to open. Please help as much as you can.Thank you!

Romans 12:2

James 4:15

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell others about our campaign
  • Introduce us to businesses that may be interested in sponsoring a student.
  • Donate martial arts equipment, building materials, wall pads
  • Donate your time and talents to helping us build!

*Anyone who donates and provides an email address will be updated on our progress through our newsletter.

Thank you!

story:
Summary

Cuck Fancer. was started by Ben Teller at the age of 18. After being diagnosed with Hodgkins Lymphoma at 18, 20, and 22 and having two life saving transplants, he realized that their were a lack of resources for young adults affected by cancer. Cuck Fancer. is dedicated to doing whatever it takes to help these amazing individuals get their feet back on the ground.

Last year, Cuck Fancer. gave out $12,000 to eight amazing individuals who were affected by cancer. This was known as our first "Cuck It" grant. We plan to do this annually, and without your help this cannot be done.

For the first time ever, Cuck Fancer. is coming to UC San Diego in effort to spread awareness to our peers. This year, we have decided that we wanted to spread awareness in a new way.

One of our events at UC San Diego this year includes many of our friends shaving their heads in support of those battling cancer. The event will culminate on Wednesday, April 16th at UC San Diego.

This Campaign: Shave a Head to Cuck Fancer!

We are launching this campaign to raise money for young adults affected by cancer. Over 15 people have volunteered to shave their head in support of all those fighting today. By donating to this campaign, you will be sponsoring one of these participants.

For every $100 raised, one more person will shave their head. Come witness this event on April 16th, at UC San Diego. This is a community effort, and cannot be done without each and everyone one of you. Each dollar counts.

Many of our participants are taking the extra step of promoting a goal that they would like to see achieved before they are eligible to shave their head. They have posted personal messages on social media about these goals (in fact, one of these participants may be who brought you here to this page!)

What We Need & What You Get

For every $100 raised, one participant will shave their head. It is that simple. 

The money we raise will go directly towards funding our "Cuck It" grant recipients for the year 2014. The more money we raise, the more heads will be shaved, and the more we can help support the young adult cancer community! Please help us reach our big picture goal of $3,000!

Check out some of our AWESOME perks!  


$1-- You are a mother CUCKER, so thank you for your support. 

$5- You are CUCKIN awesome, we will be sending you a Cuck Fancer Bracelet. 

$10- Oh, CUCK no. You will be getting 2 bracelets! 

$25- What the CUCK! A Cuck Fancer shirt or tank in any size you want with a bracelet as well. 

$50- You are too CUCKIN much. 2 shirts, 2 bracelets and a hug! 

$100-  CUCK YEAH! 2 CF shirt/tanks, and 10 bracelets. 

$250- Just CUCK it. 5 shirts, 20 bracelets.

$500- I can’t CUCKIN contain myself. You alone have gotten five people to shave their heads. 10 shirts, 30 bracelets, and we will be recognizing you as a cuckin awesome donor!

$1000- Are you CUCKIN Kidding me? Thank you. Any amount of shirts/bracelets CF swag you want, plus a grant will be given in your name for our 2014 “Cuck It Grant” recipients. 

"The fight on cancer cannot be done alone, it can only be done when people unite as one and fight together."-- Anonymous

Your contribution is tax deductible, if you have any questions, please feel free to contact Ben whenever via email at ben@cuckfancer.com!

Frequently Asked Questions

What is Cuck Fancer.?

Cuck Fancer. is a 501(c) organization started by UC Irvine alum, Ben Teller. Cuck Fancer. is dedicated to raising awareness for young adult cancer by helping survivors get their feet back on the ground.

At Cuck Fancer. we believe young adult survivors need a certain type of support. It’s our intention to do whatever it takes to help get these unique individuals back to their lives. There is a lack of resources for this age group that tends to get overlooked by the cancer world.

Cuck Fancer. will contribute anything necessary so young adult survivors can get their feet back on the ground: Rent, tuition, school supplies, car payments or medical bills. Cuck Fancer. strives to eliminate obstacles in any way possible so young adult cancer survivors can move forward in their lives with a sense of purpose.

Where will my money go?

All proceeds donated to this campaign will go directly towards funding the 2014 Cuck It Grants. To learn more about the Grant  itself and about the 2013 grant receipients, please visit http://cuckfancer.com/grant-recipients. The more money raised, the more grants we will be able to give out!

What are other ways to contribute to the cause?

If you would like to purchase more Cuck Fancer. apparel, please visit the online store: http://cuckfancer.com/shop

If your company is interested in sponsoring the 2014 Cuck Fancer. week at UC San Diego  and any other inquiries, please do not hesitate to contact founder Ben Teller at ben@cuckfancer.com

What if I want to do more than donate...and want to volunteer to shave my head, is that possible?

One word: YES! Any one interested in volunteering to shave their heads on April 16th at UC San Diego as part of this campaign please contact founder Ben at ben@cuckfancer.com

story:
I am Diego O. Minnicelli, a Chemical engineer specialized in herbal remedies by profession, a Reflexologist by passion!

I learnt about Reflexology from a Medical Doctor in Uruguay and  became my family therapist. While living in South Asia, I improved my learning and practice. When I came back to live in Italy, I started doing it on charity basis, as a service towards the needy.

As the Italian Health Insurance does not cover Reflexology treatments, the poor people have not access to them. But there is a way to remedy this problem: teaching them how to improve themselves their health through Reflexology. 

I am asking for your help in order to getting 2.100 euros, the minimum financial resources to cover the teachings of three courses for the poor elderly living in Genoa, Liguria.

For every donation of 10 euros, you'll get one reflexology map sent to you by email.

For every donation of 25 euros, you'll get three reflexology maps sent to you by email.

For every donation of 50 euros, you'll get five reflexology maps sent to you by email.

If the amount does not reach the total need, I will teach as many courses as possible, one or two...

Wherever your donations might exceed the need, they will be dedicated to special treatments for the ailments that cannot be solved only through self-treatment.

My project points towards the sustainability of the primary health problems within the families, so much dependent nowadays from chemical medicines.

It's all about helping ourselves to maintain or improve our family health through simple self treatments of Reflexology.

I've already taught one small group of three families during a three months period. It was amazing the changes that we achieved regarding the family members health conditions and the improvement of the relationship among the family members.

Of course the risk exist about people coming to the courses but not practicing at home, so not getting the benefit in the end... I've thought to follow up their home treatments as a competition within the group.

If you think this project is worthy to be supported, then please spread the voice among your community in order to creating more awareness about the tools we can use to restore our health within our family.

story:
40, fat and frumpy to World Champion?

A.K.A How My Life Changed At 40 To Lead Me To Represent My Country As An Elite Athlete

Us Aussies loves our sport.

We spend years as kids learning how to be our sporting idols, weekends cheering for teams and hours watching people compete to take out championships at local, state, national and international level. With the Commonwealth Games happening right now in Glasgow, I’m sure many of you are cheering on your favourites, willing them to bring home the Gold.

While you’re watching these exceptional athletes, just take a closer look at them. In the main, they appear to be in their teens, and twenties. The majority of them may have been training at their chosen sport, almost since they could walk. For many of us who habour dreams of becoming a champion at our favourite sport, these dreams gradually fade as we grow up, go to university, get a job, get married, have kids…grow older...and forty five is far too old to become a World champion...

Isn't it?

Well, five years ago, I would definitely have agreed with you.

You see, like any other person, I was in a stable long term relationship,  working as a computer programmer, going out with friends to café’s or restaurants or the pub after work most Fridays. I played a bit of social tennis, went to the gym a few times a week (to earn my Friday night beer!);

You know…normal.

It was when my relationship went sour and I found myself suddenly single, a bit lost and direction less that I knew something had to change. I wasn't happy with many things in my life and like many other women my weight was a massive issue for me...so a fitness assessment at my gym that put me into the 'obese' category was a mighty shock! 

I cried. A lot. Life wasn't supposed to be like this!

But crying wasn't going to fix it, so I decided to do something about it and that is when the gym started to feature much more regularly in my life and I loved it.

25 kg later (lighter!), I was looking great, but my life was a mess and clinical depression set in. Exercise is frequently touted as being beneficial for depression and so it proved - the gym became my sanctuary, as I focused intently on the only thing that seemed to be working. I hired a trainer and the results we started getting were a revelation to me. I decided to reward myself with a photo-shoot - for coming so far and not quitting, and this led to the snap decision to compete in a bodybuilding contest - and I won!

State Novice Figure Champion at my first attempt! 

That was followed up with 3rd at National and 3rd at the Natural Universe competition…at just my 3rd show!

Now I had the bug and wanted to see how far this unexpected turn of events would go, but long term shoulder problems led to the doctors telling me to quit (all) sport - or get a double shoulder reconstruction. I took the surgery option and went back to the gym, only to be told again by the doctors to 'not even walk if I could avoid it' or face double hip surgery as injuries piled on top of injuries.


It was the lowest of low points and this is where Aiden (my trainer) did something extraordinary  - he took me aside and said 'Sarah, you have the genetics, the shape, the symmetry, the discipline – you've got the pins (legs), you've got the mental toughness in spades (stubborn as a donkey!) - if you can get over these injuries, you can go anywhere...and I will go there with you'

Sometimes it only takes one person to believe in you, and that was it - after I'd picked my jaw off the floor, we set to work. 9 more long slow months, not of bodybuilding, but re-building my body structurally from the ground up. Another year of slow patient building, leading up to last year’s successful comeback winning 5 of 6 State categories, 1 overall State title and my category at Australian level...

Aged 44! 


Who'd have thought, a mild mannered, formerly very overweight 40 year old computer programmer would now be in a position to not only represent Australia on the world stage, but is a very strong contender to win gold!

I imagine it now - standing in the spotlights, with competitors from all over the world, who too are representing their country, waiting...waiting - anxiously, heart in mouth to hear the announcement...I hear it...

'and the winner is...representing Australia...Sarah Taylor!'

I would cry, I know that – tears of joy, relief and sheer pride in the fact that I'd done everyone who supported me proud, knowing that Aiden’s belief in me and complete commitment to the process was justified and no matter how tough it got, I never gave up on my dream.

I know that I am a serious contender to take out the Worlds, I just need your support to help me get there, to show the world that us Aussies pull together, to show them we are ‘the best of the best’ on the biggest stage.

Oh, and I'm not planning on just winning one title...oh no, I'm planning on taking out the championships across three Natural World Federations!

  • INBA/PNBA Pro/Am World Cup, Hollywood, CA, USA
  • UFE World Championships, Toronto, Canada
  • WNBF/INBF World Championships, Boston, MA, USA

Why I am worth supporting

My motto is 'It’s never too late, you just have to start'. 

I am proof that you don’t have to be skilled at sport your entire life to be a World Champion, you don’t have to have been training since you were three to be able to represent your country and best of all;

YOU CAN BE OVER 40 and still chase a dream.

This is my Commonwealth Games and Olympics all rolled into one, and I am asking all of you, if you have had a dream that you have let go, you might have thought that you would love to represent your country, wrap yourself in the flag and cry as they play the National anthem - to help me to do it!

What I Need

Competing is expensive as many of you know! My basic goal is to get there and get on stage, so flights, accommodation and registration are kind of essential :-)

  • Flights = $2500
  • 9 Nights Competition Accommodation (you have to stay in the designated hotels) = $1500
  • Membership = $450
  • Registration Fees = $600

TOTAL: $5050

Beyond that there are a lot of other expenses:

  • Accommodation (the other 11 nights) = $1100
  • Meals/ Incidentals (20 days overseas * $50) = $1000
  • Rent! (I'm a contractor, so no work = no pay!) = $1500
  • Drug Testing Fees = $300
  • Tanning (I have 6 spray tans/show!!) = $600
  • Hair/Makeup = $450

What's in it for you?

Now, the important bit - and you know, this is the best part of it.

What I can do to help and give back to you?

Over the last few years I have developed into a well-known blogger, creator and publisher of Figure & Physique Magazine and featured writer for 2 of the federations I am competing for. I have also become an accomplished photographer - many of you will have frequently seen me at competitions – camera glued to my head!

So there are heaps of things I can do for you!

  • Exclusive Updates
  • Q & A's on diet, nutrition, health, fitness, competing, posing
  • Virtual Coaching
  • Photo Sessions
  • Competition Assistance
  • Train with my Trainer

I’ve put together a few things over there on the right – check them out

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to be able to help financially, please forward this on to anyone you know who may have a love for sport, Australia and/or Australian athletes. All contributions help and your support is greatly appreciated! 

  • Make some noise - share this campaign on facebook, twitter - everyone you know
  • Check out my blog at http://sarah-taylor.com/ - I'll be documenting my journey here
  • Cheer me on by joining my facebook page https://www.facebook.com/SarahTaylorFigureChampionPhotographerBlogger - I'll be posting blog links, and short videos, training and diet tips here
  • Maybe you have friends or relatives in LA, Toronto or Boston who have a couch that I could sleep on for a few days
Lets get loud and make this happen!
story_txt:
40, fat and frumpy to World Champion?
A.K.A How My Life Changed At 40 To Lead Me To Represent My Country As An
Elite Athlete
Us Aussies loves our sport.
We spend years as kids learning how to be our sporting idols, weekends
cheering for teams and hours watching people compete to take out championships
at local, state, national and international level. With the Commonwealth
Games happening right now in Glasgow, I’m sure many of you are cheering on your
favourites, willing them to bring home the Gold. 
While you’re watching these exceptional athletes, just take a closer look at them. In the main, they
appear to be in their teens, and twenties. The majority of them may have
been training at their chosen sport, almost since they could walk. For many of
us who habour dreams of becoming a champion at our favourite sport, these
dreams gradually fade as we grow up, go to university, get a job, get married,
have kids…grow older...and forty five is far too old to become a World champion...
Isn't it? 
Well, five years ago, I would definitely have agreed with you.
You see, like any other person, I was in a stable long term relationship,  working as a computer programmer, going out
with friends to café’s or restaurants or the pub after work most Fridays. I
played a bit of social tennis, went to the gym a few times a week (to earn my
Friday night beer!); 
You know…normal.


It was when my relationship went sour and I found myself
suddenly single, a bit lost and direction less that I knew something had to
change. I wasn't happy with many things in my life and like many other women my
weight was a massive issue for me...so a fitness assessment at my gym that put
me into the 'obese' category was a mighty shock! 
I cried. A lot. Life wasn't supposed to be like this! 
But crying wasn't going to fix it, so I decided to do something about
it and that is when the gym started to feature much more regularly in my life and
I loved it.


25 kg later (lighter!), I was looking great, but my life was a mess and
clinical depression set in. Exercise is frequently touted as being
beneficial for depression and so it proved - the gym became my sanctuary, as I
focused intently on the only thing that seemed to be working. I hired a trainer and the results we started getting were a revelation to me. I decided to reward myself with a photo-shoot - for coming
so far and not quitting, and this led to the snap decision to compete in a bodybuilding
contest - and I won! 



State Novice Figure Champion at my first attempt! 
That was followed up
with 3rd at National and 3rd at the Natural Universe
competition…at just my 3rd show!


Now I had the bug and wanted to see how far this unexpected turn of
events would go, but long term shoulder problems led to the doctors
telling me to quit (all) sport - or get a double shoulder reconstruction. I
took the surgery option and went back to the gym, only to be told again by the
doctors to 'not even walk if I could avoid it' or face double hip surgery as injuries piled on top of
injuries. 




It was the lowest of low points and this is where Aiden (my trainer) did something extraordinary  - he took me aside and said
'Sarah, you have the genetics, the shape, the symmetry, the discipline – you've got the pins (legs), you've got the mental toughness in spades (stubborn as a
donkey!) - if you can get over these injuries, you can go anywhere...and I will
go there with you'
Sometimes it only takes one person to believe in you, and that was it - after I'd picked my jaw off the floor, we set to work. 9 more long slow months, not of bodybuilding, but re-building my body
structurally from the ground up. Another year of slow patient building, leading up to last year’s successful comeback winning 5 of 6 State categories, 1 overall State title and my category at
Australian level...
Aged 44! 


Who'd have thought, a mild mannered, formerly very overweight 40 year
old computer programmer would now be in a position to not only represent
Australia on the world stage, but is a very strong contender to win gold!
I imagine it now - standing in the spotlights, with competitors from all
over the world, who too are representing their country, waiting...waiting -
anxiously, heart in mouth to hear the announcement...I hear it...
'and the winner is...representing Australia...Sarah
Taylor!'
I would cry, I know that – tears of joy, relief and sheer pride in the
fact that I'd done everyone who supported me proud, knowing that Aiden’s
belief in me and complete commitment to the process was justified and no matter how tough it got, I never gave up on
my dream.
I know that I
am a serious contender to take out the Worlds, I just
need your support to help me get there, to show the world
that us Aussies pull together, to show them we are ‘the best of the
best’ on the biggest stage.
Oh, and I'm not planning on just winning one title...oh no, I'm planning on taking out the championships
across three Natural World Federations!

INBA/PNBA Pro/Am World Cup,
     Hollywood, CA, USA
UFE World Championships,
     Toronto, Canada
WNBF/INBF World
     Championships, Boston, MA, USA


Why I am worth supporting
My motto is 'It’s never too late, you just have to start'. 
I am proof that you don’t have to be skilled at sport your entire life to be a World Champion, you don’t have to have been training since you were three to be able to represent your country and best of all;
YOU CAN BE OVER 40 and still chase a dream.
This is my Commonwealth Games and Olympics all rolled into one, and I am asking all of you, if you have had a dream that you have let go, you might have thought that you would love to represent your country, wrap yourself in the flag and cry as they play the National anthem - to help me to do it!


What I Need 
Competing is expensive as many of you know! My basic goal is to get there and get on stage, so flights,
accommodation and registration are kind of essential :-)

Flights = $2500
9 Nights Competition
     Accommodation (you have to stay in the designated hotels) = $1500

Membership = $450


Registration Fees = $600


TOTAL: $5050
Beyond that there are a lot of other expenses:



Accommodation (the other 11 nights) = $1100

Meals/ Incidentals (20 days overseas * $50) = $1000
Rent! (I'm a contractor, so no work = no pay!) = $1500

Drug Testing Fees = $300


Tanning (I have 6 spray tans/show!!) = $600


Hair/Makeup = $450




What's in it for you?

 
Now, the important bit - and you know, this is the best part of it.
What I can do to help and give back to you?
Over the last few
years I have developed into a
well-known blogger, creator and publisher of Figure & Physique Magazine and featured writer for 2 of the federations I am competing
for. I have also become an accomplished photographer - many of you will
have frequently seen me at competitions – camera glued to my head!


So there are heaps of things I can do for you!



Exclusive Updates


Q & A's on diet, nutrition, health, fitness, competing, posing


Virtual Coaching


Photo Sessions


Competition Assistance

I’ve put together a few
things over there on the right – check them out

If you are not in a position to be able to help financially, please forward this on to anyone you know who may have a love for sport, Australia and/or Australian athletes. All contributions help and your support is greatly appreciated!

story:
Cresilda is a 38 year old single mother of 3 young children who live with her mother in the Philippines while she has been working as a domestic helper in Hong Kong since 2011 in order to support them.

In September 2014 Cresilda was diagnosed with an aggressive form of breast cancer, stage 3C. Sadly, Cresilda lost her job shortly afterwards in circumstances that strongly suggest discriminatory action. As a result Cresilda no longer holds Hong Kong resident status, and hence does not qualify for treatment in government hospitals at Hong Kong residents rates.

The doctors at Queen Mary Hospital have told her she urgently needs to start treatment as her cancer is already spreading and have devised a treatment plan which includes target chemo therapy, surgery and radiotherapy but Cresilda is unable to have any treatment yet as she cannot afford it at private patient rates which is all the public hospital can offer her.

Cresilda’s first course of target therapy alone will cost HKD$30,000 and this needs to be paid in advance before she can start her treatment. The total cost of treatment is likely to be in the region of HKD$500,000. Some donations have been received but they are not enough to cover her treatment.

Cresilda approached Helpers for Domestic Helpers (HDH) for assistance and the organization is supporting her in pursuing a civil claim against her former employer. But time is not on her side and she needs urgent medical treatment now.  

This initial campaign is to enable her to start treatment with Chemotherapy, without your donations Cresilda's cancer will likely spread.  Please help alleviate her suffering by donating towards her treatment.

story:
"If every 8 year old in the world is taught meditation, we will eliminate violence from the world within one generation" Dalai Lama

Meditation Touch was created for people exactly like you, people who are caught up in the stressful rat race to complete one task after another (studies, work, family...). They are people who understand that this endless rat race has a high price on their physical and mental health, and so, they wish to take corrective measures. They are people who know that meditation is a good solution, but who are still unable to find the right way to incorporate it into their busy daily routine, or who just didn't find the right meditation suitable for themselves, yet. 


Meditation Touch is a unique combination of state-of-the-art biofeedback technologies with the pioneer iFeel Emotional Diagnosis®. Meditation Touch will enable you to discover your inner self, pinpoint the underlying emotion, and match it with the right meditation — which will give you back your inner peace. Making Meditation Touch the best self-help app ever!  

Do you feel suffocated and restless sometimes? Tense and exhausted from the stressful routine? Bored from the tasks that never seem to end? Think how much fun it would be if you could practice activities that guarantee to raise the level of peace in your life. How happy it would be to become calm, focused, and centered like…a cat. Cats have the amazing ability to be relaxed and peaceful at any given moment without losing their concentration and alertness. Furthermore, cats are constantly aware to the environment and, at the same time, attentive to themselves and engaged in enriching their inner world. With Meditation Touch, you can develop these qualities. Learn how to be a cat — ask Meditation Touch how.

Meditation is the deepest, healthiest, and cheapest solution to wipe a way your daily stress. Many studies have shown the immense contribution of meditation to our overall physical health and well-being — lowering of blood pressure, strengthening of the immune system, anti-aging, etc., along with remarkable improvement in cognitive abilities, such as concentration and creativity, and bettering of social relations. Above all, meditation contributes to inner peace, develops love and compassion, and increases happiness. 


"The ultimate reason for meditating is to transform ourselves in order to be better able to transform the world"  Matthieu Ricard

Mediation is a scientific proven solution for many emotional situations: stress, depression, anxiety, emotional eating, pain, insomnia, PMS, ADHD, mood swing and many more. Understanding this we would like to take Meditation Touch a step forward beyond stress relieve and help you to cope better with even an additional undesirable emotional situation like:

   

Thanks to Meditation Touch, an ocean of spiritual knowledge will become accessible to you at the push of a button, anytime and anywhere! Thanks to the clear instructions and insightful visualization, this ancient knowledge is now so welcoming and friendly that you couldn't go a day without meditating. 

Thanks to your contribution, Meditation Touch will become a reality and help lead hundreds of thousands of people to a better and happier life.

We will be thrilled to hear from you about how Meditation Touch can help your life in myriad ways, and adjust our development accordingly. We have opened, especially for our Indiegogo friends, an on-line poll that will determine which additional meditation we will be releasing in October 2015. 

please press to cast your vote or to get updated with the latest results.

Please support and donate to our Indiegogo campaign. Spread the word to all your friends who you think could benefit from our app. Share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook and Twitter, so we can grow. And, together, we can make meditation an integral part of everybody's life, and thus help everyone make use of and enjoy the tremendous advantages of meditation to become healthier and happier.

Beta Releases


Our Perks
   Inspiring Wall Hanging Quotes

          Smart Fitness Bracelet

    Biofeedback Stress Monitor

SmartWatch

 




Frequently Asked Questions

1. How much would it cost to download Meditation Touch app to my smartphone?

Meditation Touch team believes that practising meditation is a precious privilege, and the opportunity to be exposed to this valuable information should be free and open to anyone in the world. Following this view, your contribution would helps us to make this possible!

2. When will I receive my Perks?

It is important for the Meditation Touch team that you are happy and satisfied, and we will do everything to ensure compliance with timelines defined and send you the perks by end of April 2014. The I feel Emotional Diagnosis Sessions will be personally schedule from January to March 2015 .

3. Which smartphones will support the Meditation Touch app?

Meditation Touch team would like everyone to be able to download the app and enjoy the benefit of meditation. We will do our best to make the Meditation Touch app compatible with the new generation of smartphones.

4. How can I let you know what meditation I would like you to develop so that it suits me?

Meditation Touch team puts high emphasis on listening to and understanding your needs and desires. We'd love to know how you think Meditation Touch will improve your life and in what situations you would see yourself using the app. For this purpose, we have opened a special survey which will allow all our Indiegogo family members to help us decide which meditation we should release by October 2015. We are committed to including the chosen meditation as a part of the Meditation Touch official release! Do not miss this one-time opportunity to significantly affect the app development — Vote Now!

Besides this survey, we encourage you to communicate with us through our Facebook page, YouTube channel, Twitter account, Google Plus account, and, of course, here, through our Indiegogo page.

5. Do I have to be an experienced meditator to enjoy the Meditation Touch app?

No! Meditation Touch is built to suit everybody, even those who have never practised meditation, as well as those who have been practising for a long time. The Physiological measurements and iFeel Emotional Diagnosis® will allow Meditation Touch to adjust, every time, just for you, the right meditation for your present situation from among the variety of meditations and to allow you to get familiar with an exciting new world. Detailed guidelines combined with the unique visualization will pave the road for you to comfortably and intriguingly explore the ancient knowledge and wisdom of the Oriental mind teachings.

6. What is Biofeedback?

Biofeedback helps in understanding and controlling the connection between body and mind by providing real-time physiological measurement (e.g., brainwaves, muscle tone, skin conductance, and heart rate variability) in conjunction with the emotional state. Those physiological indicators are associated with many emotional situations such as stress, anxiety, anger, etc. Developing awareness to those indicators and learning relaxation techniques (such as breathing and guided imagery) can improve your control of those situations and help you learn how to manage those emotions, rather than letting the emotions manage you. Using Meditation Touch will help you monitor these indicators and enable you to easily perceive the positive effects of meditation on the body in real time.

7. Do I have to purchase additional biofeedback devices to use Meditation Touch?

No! To enjoy the emotional diagnosis and to receive the right meditation for you, you don't need any additional biofeedback devices. However, to maximize the Meditation Touch experience, the Meditation Touch team believes, you need to listen well to your body (and not just to your mind), and this can be done easily and precisely using the biofeedback technologies. Over the next year, the new generation of smartphones and smartwatches (like Samsung S5, Apple Watch) will already give some basic biofeedback technologies as an integral part which can be used directly with Meditation Touch. Moreover, the Meditation Touch team understands the need and desire of the users to get deep physiological feedback with advanced equipment (e.g., heart rate variation, skin conductance, brain waves), so we are working hard to support them. Even at present, you can ensure yourself the most beneficial Meditation Touch experience by choosing the biofeedback stress monitor offered as perks for contributors.

8. What is iFeel?

iFeel is a pioneer Emotional Diagnosis technique based on both ancient and contemporary theories of diagnosis, such as color diagnosis, Tibetan Buddhism, Bach Remedies, and many more. iFeel Emotional Diagnosis® can bypass the logical and rational in us and get deeper insights regarding the emotional state, thinking patterns, and behavior of the user. This technique enables you not only to discover your inner self, but also to pinpoint the underlying emotion and, thus, match the right meditation for you. 

9. Can I stop psychological treatment and drugs following the use of Meditation Touch?

No! Meditation Touch is a smartphone app, and in no way is a substitute for medical or psychological treatment! However, if you meet regularly with the physician, please consult with him/her on how to combine Meditation Touch with the existing treatment.

10. Where can I get more information on the benefits of meditation?

You can get more information by clicking on the following link

11. Way i can't find iMeow Meditation Touch App in the App store?

iMeow Meditation Touch App is still under development. The official release will be around April 2015. If you would like to have early access you can apply for our beta team by emailing us: Meditation.Touch@gmail.com
