story:
The rise of chronic illness and disease such as diabetes is an ever increasing issue among today's youth. Real Kids Real Food, an after-school program, combats this through a proven program that encourages FUN while learning to prepare delicious recipes, enjoying exercise and growing and harvesting fruits and vegetables. This allows the community to grow strong starting from childhood giving children the opportunity to be educated on how and what will improve their quality of life.  

What We Are

Real Kids Real Food's goal is to eliminate childhood obesity, chronic disease, and malnutrition through after-school programs that promote healthy food choices and positive lifestyle changes, including:

  • Gardening & Harvesting
  • Hands-on Food Preparation of Delicious Recipes
  • Learning About Eating Right & Staying Active
We are now working to fully fund the 2014-2015 Real Kids Real Food Program to provide a strong and opportunity filled future for today's youth.

Why This Is Important

This is a matter that impacts our Nation, and the world. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention; obesity has more than doubled in children and quadrupled in adolescents in the past 30 years. 
  • Children 6-11        1980: 7%       2012: 20%
  • Children 12-19      1980: 5%       2012: 18%

In 2012, almost one third of children and adolescents were overweight or obese.  70% of obese youth had at least one risk factor for cardiovascular disease.  Obese adolescents are more prone to pre-diabetes. 

Your contribution to this project will enable us to run Real Kids Real Food, for the financial year of 2014-2015. This will make a difference in the lives of thousands of children by preventing and reversing obesity, chronic disease and malnutrition.

Where The Money Goes

Your contribution will provide:
  • Hands on Food Preparation of healthy delicious recipes.
  • Learning about nutrition and a healthy lifestyle.
  • Preventing Chronic diseases.
  • Engaging kids in physical fitness.
  • Providing parent education and involvement.
  • Enabling community service projects through the kids. 
  • Field trips to local farms. 
  • Planting and Harvesting our own garden of fruits and vegetables.
In our last campaign, we successfully raised funds to provide the materials needed to distribute educational materials to the Inner City schools who would benefit the most from our program. Find our previous campaign here: http://igg.me/at/RKRF/x/ 

Founding of Real Kids Real Food

Our passion for healing the world one person at a time began with my own recovery from crippling arthritis and substance abuse through the living food lifestyle. 

The Real Kids Real Food program began at the Martin Luther King School, located in Dorchester, MA.

My adult classes, since 2008, are based on my book “Eat to Thrive-10 Weeks to Lifelong healthy habits and healthy living”.   In these classes I address health issues and introduce a healthy lifestyle as well as train staff for Real Kids Real Food.

Polaris Bike and More Raffle 

Get your chance to receive a Polaris bicycle valued at $2,499 through our raffle! We will also will offer Life Force Juice Package ($75 value), Holistic Healing Center Network Treatment ($50 value), 18-pack of Organic Living Superfoods ($65 value). The drawing will be on September 13th at and the end of the raffle is on September 10th. Make sure to pick your raffle tickets up at the Perks at the right of your screen, there are options for 1 or 5 tickets, get them while you can!!! 


Meet our Team


For additional information on our quest for a healthier future, please refer to our website: http://www.optimumhealthsolution.org/2013/wordpress/real-kids-real-food/mystic_learning_center/
story_txt:
The rise of chronic illness and disease such as diabetes is an ever increasing issue among today's youth. Real Kids Real Food, an after-school program, combats this through a proven program that encourages FUN while learning to prepare delicious recipes, enjoying exercise and growing and harvesting fruits and vegetables. This allows the community to grow strong starting from childhood giving children the opportunity to be educated on how and what will improve their quality of life.  What We AreReal Kids Real Food's goal is to eliminate childhood obesity, chronic disease, and malnutrition through after-school programs that promote healthy food choices and positive lifestyle changes, including:
Gardening & Harvesting
Hands-on Food Preparation of Delicious Recipes
Learning About Eating Right & Staying Active
We are now working to fully fund the 2014-2015 Real Kids Real Food Program to provide a strong and opportunity filled future for today's youth.Why This Is ImportantThis is a matter that impacts our Nation, and the world. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention; obesity has more than doubled in children and quadrupled in adolescents in the past 30 years. 

Children 6-11        1980: 7%       2012: 20%
Children 12-19      1980: 5%       2012: 18%


In 2012, almost one third of children and adolescents were overweight or obese.  70% of obese youth had at least one risk factor for cardiovascular disease.  Obese adolescents are more prone to pre-diabetes. 
Your contribution to this project will enable us to run Real Kids Real Food, for the financial year of 2014-2015. This will make a difference in the lives of thousands of children by preventing and reversing obesity, chronic disease and malnutrition.
Where The Money Goes
Your contribution will provide:


Hands on Food Preparation of healthy delicious recipes.
Learning about nutrition and a healthy lifestyle.
Preventing Chronic diseases.
Engaging kids in physical fitness.
Providing parent education and involvement.
Enabling community service projects through the kids. 
Field trips to local farms. 
Planting and Harvesting our own garden of fruits and vegetables.

In our last campaign, we successfully raised funds to provide the materials needed to distribute educational materials to the Inner City schools who would benefit the most from our program. Find our previous campaign here: http://igg.me/at/RKRF/x/

story:
As a registered non-profit here in Israel, we train and educate the brave volunteers that come to serve in the IDF and prepare them to lead in the IDF’s top special forces combat units.

Nearly our entire support team, from our krav maga instructors to our lawyers, are former lone soldiers who served in elite combat units and currently volunteer their time to Tsevet Lohamim in many different capacities. We are committed to helping the next generation of IDF volunteers prepare for the intense rigors that we are familiar with and to provide them with all of the support possible.

Tsevet Lohamim needs your help! In order to expand our reach, to improve our equipment and training facilities and to provide our soldiers all of the support that is otherwise not accessible to them in their journeys, we are reaching out to you.

A donation to Tsevet Lohamim will help us reach our goals. Help these heroes that have sacrificed everything to be on the front line, not just today, but tomorrow and the next.

Thank you for support of Tsevet Lohamim. Am Israel Chai!

story:
Summary


While you're making your commute in your car, using your heater or AC feeds in air from outside. This leaves you and your family open to all the pollutants, bacteria, and toxins as well. AirFree is here to fix that leaving you a better, healthier breathing experience. AirFree is designed to be efficient, small, safe and affordable. You simply plug it in to your car and it starts working.


How does it work?


AirFree works by air ionization, which is releasing negative ions and tiny amounts of ozone in the air that neutralize things like:

  • Bacteria
  • Formaldehyde
  • Smoke
  • Odors
  • Benzene

All of which are harmful to your health. AirFree is very effective and will improve your breathing experience, guaranteed.

Simply plug it in to your car or adapter and enjoy. The LED will light up to let you know it's working.

Our ionizer will remove smoke in under 15 seconds. Watch our test below.



Why we need your help


We need you to help us get this product into your hands. We've been working on this project for around 2 years, perfecting it so that you can have a healthy breathing experience. 

Overhead for this product is really low since the casing is already made by our manufacturer while we tuned up the stuff on the inside to make it work more efficiently.

Backing this project will allow us to finalize and send them our electronic schematics so we can begin production


Risks and Challenges


As with any overseas operation, manufacturing and import problems may arise and should be accounted for. We have taken every precaution to prevent problems with production but anything could realistically happen and we'll keep you updated no matter what.


Other Ways You Can Help


Share this on Facebook and other social media platforms. Make sure everyone knows about this so you and your friends can have a better breathing experience with AirFree.

story:
Our Vision

Please allow me to introduce “Forward March”, a comprehensive, whole wellness treatment program available to all, with an emphasis on assisting our underserved  veterans. Our commitment is to help those that are at risk of homelessness, suicide, isolation, and the dissolving of the family.  Our research goes back 45 years to the Vietnam era and its returning, neglected veterans. Our program is an innovative, lifesaving, 1:1, steps curriculum that will change the world. We are in fact, the next big idea in well-being.  We aim to eradicate homelessness and put a severe dent in the number of broken families and most important,, the overwhelming number of suicides our country grieves from.  Phillips and “Forward March” share the same goal: TO SAVE LIVES.  Our mission is to expand our current 10 bed facility by renovating an additional existed wing, and eventually setting up satellite veteran wellness centers throughout the country, (especially in high veteran population areas such as California, Texas and Florida).

· Our “self-directed with 1:1 support & services” type program is accountability based.  Forward March is set up as a 7 step, three area, highly focused individual action plan that lasts as long as the individual needs it to.  We are not a 20 day, 60 day, etc program.  If a person needs a year to complete their program, they may have a year.

·  Our commitment  will have such a positive impact on our country it will reach the levels of effectiveness to match those such as “Boys and Girls Clubs of America”, “AA”, “Red Cross”, “Saint Jude’s Children’s Research Hospitals”, and/or “Ronald McDonald House’s”. In short, we will be making a lasting difference.  This is not a feel good camping event where the individual has fun for a week then goes back to real life. 

· We provide the opportunity for needed self-evaluation, tools and steps to reach a level of wellness that combats the effects of depression, PTSD, anxiety, isolation, homelessness, etc.  We are the program that makes it possible for a person to move forward and reach a level of healing and whole wellness so that they may live as a happy, passionate, contributing member of society with renewed purpose and the ability to eventually help others.

·  Forward March will address the individual's Mind, Body and Spirit. It will heal the heart, repair broken relationships, as well as renew a person’s own reason for living, restore purpose and create passion.

·  We will eventually consist of many satellite facilities throughout the country, especially in high veteran concentrated areas.

·  Forward March’s comprehensive long intake & evaluation procedure ensures every participant is treated as in individual, which believe it or not is “Ground Breaking”.

·  Our program has an entity entitled “Guts & Gurus”, which consists of obtaining the services of famous experts who volunteer their passion, time and skills to those veterans that share those same interests.  This could be considered similar to the USO “concerts for troops” program, however these celebrity experts will be literally changing as well as saving lives.

· We do not require any religious affiliation or participation unless the individual requests it.

Did you know:

·  In the United States approx. one veteran commits suicide every hour, that number does not include unsuccessful attempts.

·  Approximately 40% of homeless men are veterans

·  Every year, over 800 000 people die from suicide; this roughly corresponds to one death every 40 seconds.

·  Suicide is among the three leading causes of death among those aged 15-44 years in some countries, and the second leading cause of death in the 10-24 years age group; these figures do not include suicide attempts which can be many times more frequent than suicide (10, 20, or more times according to some studies).

·  Depression is a common illness worldwide. Globally, more than 350 million people of all ages suffer from depression. It is the leading cause of disability worldwide, and is a major contributor to the global burden of disease.

·  41% of veterans are diagnosed with mental health or behavioral health problems. 20% of veterans are diagnosed with the injury called PTSD.

·  At its worst, depression can lead to total life dysfunction, homelessness, abuse, broken families and suicide.

· One size fits all group meetings, classes and programs, such as those offered by the V.A. do not work.

· You cannot solve our country's staggering suicide rates with medication alone.

· Ineffectively treated mental health issues (particularly depression and alcohol use disorders) are a major risk factor for suicide in Europe and North America.

· In poorer countries homelessness is caused by poverty.  In the richest counties, it is caused by lack of sustainable independence programs and whole-wellness.

· You cannot solve our countries homeless problem with just a roof and three meals a day.

· One size fits all housing, job service and training programs such as those offered by the V.A. do not work.

·  The current gaps in existing programs are due to not approaching each person as an individual.

·  Addressing each person as an individual is an effective, long term solution to eradicating, homelessness, and common side effects of mental health illness such as isolation, dependency, negative stigmas, abuse, and suicide.

Us

·We are in the trenches caring for veterans 24/7.

Our standard of care is built on the famous quote by JFK- "As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them." - John F. Kennedy 

We operate an assisted & independent living facility & wellness center for veterans with mental health issues such as anxiety, depression, PTSD, etc that were homeless, or are at risk of being homeless, That have struggled with severe depression, suicide attempts, family isolation, etc.   These veterans are all ages from all conflict eras.  We approach each client with open arms, no judgements and 100% love and acceptance.  Our foundation starts with forgiveness and patience.  Our program is unique and when an individual is committed, we are 100% successful in improving their life. 

Our program's mission is to expand both at our current location and nationally. 

Through our program, veterans have the opportunity  to reach a level of living well, being healthy and enjoying life. Long term suicide and homelessness prevention is ensured.

They deserve the best, and we have created it-"Forward March"


    Other Ways You Can Help

    spread the word, share our campaign.

story:
Quidditch, the Northwest, and the Portland Augureys

In 2005, students at Middlebury college in Vermont adapted the game quidditch from the Harry Potter books and movies, so that it could be played in real life. Since then it has spread worldwide, and while it keeps a sense of fun and whimsy in the community, quidditch has evolved into a very real, very physical sport.
The Portland Augureys were founded in July 2014, and are currently the only official US Quidditch team in Oregon and the only official community team of the Northwest region. We are new and small, but we're growing fast and we play the best quidditch we can, regardless of the circumstances. 

What We Need & What You Get

The first regional championship for the Northwest will be held at the Seattle Sounders' practice facility in Tukwilla, WA on March 7 of this year. We've worked hard to qualify for regionals, but now we need your help to afford it. Here are our anticipated expenses:

  • Hotel rooms for our players and coaches, to comply with USQ's travel policies
  • Gas money to get players from Portland and Eugene to Seattle
  • Registrations and financial assistance for our less financially capable players (we want quidditch to be available for everyone)
We're offering a large number of perks, a lot of which will not only support our team going to regionals but also help nurture the growth of quidditch as a sport in the Portland area.

The Impact

As a young team, we don't have a lot of established fundraising or fanbase, and contributions help us get off the ground. Being able to compete at regionals will make everyone on the team very happy and motivated, and give us a step up towards the next level of quidditch.

Challenges and Obstacles

The Augureys are still very young and new. We've been to two tournaments this season, where we've gone 1-5 but played hard and never given up. We've also had comparably good point ratios and are 3/6 on snitch grabs!
We've had small rosters and very little experience. With no previously-established teams in Portland, we've had to build our program from the ground up. Regionals would be the fruition of a lot of hard work from the whole team.
Other Ways You Can Help

We accept donations to our paypal, at portlandquidditch@gmail.com!

We're also recruiting for the team! Anyone interested in playing or volunteering for us can come to practices every Sunday at Fernhill Park in Portland, and/or check out our Facebook page, twitter, and tumblr. Also check out the page and group for the Portland Quidditch League, our parent organization.

story:
Baseball, Brothers, Family

Montana and Dalton have grown up on baseball. Both playing since they were four years old, their dream has always been to be pro ball players...well that and a Super Hero(Dalton), and a Paleontologist(Montana). Between rec ball, travel teams, and school play, the boys have played on up to six different teams between them in a season. We support them 100% in their pursuit of baseball, but the financial burden is overwhelming at times, and we feel it is important for them to help raise some of the money for their season. That brings us here.

What They Need

Last year we guesstimated $6,000 for total baseball expense throughout the year and it ended up a little over $8,000. Below are some of the expenses the boys take on each year, and each year those expenses increase and multiply. In 2016 we plan to NOT play travel ball and instead use the money normally spent there on training and specific training events.

Rec Ball fees

School Ball fees

Travel ball fees

Indoor facilities practice fees

Additional uniform fees, misc.

New equipment, equipment repairs

Consumable supplies

Travel tournament expenses, food, travel, housing - Spring/Summer

Travel tournament expenses, food, travel, housing - Fall

Majors AllStar expenses, food, travel, housing

Sr.League AllStar expenses, food, travel, housing

Instructional camps and exhibition

The Amount

Last year we told them they needed to come up with half. This year they are trying to raise 1/4 through donations, and then each year after, trying to reduce the amount until they are self-sufficient. We set it at 2,500 this year to allow for cost of producing incentives and shipping.

What You Get

Well, first, you get the satisfaction of contributing to a couple of young dreamers and helping to make those dreams a reality. But, in addition to that, we and the boys have come up with a few incentives for each level of donations. From baseball cards to professional signed prints of each player in action to cool practice shirts and pro jerseys with the boys' logo, there's plenty of swag to go around.

The Impact

The impact. The impact is huge. Baseball with our boys is what has defined our family unit for so long. We are a baseball family. We spend our time together at the field. Our boys love this game, they live it and breathe it. The only thing we've taught our boys to put before baseball is God and family. We have not allowed them to play travel ball until last year, mainly because of the financial commitment. Your contribution will allow these two boys to follow their dreams a little further.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that money is tight, and some can't even spare $5. Hey, that's why we're doing this in the first place. If you can't contribute to the boys, you can certainly help by spreading the word. Please share this with as many as you can. Thanks.

Our boys love this game, they live it and breathe it. The only thing we've taught our boys to put before baseball is God and family. We have not allowed them to play travel ball until last year, mainly because of the financial commitment. Your contribution will allow these two boys to follow their dreams a little further.Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand that money is tight, and some can't even spare $5. Hey, that's why we're doing this in the first place. If you can't contribute to the boys, you can certainly help by spreading the word. Please share this with as many as you can. Thanks.

story:
You can order Hexoskin today on our website:


Thanks to everyone! We've reached 165% of our goal!

This has been a great experience, we've made many friends and talked with awesome people!

You can now order Hexoskin on our official website.

What is Hexoskin?

Hexoskin is the first wearable movement, respiration, and heart activity tracker. Hexoskin tracks your health and gives you insights about your activities, your sleep, your life's choices.

"The Hexoskin has the advantage of being a simple shirt and not something clunky like an armband" -- Crunchwear

"Hexoskin is a sensor-filled smart shirt that offers significantly more health data than a basic fitness tracker like a Fitbit Flex." -- Digital Trends

"Hexoskin has lined up an impressive list of beta testers." -- Crowdfundinsider

"This shirt could be the future of fitness tracking" -- AskMen.com

"Hexoskin’s applications go beyond collecting stats during physical training and could be used as a constant companion." -- Gizmag

"Thrilled about the opportunity this offers for research, medical monitoring, the quantified self and art and design." -- GigaOM

"They envision a future where constant, passive health monitoring through smart clothes will feed in to big data applications and predictive analytics" -- Forbes

A big thanks to Sampo Laaksonen from Finland who helped us cross the goal! Keep on sharing the campaign with others you know might be interested!

Simple

Put on the shirt, plug your device, and your body metrics are displayed on your phone and uploaded in your account. Sleep, be active, live.

Safe

The shirt connects to a small and lightweight device that fits in a pocket on the waist. There is no device on your chest, which makes it safe for activities ranging from sleep to contact sports.

Sophisticated

It does a lot more than your old heart rate strap, without the strap. Its trio of sensors offers a high-quality ECG signal, the most precise breathing volume measurement, and movement sensors that measure activity, steps, cadence, and sleep position.

Connected

When you wear the shirt, your health stats are digitized and uploaded in real-time. You can get detailed reports on your training and general health in a web browser on any device:

  • Training reports and training programs
  • Activity and stress levels during the day
  • Sleep quality reports

Get a clear view of your overall performance and reports on your progress. See your trainings in details, like you've never seen them before.

Individual Training

Hexoskin Solo is our personal training app. When we'll ship your Hexoskin, the app will come with these tools:

  • Programmable training plan (create and share).
  • GPS training tools with waypoints activated trainings.
  • Interval training based on physiological response.
  • Display real-time data (including ECG and breathing).
  • Connect to smart watches and glasses.

 

Team Training

Hexoskin Team is our team training app. If you're a trainer, this app allows you to program, time and annotate athlete training routines. Time groups of athletes simultaneously. No more juggling with stopwatches.You can be connected to 3 Hexoskin data streams in real-time using the app.

See how Hexoskin compares to traditional training monitoring tools.

Sleep

Your body speaks when you sleep. Hexoskin has all the sensors you need for precise sleep monitoring. Measure sleep efficiency, position changes, breathing, and heart rate at rest.

Free, Unlimited Data Storage. Forever.

Hexoskin can record more than 3 million data points per hour. To make sure you never lose your data, we offer you free, unlimited data storage. 

Open == Transparent

Hexoskin is simple to use and its apps are powerful, but we also wanted Hexoskin to be open for hobbyists and 3rd party apps. 

Here is what we will make available for those who want to develop Hexoskin software:

  • Open web API: access to full data, including raw data.

Connect to Other Apps

The Hexoskin API tools will make it easy to connect to your favorite training and tracking apps.

  • Share trainings on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Sync with RunKeeper or Withings.
  • Track with IFTTT, Tictrac, Dashbook, Open.Sen.se, HumanAPI.
  • Export your data and use it with research tools such as VivoSense by Vivonoetics, R or Octave.
  • Tell us which app you would like to be supported!

Join our developer community: api@hexoskin.com

Notes: mobile apps are included will all perks, phone is shown to illustrate the app only. All Federal, Provincial and State taxes are extra where applicable.

Why Indiegogo?

After years of development, and tests by research groups, professionals, amateur athletes, but also inactive people, we've decided to make this technology available for all at an affordable price. By contributing to this campaign, you helped us get the production volume we need to lower the price to 399$.

The Team

Here are the awesome people working on this project!

Missing from picture: Lucie Maud Marchand, Pat Mitchell.

We've been working on wearable health sensors since 2006. Here are a few pictures of early prototypes.


Biosignal analog test bench, electronic shirt tester, 3D printed prototypes.

Why You Need a Hexoskin

  • Because you love knowledge, and knowledge is power.
  • Because you want to get to know yourself better.
  • Because you want to get in shape.
  • Because you want to see what happens when you meditate.
  • Because you want to do some great self tracking.
  • Because you want to be the first in your research group who has this awesome raw data producing wearable instrument that is Hexoskin.
  • Because you want to look like the person at the gym that knows the most even though you have no clue.
  • Because you want to look like the person at the gym who knows the most because you really do.
  • Because you want a personal coach when you go to the gym.
  • Because it's cool and so are you!

Specs

Even though Hexoskin is simple to use everyday, the sensors gather an insane amount of information on your body. All that information is available on demand and allow you to get insights about your health.

  • Designed and assembled in Canada.
  • Shirts are made of high-quality Italian textiles.
  • Quick dry, breathes, feather weight, anti-odour, chlorine resistant, UV protection.
  • Open API so you can download all the data and use with other apps.
  • Bluetooth connectivity with iPhone and iPad. (Android coming next)
  • Heart rate, RR intervals, fatigue and stress indicator (Heart Rate Variability).
  • Breathing rate and breathing volume.
  • Activity intensity, peak acceleration, steps and cadence.
  • Analog 256Hz ECG data.
  • Analog dual-channel 128Hz breathing sensors.
  • Analog 3D 64Hz acceleration.
  • 14+ hours of battery life, 157+ hours of standalone recording.

Call to Mobile/Wearable Developers!

We're looking for developers to develop new applications for Hexoskin on these devices:

  • Pebble Watch, Neptune Pine, Kreyos, Samsung Gear, and other smart watches.
  • Google Glass, Recon, and other head-mounted displays.
  • Mobile platforms SDKs (iOS and Android).
  • Microsoft Kinect, Leap Motion.

Contact us to join our developer community: api@hexoskin.com

Beta Users

Among our beta users, we have:

  • The Canadian Space Agency Life Sciences and Space Medicine groups.
  • Athletes training for the next Olympic Games such as Marc-André Bédard, Claude Godbout, Chloé, Justine, and Maxime Dufour-Lapointe.
  • Research teams at MIT AgeLab, Waterloo, Concordia PERFORM Centre, McGill, Baycrest, University of Montreal, École Polytechnique de Montréal, and other universities.
  • Professional athletes performing in the NHL.
  • Sports performance professionals such as CSCS, Postural Sports Performance, Victoria Park, Neurosport, M2M Lab, Cognisens.
  • Amateur athletes in many sports like long-distance running, triathlon, cycling, speed skating, cross-country skiing, skeleton, hockey, hiking, cross-fit, etc.
  • ... and a number of ordinary people just like you who are trying to live a healthy life!

              

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign (in your workout group, on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, blogs, etc).
  • Click on the buttons at the bottom of this page!

Press Coverage

(DigitalTrends, GigaOM, Business Insider, Gizmag, Forbes, Crowdfundinsider, Crunchwear, Gadget Review, TechVibes, Star Phoenix, La Presse, Les Affaires, TVA Sports)

Partners

VivoSense by Vivonoetics is a physiological analysis software used by leading research groups at the Mayo Clinic, Harvard, and Adidas. They an import data from Hexoskin, including GPX data.

Tictrac tracks all your activities in one place to let you discover what makes you tick.

Dashbook is one screen that simplifies your life.

HumanAPI lets you easily and securely stream human health data.

Open.Sen.se lets devices, applications and even humans to simply post what's happening to them, what they are feeling.

MAKEACHAMP helps amateur athletes raise money to finance their training and competitions worldwide.

BodyHype Apparel makes Hexoskin compatible undershirts with custom designs for team sports.

SportRFID and reelyActive have partnered with Hexoskin to capture on multiple video cameras the beauty of extreme and expression-based sports. The team at reelyActive installed their long range RFID sensors in our offices and made this awesome "live" team dashboard: logintolife.at/hexoskin (yes, you can see who's there and who's alive :)

Frequently Asked Questions

Send your questions to: contact@hexoskin.com

Q: Do you need an iPhone to record my training data?

A: No smart phone required. Hexoskin can record up to 157 hours of data without the need to be connected to any device.

Q: Can I wash my Hexoskin shirt in the washing machine?

A: Yes, use cold water, set to gentle cycle, and line dry.

Q: How do I pay for international shipping?

A: If you forgot to pay for international shipping when you originally contributed, just use the overall contribution option “CONTRIBUTE NOW” to pay the shipping. Please contribute $25 more for international shipping (outside the US and Canada). If you forgot to pay for international shipping we will remind you by email.

story:
Bodh Gaya, India is the most magical place I have ever known. It is a small town surrounded by dry, rocky mountains that overlook clay and thatch villages, a pair of elephants, and some of the most happy and sincere people I have ever encountered. Part of what makes this place so special is the temple at the city center, which hugs a descendent of the original Bodhi Tree under which Siddhartha Gautama Buddha attained enlightenment over 2,000 years ago.

Bodh Gaya is located in the state of Bihar, which is the Indian state most notorious for the bulk of its population in the lowest demographic sector.  This year is expected to be especially hard on the town’s locals, as many of their shops and small vendors have been displaced by the Bihar government as a result of the bombing that happened last July. There is a legitimate fear of starvation among many of the people who live in the Gaya district.

Rarely do we find the opportunity to directly and effectively help communities in dire need across the world from us. I am writing to ask for your support in doing just this by funding a distribution of staple food ingredients to a small Indian town that is very close to my heart. In mid-October, I am returning to Bodh Gaya, a place where I have spent over a year of my life. I am in a unique position to do this work, as I have made strong connections to community members working in humanitarian capacities. Once in Bodh Gaya, I will work with these locals to orchestrate a food distribution. With their help I will buy, portion, and distribute rice, lentils, chapatti flour, mustard oil, and wool blankets: staples that will make an enormous difference in the lives of individuals living in poverty.

My goal is to raise 2,000 USD to fund the purchase of these bulk food ingredients that I will distribute in Bihar. This amount will feed 300 people in need for one month.  The more we raise, the more people we can feed. Please consider making a donation to the Bodhi Food Fund. Even a few cents will make a difference, as it takes less than $1 a day to feed one individual.

As a further incentive, donations of 20 dollars or more will receive a special gift from India! This could be your own Bodhi tree seed with starter kit instructions, traditional chai tea with a recipe, or handicrafts made by the people of Bodh Gaya.

THANK YOU!

Love, 

Camille

story:
Disaster Relief: 

Typhoon Yolanda 

  • Was a super typhoon that struck my wife's hometown of Kananga, Leyte this past weekend. The typhoon killed thousands of people, wiped out airports, hospitals, and homes. This storm destroyed the house that my wife's family lives in and left them without electricity, water, food, and shelter. The roof was completely ripped off while they were huddled inside. They are currently living in a house without a roof, windows, and doors. They are running low on water and food. Services like the Red Cross have been unable to do little to help at this point. It is important to me to help them get through this terrible disaster. With your donation, you can help them purchase basic supplies to get through this horrible time.

What We Need

  • We were asked to set a goal of how much we hope to raise, but the truth is no amount of money could fix the damage that this storm has done. Any amount no matter how big or small will help in ways you could  never imagine. You can also send a check if you prefer. We are asking for money because there is no way to get supplies sent over at this time due to the damage.
  • I can personally vouch that every single dime will get into their hands and be used for the purpose it is intended for.
  • Whether we reach our goal or not, the money we receive will be used and appreciated. Ehm has a father, mother, brother, three sisters, and a niece and nephew.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you simply cannot contribute, there are other ways you can still help. Please help us get the word by sharing this campaign with as many people as you can.

story:
Dreams of a cancer survivor

My name is Alexis, at the age of 20 i developed a rare liver cancer, fibrolamellar hepatoma. Professor Ramos removed the 6 x 11 cm tumor from my body but unfortunately this was not the end of my journey with cancer. The cancer had already spread, and I received chemotherapy for 8 years, following a surgery to remove my left ovary as I had 3 tumors attached. Unfortunately, last year Dr Gobetz discovered a tumor on my right ovary. My ovary was saved, but is very under active, and the chance of having a gorgeous child one day without egg retrieval NOW, is next to nothing.

At the age of 29, I am now in remission. My dream is to one day have a beautiful baby that I can bring into this world. Dr Gobetz, a specialist at Vitalabs will need to perform the egg retrieval operation (IVF)  within the next month.

The operation as well as medication will come to a grand total of about $20000. I do not have this available to me, and I believe this will be my only chance of a successful egg retrieval, allowing me the gift of one day becoming a mother.

story:
Short Summary

An Israeli company, G Stim, presents new Lipido last capsules and orgasmic cream based on natural ingredients that increases sexual potency and improves sexual functioning in both male and female. 

G Stim capsules and cream were developed in order to contribute and offer optimal solution for sexual activity. The products were approved  by clinical investigation for safety and efficacy.

The capsules are anti oxidants and safe. They increase erection.

The Orgasmic cream for women is very safe and very easy to use in addition to its nice smell.

Both products are fully effective without any side effect.

The male have to take 1-2 capsules one hour before sex.

The female needs to rub her thumb slowly and gently in to her  love canal.

G Stim team has fixed research and development and is preparing currently for manufacturing of the products, and need to find financing resources  to be able to produce commercial amount. 

For this purpose the company has decided to start the crowed funding process .

Testimonials of females declaring “No more fake orgasm”.


What We Need & What You Get

The sum we need is $5000 USD, as we have fixed R&D and we are seeking financial support for mass production that allows us to go into the market.  

as a reward and as a sign of our appreciation for your contribution by your generous donations to our project, we have several perks :

$5: Thanks You

$10: Post Card Thanks!

$15: One product for men

$15: One product for women

$25: Pack of both products.

$50: Five products for your choice.

$100: 11 products for your choice.

$200: One dozen of packs (24 products).

$500: Become a certified re-seller and get 60 products.


Risks & Challenges

we have passed the crucial part of R&D and we are in a state of almost no risk, as we have also prototypes and observation results that guarantee safety and efficacy.

Testimonials

Rita: I'm single and don't have a partner right now, so I tried this on myself. It worked for me. it isn't magic, but in some way it made me feel more in the mood. It was like I was "awake" down there- more sensitive than usual. After my hysterectomy (uterus) and oophorectomy (ovaries), my hormonal system went through a series of changes that left me feeling frustrated. This cream has returned my enjoyment and it's very natural feeling Testimonial.
Murad Zaher: Don't want to disclose personal details, but honestly it really works and quick. Very easy and convenient to take, I love (my wife does more) the hard erections. G Stim capsules bring me back to my teenager days. 
I am hooked!!!
  • the only challenge we are facing is raising the needed money for mass production.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the means to donate? Want to help in another way? That`s great! There are several options for you:

  • Follow us on Twitter.
  • Like us on Facebook.
  • Show someone our video on YouTube Channel.
  • Share this link on social media or email.
  • Tell your friends, co-workers, that woman ow man who would like this product!


Thanks for taking time to learn about our project and we hope you will consider making a donation!

An Israeli company, G Stim, presents new Lipido last capsules and orgasmic cream based on natural ingredients that increases sexual potency and improves sexual functioning in both male and female. 
G Stim capsules and cream were developed in order to contribute and offer optimal solution for sexual activity. The products were approved  by clinical investigation for safety and efficacy.
The capsules are anti oxidants and safe. They increase erection.
The Orgasmic cream for women is very safe and very easy to use in addition to its nice smell.
Both products are fully effective without any side effect.
The male have to take 1-2 capsules one hour before sex.
The female needs to rub her thumb slowly and gently in to her  love canal.
G Stim team has fixed research and development and is preparing currently for manufacturing of the products, and need to find financing resources  to be able to produce commercial amount. 
For this purpose the company has decided to start the crowed funding process .

story:
My Story

My name is Chelene, I am 23 years old, and have just been diagnosed with T Cell Lymphoma for the second time in 2 years. The first time I was diagnosed with stage 3 T Cell Lymphoma, was in July 2010.

I became severely sick and was hospitalized. After 16 days of grueling test, exams, blood work, the doctors discovered I had T Cell Lymphoma. During the next 4 months I received 6 rounds of chemo therapy, and Neupogen shots. The combination of these treatments was absolutely devastating to my body and the aftermath left me with Neuropathy, which is nerve damage that affects my arms and legs. I finally went into remission in November of 2010.

Now my T Cell Lymphoma cancer is back and my doctors have no stage to label my cancer, the doctors are taking an aggressive approach to treatment. I currently undergoing treatment and have begun on May 14th, consisiting of chemotherpy, injections, blood work, and scans, following by a stem cell transplant that will be held at Usc.

With the reaccurance of my cancer along with the neuropathy, my working hours depleted and I am currently unable to work due to my condition, and undering going treatment.

 

The Impact

Before my first treatments, my doctors recommended that I harvest and freeze my eggs. I choose not to. This time it was highly recommend to harvest and freeze my eggs, seeing on how my body will not produce any after this. With the gerouse help, support, and sponcers, I was able to havrvest and freeze a small number of eggs, better than none :)

After being independent and out on my own, I have had to move back in with my parents. Both my parents are hard working, blue collar, people who struggle financially every month, just like most of us do. My first round with cancer drained what little savings my parents had and now I am faced with, God only knows what kind of medical debt will come.

 

What I Am Asking

As of right now I am still receiving phone calls and letters daily and weekly from debt collectors, still not knowing how to pay them, or the on coming debt. My goal is to raise $5,000. The money that I will be receiving from all of you wonderful and generous people will be used to help pay for my chemo, bone marrow transplant, medication, picc line, injections, lab testing, scan testing, co-pays, and gas to and from my treatments.

I would like to say thank you to all of those who have helped and who are helping. A few dollars might not seem like much, but those few dollars could pay for another injection, or test that is needed, and is more of a blessing than you know. I would also like to say thank you to everyone for all of your love, support, prayers, wishes, and thoughts, they are more appreciated than you know!!! :D

 

P.S. CANCER SUCKS!!!

story:
Short Summary

Alex Martinez is a loving husband to his wife Nicole and loving friend to many in his life.  Never a day goes by where he is not trying to put a smile on other’s faces, help them when they are in need, or just being a great overall person.  He is also a professional photographer and has worked with many couples around Colorado to capture everything from their family portraits to weddings. 

On September 15, 2012, Alex was involved in a propane fire at his apartment that left 3rd degree burns on 25% of his body, mostly burning his hands, arms, legs, and feet.  Currently in the Burn Ward at University Hospital in Aurora, Colorado, doctors and nurses are working every day to help manage the pain and recovery from the horrific burns.

His recovery from this accident is going to be long, with many unforeseen challenges ahead, and this fund is created to help even in a small way with those challenges.  As he and his wife Nicole head down this long path, we want to make sure they are able to do so without worrying about the small things and are able to focus on his recovery, therapy, and new life changes.

What They Need

Alex and his wife Nicole have a long road of recovery and coping ahead of them, and on this path, we want to make sure they are taken care of as they focus on Alex’s recovery from this accident.  This fund has been established to help with the financial burden that has and will come from this accident, bringing the community together to help someone who has impacted so many.

The money will be directly deposited into a special account at First Bank of Colorado setup under Alex’s name.  The money will be used by Alex and Nicole to help manage their life after the burn, specifically as Alex starts to adjust to everyday living with the new scars on his body.

With a goal of $1000, we know we can help, even if in a small way, as Alex and his wife make this journey together.  Every contribution will make a big impact in Alex’s recovery, taking some of the burden of life off he and his wife as they work together through the physical and emotional scars.

No matter if we reach our goal, or if we exceed it, the money will be there for Alex and Nicole to use on this long journey.  Thank you all for your help and compassion in this.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute financially, but want to help out somehow. 

Currently, Alex is recovering at the University Hospital burn ward in Aurora, Colorado.  Alex loves visitors, and is able to accept them most hours of the day as long as he is not in surgery.  If you would like to visit Alex, he would love to see or meet you.

To make sure the time you are planning is acceptable, please contact the hospital at (720) 848-0000 (ask for the Burn Ward Nurses), and confirm he is able to accept visitors.

story:
PLEASE HELP ME

  

September 6. 2012

  

Hi, my name is Deborah Slocum I am an innocent victim of a drunk driver. 

My accident occurred in June, 1984 and I am still having medical problems with my throat that need to be addressed. 

For the past 28 years I have had 90 plus surgeries and it is still ongoing.  My most serious injury was a crushed larynx and vocal cord damage.  I have traveled all over the USA to receive care at USF in Tampa, Baylor College of Medicine in Houston TX, Tulane University and Hospital in New Orleans. LA and the Institute for Laryngeal Surgery & Voice Rehabilitation along with Harvard Medical School and Massachusetts General Hospital.

My throat is so complicated not everyone will even touch it, not even my ENT here.  I have complications with scar tissue and need to have another tracheal resection done.  This time they will use a section of aorta (which does not develop scar tissue) to help rebuild my throat so I can breathe easier and take the stress off my heart and lungs and help my body to function a bit easier.   My throat now is only 3cm, equivalent to that of an infant, not a 58 year old woman.

We now need your financial help to pay for the costs of my upcoming trips to Boston which includes co-pays, airfare, hotel stays, taxis, food etc.   If there is any way you can assist me, please, please find it in your heart to help with contributions. 

 Sincerely,

 

 Deborah A. Slocum

story:
Dear Friends! Vova Ivanov was diagnosed with the disease everyone fears and hates the most…… After 5 months of different health symptoms and listening to numerous reasons why he cannot go to a hospital (no insurance, no money, he'll be ok, etc.), Alina, Vova's wife, dragged her husband to the ER and within the three weeks of ER visits, painful shots, drugs, IVs, CAT scans, MRIs, cystoscopies, and unbearable pain, Vova was diagnosed with bladder cancer.

After all the family tears and agony, Vova is ready to fight for his life! Vova already had two surgeries and now he has to have 2 months of chemotherapy and went through a 10 hour surgery to remove his bladder and lymph nodes.

Luckily for the family, Evanston Hospital is providing free care, but the crisis is far from over. 

After this surgery he can’t walk for a month in order for everything to heal. Obviously, Vova cannot work. Family friends are helping as much as they can, but we need more help.

Ivanov family has two small kids.  The family has to pay rent, buy food and pay for Vova's care.  

Every dollar counts.  Please help as much or as little as you can.  Thank you and God bless you all.

story:
Our Story

Blue Ridge Treks is a new therapeutic partnership between Clinical Social Workers Alex Hersey and Joe Early II.  Based in Asheville, NC and utilizing natural resources of the Pisgah National Forest and the Blue Ridge Parkway, Blue Ridge Trek's mission is to provide a clinical liaison between traditional outpatient therapy and wilderness therapy.  Joe and Alex believe in developing a strong sense of self, strong relationships with others, health and connection with nature.  To this end, Blue Ridge Treks will provide weekly individual and family therapy sessions, weekly wellness hikes in the Asheville area, and monthly overnight backpacking treks.


The Impact

Individual - Individual clients will have the opportunity to spend 18 days in wilderness settings through our backpacking trips, covering 75 miles and summiting at least seven 6,000 foot peaks, including the highest peak in the Eastern United States.  Additionally, they will have the chance to hike at least 100 miles along the Blue Ridge Parkway on our weekly wellness hikes. These outdoor components serve to enhance self-growth, relationships and communication worked on during weekly therapy sessions.


Families - In addition to family therapy sessions, which will focus on communication and problem-solving skills, Blue Ridge Treks hopes to introduce wilderness experiences as a means to create positive family experiences. Our hopes are to impact families through increased positive communication and experiences.


Community - The community within and surrounding Asheville will benefit from monthly service days led by founders Alex and Joe.  Youth will be introduced to various service opportunities in the community as well as learning Leave No Trace principals on outdoor excursions.


What We Need & What You Get

What we need...we plan on using these funds to purchase backpacks, sleeping bags and pads, water filtration systems and other necessary gear for backpacking treks.  We will work with a locally owned outfitter in procuring our gear to benefit the local economy as much as possible. We will also use these funds to purchase a 16 passenger van to transport youth to and from wellness hikes and treks.  We believe by providing gear and transportation we will widen the circle of youth who can participate in our programs.  Any funds not immediately spent on gear or transportation will go towards scholarships for trekkers.  If we do not reach our goal, Alex and Joe will continue fundraising as well as using business profits to meet Blue Ridge Treks' needs.


What you get...we have some great designs from Hamilton Creations that will be put on first edition bumper stickers, t-shirts, water bottles and sweatshirts for your much-needed donations.

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE encourage your like-minded friends and colleagues to Like us on Facebook, sign up for our email list and be in touch with any possible referrals!

story:
Our Vision    

We believe in a world in which people don't have to worry about how to obtain water or whether it will make them sick. What would your life be like if you had to worry about this every day? 1.1 billion people around the world do. The facts don't have to read like this, however. We have a more positive outcome in mind: Reducing water shortages and water-related disease burdens by conducting targeted, community-health interventions.

Please donate to our current project, which aims to improve the water supply in Belen, an impoverished community of Iquitos, Peru. Thanks in advance for your interest and support!

Our Story 

We are four first-year medical students from Penn State College of Medicine: Sara Abu-Tabikh, Derek Reighard, Jenny Rice, and Hannah Ross-Suits. We are continuing the research and community activism that last year’s Iquitos group started (http://www.indiegogo.com/waterforiquitos?a=126306). 

This year, we’ll be working exclusively in the Belen Municipality of Iquitos, Peru, investigating water use, hygiene practices, and traditional medicine for treating gastrointestinal illness, in addition to training community health workers in oral rehydration therapy.

We will spend several weeks conducting surveys, analyzing water sources and stool samples for various contaminants, and talking to locals about their health practices and concerns. We will be training Iquitos-based health promoters as advocates of oral rehydration therapy. At the conclusion of our project, we will present the data to Peruvian health officials -- as well as to Penn State's Global Health Office -- and they will use that data to implement broader initiatives.

We are all incredibly excited to be traveling to Iquitos this summer. To get to know us better, click on our individual tabs below or check out our blog!  http://waterforiquitos.blogspot.com/

The Impact   

Poor sanitation can lead to a wide variety of diseases that cause significant morbidity and mortality. Giardia, Cryptosporidium, and roundworm are some examples of diseases that thrive in areas of poor sanitation and can cause serious harm or even death to their victims. Each of these diseases occurs or has occurred in or around Belen.

In the Belen Municipality of Iquitos, Peru, many people do not have access to running water or clean, treated water. Many must obtain their water from nearby rivers, which may or may not be contaminated with the diseases mentioned above. The inhabitants in all of these communities face significant barriers to obtaining one of the most fundamental human needs: potable water.

It is our goal to assess household water collection, sanitation infrastructure, and hygiene practices. We will then implement an intervention to help encourage oral rehydration therapy and slow gastrointestinal disease rates seen in these regions.

This project will serve as a tremendous learning opportunity for the whole team, fostering compassion for those in underserved areas and developing leadership skills and team-building as we work together toward a common goal. We firmly believe that there exists real potential to provide the people of Belen with the clean drinking water they deserve.

It is our sincere hope that our efforts in Belen will (1) help to educate other medical students about the many implications of water in society, (2) result in a friendly alliance between Penn State College of Medicine and Belen/Iquitos community members, and (3) pave the way for future health interventions in Belen and throughout the Iquitos region.

What We Need 

As we are medical students, we must rely on grants and donations in order to make our travels possible. Each team member will require a roundtrip flight to Iquitos (about $900 each). While in Iquitos, we will need to account for daily expenses: housing ($500 total for 4 weeks), food ($100 each), and transport ($50 each). That makes for a grand total of $4700 (yikes!). Good news: we've already been awarded a small travel grant from The Kienle Center for the Humanities at Penn State, so we are seeking to help cover at least $2,600.  

Every dollar helps! If you are in a position to give, please consider contributing to our cause. Thank you in advance for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help 

Spread the news to your family, friends, and coworkers!

If anyone has expertise in water engineering or sustainable water development in Latin America (or elsewhere!) and has advice, don't hesitate to post it on our comments section, or simply send us a message! We'd love to hear from you. With this collaborative effort, we can make this project an incredible success!

It is our sincere hope that our efforts in Belen will (1) help to educate other medical students about the many implications of water in society, (2) result in a friendly alliance between Penn State College of Medicine and Belen/Iquitos community members, and (3) pave the way for future health interventions in Belen and throughout the Iquitos region.
What We Need  
As we are medical students, we must rely on grants and donations in order to make our travels possible. Each team member will require a roundtrip flight to Iquitos (about $900 each). While in Iquitos, we will need to account for daily expenses: housing ($500 total for 4 weeks), food ($100 each), and transport ($50 each). That makes for a grand total of $4700 (yikes!). Good news: we've already been awarded a small travel grant from The Kienle Center for the Humanities at Penn State, so we are seeking to help cover at least $2,600.  
Every dollar helps! If you are in a position to give, please consider contributing to our cause. Thank you in advance for your support!
Other Ways You Can Help 
Spread the news to your family, friends, and coworkers!
If anyone has expertise in water engineering or sustainable water development in Latin America (or elsewhere!) and has advice, don't hesitate to post it on our comments section, or simply send us a message! We'd love to hear from you. With this collaborative effort, we can make this project an incredible success!

story:
Yoga for Senior Citizens

I have been supporting myself teaching yoga in the St Helena community for 12 years. Finding a space to rent  that I can afford has always been a challenge. Several years ago, I was asked by Grace Episcopal Church to teach my yoga classes there. They have a beautiful, large room to accomodate a lot of students. I have always practiced Karma Yoga, and every month the class picks a charity of their choice to donate a percentage of the months revenue to. 

Last year, the vestry comittee increased the rent I was paying for the room by over 300% from $20 to $75. In addition, the vestry required me to become sponsored by a non-profit orginazation to fullfill their by laws. This means I now have to pay the non profit each month as well as  Grace. The amount of money I receive each month is based on the number of class cards sold, not the actual attendance. To cover this rent increase, the obligation to the non profit, and my monthly expenses means i need to sell 30 cards a month. I average 10-15 cards a month, last month was 9. For the past year, one patron has been helping to cover the additional cost. This is not available for this year, so I am hoping many people can give a little instead of one person giving a tremendous amount.

I also found out last year, when I offered classes to senior citizens at a reduced cost, that even paying a small amount on a  fixed income was difficult for them. I know Yoga will help seniors to feel better and increase their quality of movement, and life.

With this campaign, the rent for the room at Grace will be covered for one year, I can continue to support myself teaching yoga, and I can offer classes to St. Helena senior citizens for free.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I need $5,200.

The rent for the room to teach yoga is $75/ day and I teach 2 classes a week $150 week x 52 weeks a year = $7,800. 

I will pay rent of $25 / class - $50/ week x 52 weeks/ year= $2,600.

By contributing to this campaign, you will be providing free classes to senior citizens on a fixed income, get yoga classes for yourself and audio cd's of my yoga classes to put on your ipod and have yoga on-the-go! Also, private yoga instruction via web cam.

Any and all amounts funded to this campaign will go to rent the room to teach yoga. If I receive more than the $5,200, it will go towards next years rent.

I have always charged reasonable rates for my yoga classes so students can attend often, and benefit from an ongoing practice. By recieving assistance with the rent cost, I can continue to provide yoga classes for everyone to afford, and to be able to support myself.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute, please spread the word about this campaign by telling friends and family, post on social media, and refer to the campaign website.

I so appreciate and am so grateful for wheatever you can do!

story:
In order to keep within the Indiegogo terms and conditions we have removed the Raffle ticket perk options and replaced these with a donation option for the time being.    The Raffle is now being run on our Pharo Facebook Page here:  https://www.facebook.com/pharosugaring

We at Pharo Beauty have a Salon/Therapist in Australia who has a very sick child with a rare condition.  Sarah from Sarah's Smart Nails has a 2 year old son with PVT (more about what PVT is exactly below).  When Lachy is sick, Sarah's must close her business and look after Lachy, which normally means being admitted to hospital and/or travelling across Australia to be seen by experts across the country. 

We have been touched by the fortitude and positivity of Sarah for her son and family.  We want to support Sarah by contributing some great prizes where ALL the funds (minus indiegogo fee, total going to Lachy $4625) will be given to Sarah to assist with Lachy's family needs.

Help us raise at least $5000 for Sarah and Lachy. In return you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win very cool prizes! Any donation, big or small, is greatly appreciated!

EVERYONE that donates $50 WILL receive a FREE Radiessence Light Tan Bronzer with Retractable Brush worth $23.13 (w/s price). All donators will receive the Bronzer however it is limited to one (1) Bronzer per Sponsor.

EVERYONE that donates $100 WILL receive a set of 4 Natural Glow Lip Glosses worth $62.50 (w/s price).   All donators will receive the set however it is limited to one (1) set of Natural Glow Lip Glosses per Sponsor.

 In order to reach our goal of $5,000 we only need 100 participants donating $50.00 .... How simple is that? We believe the goal is achievable with YOUR help.



Lachy has blood clot in his portal vein, there are two veins that take the most of blood to your liver one of those is the portal vein.

The biggest issue with the PVT is that it causes portal hypertension. Basically because the blood has to go somewhere and it can't go through the portal vein it backs up into smaller veins. The pressure in those smaller veins around the intestines, stomach, esophagus etc is much greater than it should be (portal hypertension).

What can happen?...the biggest risk with portal vein hypertension is internal bleeding which is what Lachy had in June 2012. The veins that have lots of blood in them aren't meant to have that much pressure on then and they can explode at anytime. If this happens that is when he vomits and Poos black tarry blood

The surgery we hope to get Lachy is called Rex shunt its to take part of his jugular vein and make a bypass around the blood clot Lachy only has one vein that they MIGHT be able to try do the bypass with as the other one is too small. This is as much as we know at the moment we are waiting on a scan called a venogram this will tell the Doctors if they might be able to perform Rex on Lachy.

Please keep him in your thoughts Sarah update's this page as she receive's information:  https://www.facebook.com/LivingLifeFightingPvtPhLachysJourney/info

story:
Hi Shannan here ........

For the new year i would like to smile again. As long as i can remember  I have had problems with my teeth and have scared to go to the dentist. 2014 is my year to over come my fears and  get my smile back. I am still young and have two daughters i would like to enjoy life with them . I am embarrassed  to be seen out in public and i don't do a lot of things  outside my home . I am living on a fixed income and don't have a lot of money after rent and bills . This is my big goal for 2014 and  all your help with  this  is  so appreciated !


About 6 months ago I did go to the dentist to get a tooth pulled due to pain and they said  that the  rest had to go as well and gave me  a price sheet with everything  that had to be done. I just looked at it and cried. It was  a little over 3 grand.  thats where you can help me out. I plan on video blogging everything  and you can follow me there to see where i am in the process.

The impact on my life with be huge. I would not be in pain and i could eat anything I would like but best of all I could be out and about with my girls and not be embarrassed anymore..

Thank you for taking the time to read this if you can't help money wise You still can by getting my story out there. Or if you know of a dentist that is willing to work with me  that would be great too.

Happy New Year,

Shannan Martin

Sacramento, Ca

story:
Lucas was born on March 3, 2012 with a port wine stain covering the right side of his face, from his forehead, covering his right eye down to his mouth. For the first 8 months, he was developing quite normally.

On Christmas Day 2012, just nine months of age, Lucas had his first seizure. He was rushed by ambulance to Sick Kids Hospital where a team of doctors and nurses attended to him and were able to control his seizure, which at that point had been ongoing for over an hour. Lucas was hospitalized for 24 hours. Two days after being discharged, Lucas experienced another prolonged seizure episode that returned us back to the emergency room.

We immediately noticed visible set backs in Lucas' development. He lost functional usage of the right side of his body, reduced vision in his right eye and decreased responsiveness. 

To help control his seizures, Lucas was placed on anti-seizure medication which the doctors informed us he would have to be on for the rest of his life.  

In April 2013, Lucas started experiencing stroke-like episodes, where he would lose total usage of the right side of his body. He was placed on a low dose of Aspirin to manage this, in addition to his seizure medication.

In June 2013, Lucas began suffering from another type of seizure that could not be controlled by the meds he was currently on. He was once again rushed to Sick Kids for a battery of tests. An EEG confirmed that Lucas was experiencing this new type of seizure and was put on new medication in addition to his current medication.

His medication dosage has been increasing on a weekly basis, as his seizures are yet to be controlled. As a result, Lucas has fallen many times and suffered from bruises, cuts and black eyes which have compromised his safety. 

In addition to his seizures, Lucas faces another difficult challenge of developing glaucoma throughout his life. Currently, he has developed right homonymous hemianopia, which further impacts his balance and safety.

Lucas can have up to 9 appointments in a given month with various medical specialists. However, he is currently on several waitlists for many healthcare services that are essential for his development. The costs associated with these services and the time off required from work has resulted in lost income and has taken a toll on his parents.

In February 2013, we were informed that Lucas had been accepted into a wonderful program at Centennial Infant and Child Centre (CICC) that provides all the therapeutic services he needs under one roof.

While CICC is a non-profit charitable organization and fundraises in order to help bring the cost down, the tuition fee for the 2013 - 2014 school year equates to $5750 not including the $4500 fee for transportation or afternoon daycare costs. Extended health benefits do not pay for this type of program. We have explored other funding sources but unfortunately Lucas does not qualify for these or any government based subsidized childcare. Lucas' parents are challenged financially to be able to afford this program for their son – a program that has shown to have great results. His parents, have been on an emotional roller coaster with Lucas’ health. We are seeking your assistance to obtain funding to make an immediate impact in Lucas’ development. At this time any support is greatly appreciated.

Lucas is an incredible little boy that manages to make us smile and laugh each day. Please consider supporting our nephew in his development. 

Thank you,

 

Lucas' Aunties

story:
My name is Christy Connelly and I am posting this fundraiser in an effort to help my dear friends, the Dunn family.  Any contributions will be greatly appreciated and will help them with the high medical expenses accumulated (and will continue to accumulate) in caring for their beautiful 6 month old daughter, Lilyana.

 Lilyana was born with one functioning kidney. Her other kidney is non functioning and is Multicystic Dysplastic. Lilyana was diagnosed as having Grade 4 Reflux which causes recurrent urinary tract infections (UTI). She was diagnosed with her first UTI at 7 weeks old. The Doctors recommended surgery to correct the Reflux to keep her one functioning kidney from becoming damaged by the recurrent infections.  If her kidney were to become scarred, it could result in long term renal illness (which could lead to the need for a kidney transplant). They decided to proceed with the surgery after Lilyana spent 9 days in the hospital for a nasty UTI that was only treatable by IV antibiotics .  As hard as it is to see your 2 month old infant go into open surgery, they wanted their sweet baby to enjoy life symptom free and to keep her one functioning kidney healthy.

 The surgery did not go off without a hitch. The stent that was placed in her ureter did not function properly, and this caused Lilyana to go into "apparent renal failure" within 24 hours of her surgery. The Doctors performed an emergency surgery to drain her kidney, and they had to place a nephrostomy tube in her kidney to save her life. The nephrostomy tube stayed in her kidney for about a month and a half. Immediately after they completed the surgery, they found that her red blood cells had fallen dangerously low, and she needed an emergency blood transfusion. The family then spent another 7 days in the hospital for Lilyana to recover well enough to come home. When she was released from the hospital the nephrostomy tube was still in place.  Several weeks later Lilyana had another surgery to remove the stent. The neprostomy tube was finally removed several weeks later.  We all held high hopes that the infections were behind Lilyana and that she was on the road to live a more normal babyhood.

 Not the case. Lilyana continues to have recurrent UTIs and is still undergoing tests. The doctors are not sure what the cause is. Her  doctors are watching an abnormality in the anatomy of Lilyana’s ureter that was found in surgery. We pray this "abnormality" will not require further surgeries and procedures but we won't know for a few more months. Her multicystic kidney will be monitored as well. The hope for the multicystic kidney is that it will shrink and go away on it's own without causing any problems. The other possibility is the multicystic kidney can grow and may need to be removed surgically.

 The Dunn family may need to travel for health care in another city if her condition does not improve.Mom has not left Lilyana’s side and she has not been able to go back to work. Daycare is not an option because of Lilyana’s condition.

 The Dunns will do whatever it takes to get Lilyana healthy. She is a happy baby despite everything she has been through. Her smiles will touch the most distant of hearts. She is loved more than words can say.

 Thank you for reading her story. The Dunns are grateful for your caring and generosity. They strive to be positive and know Lilyana will continue to thrive no matter what obstacles may be thrown their way.

story:
Sports Training Using Cloud Computing™

                                (Smart Sports  Devices That Think™):  


Cloud Computing for Sports Training™ invented this new field in Science and Technology after years of research and development.

We have developed easy to use sports training technologies and real smart sports training devices based on cloud computing. 


We have a patent (US7789742) with other mulitple patents pending.

 We create and combine smart cloud sports training™, smart sports devices™, super smart sensors™, computer intelligence, and customized self adapting systems and smart social matching™ and smart social sports training™ and smart sports training media™ together in a ubiquitous smart packages.


1)  Super Smart Sports Controller™  or Real Smart Golf/Sports AKA Genius Multiplayer™ Sensor Based Training and Competition System™

The Technologies

It’s the ultimate Cloud Based Sports Training Device.

It’s also a small attachable powerful sports training device that’s totally self contained.

It uses one or more super smart sensors™.

Combined with software/hardware it  becomes  an hi-tech cost effective sports  teacher to learn your specific game no matter the sport.

The system immediately helps you master faster than any other method in the world your sports movement in real-time using visual (2 and 3 dimensional images) and auditory cues (sound, voice and  or music) and stores your personalized sports training and playing technique data on the Cloud.

It’s  an easy to attach (plug and play) electronics (for your golf club, tennis racket, baseball bat, football, soccer ball, basketball, or any sports apparatus) with a multisensing systems that wirelessly connects to the Cloud to play against a Real Human Being and or an animation for Single and Multiplayer modes anytime, anyplace 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

Our technologies use Wireless USB, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and Wireless HDMI.  


       Wireless USB Electronics For PC's of Super Smart Sports Controller


You can use it as a Beyond Virtual Sports  Controller™.

Now you can learn and master your favorite sport at home, in your backyard, or outside on the field of play.

The Super Smart Sports Controller™ wirelessly (USB, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and  HDMI) connects actual golf equipment and other sports equipment with a computer, tablet, smart phone, smart digital television and the cloud to allow players remotely located anywhere in the world, from one another to play a competitive simulated game of golf or real game of golf or any other sport.

An individual athlete may opt to play solo or practice to improve basic golfing techniques and or other sports techniques in real-time.

Your  Computer, Smart Phone, Tablet, and Smart Digital Television displays player information and visually simulates and controls a golf game between two or more players, via the Cloud, having similar equipment and remotely located from each other.

Standard golf clubs, tennis rackets, basketballs, baseball bats, chess pieces, boxing gloves, soccer balls, etc may be easily attached/ retrofitted with the sensors and associated circuitry to convert such clubs into "super smart clubs™" and "super smart sports devices™" for use with our powerful system.

The Super Smart Sports Controller™ is Multiple Innovations combined into One (1):

1)  It’s a Super Smart Communications Device™ For Sports

2)  It’s Super Smart Computerized Device™  For Sports 

3)  It’s a Super Smart Multiple Wireless Protocol Device™  For Sports
