Questions and Answers For  Super Smart Sports Controller™

Q. Why are we ready to manufacture our Super Smart Sports Controller™ now? 

A. With the huge proliferation of Tablets , Smart Phones and Smart Digital Televisions, our Real Smart Sports Devices™ can now be priced to make it affordable to all consumers worldwide. 

 Q. Why do Golf Clubs, Tennis Rackets, Baseball Bats, Basketballs, Soccer Balls, Pool Sticks, Hockey Sticks, etc have to be DUMB (No Cloud Technology)? 

A.  We created our Super Smart Sports Controller™ which made all of these sports devices Real Smart with Computerized  Cloud  Intelligence™ for Single and Multiplayer Sports Play Improvement and Competition.. 

Q. Does the Super Smart Sports Controller™ require batteries? 

A. Yes two double AA batteries. 


Q. Does the Super Smart Sports Controller™ requires a Personal Computer? 

A. Yes. It works with all Personal Computers via a wireless USB connection.

 
Q. Does the Super Smart Sports Controller™ work with Tablets, Smart Phones and Digital Televisions? 

A. Yes. Currently under development are versions for Google's Android, Apples IPhone  and Microsoft's Smart Phones and Tablets. 

Another version is under development for smart digital televisions.

Q. Is the Super Smart Sports Controller™ easy to use? 

A. Yes it is. You easily attach it (plug and play), and simply turn it on and swing the club for putting and driving a real golf ball.  For other sports you follow the same exact procedure.


Q. Are there any other Apps for the Super Smart Sports Controller™ beside Golf?

 A. Yes. Currently under development are Apps for Basketball, Baseball, Tennis, Chess, Boxing, Soccer, Football, Hockey, Exercise, etc. 

Q. What type of Sports Graphics should I expect? 

A. The Super Smart Sports Controller™ uses one or more sensing technologies such as a Force Sensing Resistance and or a Accelerometer to provide Real Smart Sports Graphics™  that give an athlete a complete visual image of each and every stroke.  

The visual image combined with auditory cues shows your specific weakness and strengths of your hitting strokes and how to improve them.

Q. Can I store my daily information of sports practice or play on my digital device and or the Cloud? 

A. Yes you can.  Your individual playing trends can be highlighted and stored for future comparisons day to day, week to week, month to month, and year to year on the cloud. 

Q. What makes Super Smart Sports Controller™ different than other sports training and technologies? 

A. Other sports like technologies  require a dumb controllers and are just games whether they are hands free or not which means they are One Hundred (100%) Virtual Systems.

Our Super Smart Sports Controller™ uses a Real Smart Engine™ which is Beyond Virtual™. 

You play the Sports for Real! Your play Real Golf, Real Baseball, Real Soccer, etc.

For sports training and or athletic improvement you can use our  real  smart custom golf club™ or your own golf club with our attachable Super Smart Sports Controller™. 

Q. Does the Super Smart Sports Controller™ work on Facebook? 

A. Our engineers are currently working on a special app for Facebook users. 


Q. What other operating systems does the Super Smart Sports Controller™ work on? 

A. Our Super Smart Sports Controller™ is operating system independent.


Q. Do I add the shipping fees to the Pledge amount or is it charged later? 

A. No. Please do not add the shipping fee to your Pledge.

Where we're at?

-We've been researching and testing our Super Smart Controller™ for years. 

-Perfecting the Sports Training Technologies For the Cloud.

-With your support, we can bring Real Smart Sports Devices to athletes worldwide in 2014. While we're close to entering production, your contribution will help fund:

-Production tooling from a variety of US based companies who makes our custom sensors, accelerometers and  electronics.

-Reducing the size of the electronics (miniaturize)

-Produce Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, Wireless HDMI, and Cellular Versions of these Cloud Technologies.

-Software development of other Apps besides Golf and Interactive Smart Website

-Software development for Smart Cloud Database™

- Large component order

Wireless Week. — The folks who made it possible to play golf over the Internet are planning a new game. Internet Golf Multimedia Inc. here hopes to launch next year the Java-based Internet Sports Computer (ISC), which will handle both golf and  interactive sports that "volley" by recording and relaying the players' muscle contractions in real-time.


The company's original smart golf club, the Genius, enabled opponents to remotely play golf against each other on a PC by measuring their real-world performance in hitting a real ball. The ISC, by contrast, will be a freestanding,  wireless unit that expands beyond golf to a more generic format capable of representing a variety of one-on-one games — basketball, tennis, racket ball or even a one-on-one baseball variant that is illegal everywhere except cyberspace.

On the other hand, the Internet Sports Computer includes the hardware for real-time transmission of motion information in games where both players are acting simultaneously-such as tennis volleys. Sophisticated motion analysis routines are being put into a custom chip, said the company, to animate a figure on the screen. The animated figure can be used to pinpoint problems with the movements in a swing.

Where the Genius golf club uses PC software along with a couple of ASICs and an RF transceiver, the freestanding ISC has an embedded microprocessor. The smart club (or a smart racket) will communicate with the belt-pack-mounted ISC, which in turn uses a wireless communications strategy to access the Internet.

For the future, the ISC will supplement its  golf putter with a new driver model and a new line of wireless tennis rackets, baseball bats, basketballs and other smart sports gear. Because each device is wireless, the clubs, rackets and bats can be taken outdoors, Murdock pointed out.

"Eventually we hope to mediate not just one-to-one  contests, but contests among thousands of different players worldwide," said Murdock.

Questions and Answers For  Super Smart Sports Controller™

A. With the huge proliferation of

Cloud  Intelligence™ for Single
and Multiplayer Sports Play Improvement and Competition.. 
Q.
Does the Super Smart Sports Controller™ require batteries?  
A. Yes two double AA
batteries. 

Q. Does the Super Smart Sports Controller™ requires a Personal Computer?  
A. Yes. It works with all Personal
Computers via a wireless USB connection.
 
Q. Does the Super Smart Sports Controller™ work with Tablets, Smart Phones and
Digital Televisions?  
A. Yes. Currently under development
are versions for Google's Android, Apples IPhone  and Microsoft's Smart Phones and Tablets. 
Another version is under development
for smart digital televisions.
Q.
Is the Super Smart Sports Controller™ easy to use?  
A. Yes it is. You easily attach it (plug and play),
and simply turn it on and swing the club for putting and driving a real golf ball.  For other sports
you follow the same exact procedure. 

Q. Are there any other Apps for the Super Smart Sports Controller™ beside Golf?

 A. Yes. Currently under
development are Apps for Basketball, Baseball, Tennis, Chess, Boxing, Soccer,
Football, Hockey, Exercise, etc.  
Q. What type of Sports Graphics should I expect?  
A.
The Super Smart Sports Controller™ uses one or more sensing technologies such
as a Force Sensing Resistance and or a Accelerometer to provide Real Smart Sports
Graphics™  that give an athlete a complete visual image of each and every stroke.  The visual image combined with auditory cues
shows your specific weakness and strengths of your hitting strokes and how to
improve them.
Q. Can I store my daily information
of sports practice or play on my digital device and or the Cloud?  
A.
Yes you can.  Your individual playing
trends can be highlighted and stored for future comparisons day to day, week to
week, month to month, and year to year on the cloud. 
Q. What makes Super Smart Sports Controller™
different than other sports training and technologies?  
A.
Other sports like technologies  require a dumb
controllers and are just games whether
they are hands free or not which means
they are One Hundred (100%) Virtual Systems. 
Our
Super Smart Sports Controller™ uses a Real Smart Engine™ which is Beyond
Virtual™. You play the Sports for Real! Your play Real Golf, Real Baseball, Real Soccer, etc.For sports training and or athletic
improvement you can use our  real  smart custom golf club™ or your own golf club
with our attachable Super Smart Sports Controller™. 
Q. Does the Super Smart Sports Controller™
work on Facebook? 
A. Our engineers are currently
working on a special app for Facebook users. 

Q. What other operating systems does the Super Smart Sports Controller™ work on? 

A. Our Super Smart Sports Controller™ is
operating system independent.

Q. Do I add the shipping fees to the Pledge amount or is it charged
later?  
A. No. Please do not add the
shipping fee to your Pledge.

Giving Back By Creating
Hi-Tech Jobs
With your
support, our Real Smart Game Technologies will be made in completely in the
United States and create many jobs in this tough economy nationwide.
Later we want to license these cloud
technologies globally! Our central goal is to create many manufacturing and support jobs.
Who we are?
We
are a special group of young and middle age visionaries, dedicated, hardworking
and passionate Graduate Students, Senior Engineers, and Seasoned Business
People. Wireless Week. — The folks who
made it possible to play golf over the Internet are planning a new game.
Internet Golf Multimedia Inc. here hopes to launch next year the Java-based
Internet Sports Computer (ISC), which will handle both golf and  interactive sports that
"volley" by recording and relaying the players' muscle contractions
in real-time.The company's original smart golf club, the
Genius, enabled opponents to remotely play golf against each other on a PC by
measuring their real-world performance in hitting a real ball. The ISC, by
contrast, will be a freestanding,  wireless unit that expands
beyond golf to a more generic format capable of representing a variety of
one-on-one games — basketball, tennis, racket ball or even a one-on-one
baseball variant that is illegal everywhere except cyberspace.
On the other hand, the Internet Sports Computer
includes the hardware for real-time transmission of motion information in games
where both players are acting simultaneously-such as tennis volleys.
Sophisticated motion analysis routines are being put into a custom chip, said
the company, to animate a figure on the screen. The animated figure can be used
to pinpoint problems with the movements in a swing.
Where the Genius golf club uses PC software
along with a couple of ASICs and an RF transceiver, the freestanding ISC has an
embedded microprocessor. The smart club (or a smart racket) will communicate
with the belt-pack-mounted ISC, which in turn uses a wireless communications
strategy to access the Internet.
For the future, the ISC will supplement
its  golf
putter with
a new driver model and a new line of wireless tennis rackets, baseball bats,
basketballs and other smart sports gear. Because each device is wireless, the
clubs, rackets and bats can be taken outdoors, Murdock pointed out.
"Eventually we hope to mediate not just
one-to-one  contests, but contests among
thousands of different players worldwide," said Murdock.
